rogve life gvzman de alfarache written spanish matheo aleman seruant catholike maiestie borne sevill london printed edward blount 1623 al illvstre sennor ivan estrangwayes espeio de la virtvd nobleza cauallero titulado gentilhombre de la camara de su serenissima magesdad de la gran bretan̄a sen̄or mio querido encomendarmi picaro á la protecion de los reyes principe porque demas que conuienen tale persona à sus magesdades grandezas hecho particulares leyes muy rigorosas pragmaticas seueras contra los que lo hazen ni tampoco los consejeros de estado porque aunque à caso los tengan se siruen ni gustan dellos si por su proprio interes ò razon de estado los iuezes menos porque son enemigos mortales de la pobreza de los que tienen dinero pero à vuestra sen̄oria si aunque sin reçelo por amor de los grillos çien açotes bien pagados siendo vuestra sen̄oria gouernador principal en su tierra vno de los corregidores de loçanos picaros yo se muy bien que vuestra sen̄oria puede echar mano à mi picaro agarrarle para lleuarle à la carcel detenerle en ella yo confiesso que era todo quanto malo se puede dezir arrojado desuanecido inconsiderado descuydado confuso desordenado indiscreto era reboltoso amigo de nouedades tenia sutilezas inuenciones engan̄os era importuno porfiado semejante al nauio que anda dando bordes en la ribera nunca acaba de tomar puerto era como vna pared que cada momento estaua para desmoronarse caer en tierra tenia firmeza en su voluntad tomaua resolucion en lo que auia de hazer sabia refrenar sus passiones hinchosele la cabeça de viento desuaneçio en embelecos dan consejo à los otros sabiendo los tomar para si donde llegò à triste fortuna suerte lazeria mezquindad de sarrapamiento estrema miseria necessidad en fin à la galeras con todo esso como los picaros tienen entrada en la casas de sen̄ores desconfio que este nin̄o de la piedra serà bien recebido de vuestra sen̄oria en toda verdad deue estimarse en mucho porque aunque habla mucho pero sin sustancia se puede dezir ser todo hoja tener fruto que nuestro picaro e gran charlatan que tiene muchas palabras en ellas poco de que echar mano que sea de consideracion tira à do hitos por diuersos caminos dando à entender vna cosa con sus palabras haziendo lo contrario en sus obras hallarà vuestra sen̄oria como dizen entre col col lechuga variedad de cosas para entretener recrear para que no enfademos tratando siempre vna cosa trayendo tanta variedad de razones quantas colores tiene vn pintor e como elecho yerua sin tallo sin flor sin simiente la rasuras que salen de la pieças de açofar quando se tornean en si valen poco quando la recogen hazen bulto pero echadas à derretir se bueluen en muy poco tale son la palabras vanas de los charlatanes habladores que si los apurais tienen poca sustancia pero este picaro e holgaçan que esta papando viento como los fuelles grande e el prouecho la vtilidad ganancia que del se saca estremado e en sus dichos donayres comprehende encierra muchas moralidades vnas dentro de otras e muy graçioso e como dizen vna sal diran algunos que e todo intricado confuso maldigesto reuefado mienten ante todo al contrario por el hilo se saca el ouillo por la muestra principio de vna cosa se conoçe lo demas della que natural fuerça de entendimiento como da en el blanco como tira à punteria tira como otros à tiento à troche moche de donde diere si con orden buen concierto aduertiendo à todos que ensucien sus manos en cosas viles ni hagan cosa fea indecente si que se recojan que paren obedescan al freno de la razon mi picaro e hombre de bien e de aquellos vellacos de madrid que pregonan vino venden vinagre de los que prometen cosas buenas altas despues son ordinarias friuolas digo ma sino que engolfado en vn negocio muy dificultoso perdone vuestra sen̄oria pude menos quales la cadenas quales la ataduras de e labones nigeridos vnos en otros son la importunidad de los amigo la propria promesa estando desta manera empen̄ado fue menester para satisfazer con mi obligacion auiendome engargantado el pie en el estriuo pude tan facilmente sacarlo yo puesto la faldas en cinta para passar mi carrera se mi poco valor flaqueza que alo menos si errado tropeçado pero si vuestra sen̄oria serum seruido de tenerla por buena suficiente que hecho mi deuer sin falta fealdad el torneo serum malo teniendo padrino tan noble para abonarme el que buelue la palabras conceptos de vna lengua en otra à menester tener fidelidad prudencia sagacidad ygual noticia de ambas lenguas lo que en ellas se dize por alusiones terminos metaforicos mirar lo que en esta otra lengua se puede corresponder muchos vierten la ma vezes peruierten el picaro esta trasladado plega à dios que di mi mano sea mal tradado traducido si si traslucido bien esta el picaro de aleman ha mudado su vestido su traje e al modo de espan̄a si de inglaterra si yo le puesto en su punto ser muy venturoso soy guarde dios de mala noche parir hija ay tal desconsuelo en el mundo como trabajar mucho en vn negocio alcabo suceder como se deseaua en algunos lugares hallo mi guzmanico escuro como la noche pero yo hecho algunos escolios para quitar los escollos espero buen puerto pero si à caso se em braueçe la mar de maldiçion si la ola creçen con la espuma de los deslenguados si este mi pobre vaxel tiene fuerça para contrastar la tempestades amenazadas desnudare arrojare con impetu furia en la mar dexandole à la inclemencia destos toruellinos espiritus turbulentos confiando que vuestra sen̄oria dara la mano para sacarme fuera de vn abismo tan peligroso sufriendo se anegue perezca en la mar ahogandose en ella vno que e tan aficionado à vuestra senoria como diego puede—ser de santa maria magdalena francisco de roias marqvesse de poza lord hovse de moncon president councell de hazienda maiestie court belonging therevnto thing world wont amongst men cause greatest feare know may greater equall compare euill intention secret ill meaning much truely much shall bee deepely rooted obscure bloud humble birth base mindes vsually forcible lesse corrigible one like vnto hunter taking vp close standing shadowed ouer boughes lye wait destruction euen haue receiued death wound neuer awhit neerer discouering whence hurt came basilisk view first poyson loseth force much lesse preiudice gaine hand v getting kinde dominion ouer v bring v danger vtter vndoing scandall commonwealth promoting knaues innocence executioner vertue wisedome man power preuaile able guard selfe kinde men whose subtill gin trap tending death person liues secure mine owne part haue euer afraid beast fierce hurtfull euer especially present occasion wherein large field laid open vnto wherein may sow seed venome calumniating mee least reprochfull attribute ouerbold rashheaded fellow presume offer powerful prince poore gift considering boldnesse first grew necessitie whereinto feare put mee city weakely fortified meanely mannd small force defence haue much greater need braue worthy captaines maintaine resisting furious violence sharpe assault enemy like manner needfull helpe selfe make vse lordship protection much splendour glory made manifest world view three part vertue blood power whereof true noblenesse composed peculiar propertie belonging thereunto fauour protect sacred place withdraw themselues thither better safety rest secure vnder shadow lordship protection rely much vpon noble disposition stretching wing accustomed clemency booke shall vnder chicken vnder hen wing remaine free shall seeke wrong together therewith obtaine happinesse making great selfe little admitting poore picaro become courtier shall giue none worke greatnesse excellencie shall make lordship appeare whose long happy life desired man matheo aleman uulgar new thing though perhaps thee see thou vertuehating vulgar many bad friend thou hast little thou deseruest lesse thou vnderstandest behold biting enuious couetous thou art quick defaming slowe honoring certain ill vncertaine good facile fly hard bee curbed diamond hard thy sharpe teeth doe grind powder vertue scape free thy venemous tongue piety doe thy action protect defect doth thy cloake couer treacle doe thy eye behold doe like basilsske impoyson flower though neuer cordiall euer entred thorow thy eares hiue thy heart thou didst conuert poyson sanctitie hast thou calumniated innocencie hast thou persecuted singlenesse heart hast thou condemned iustice hast thou confounded truth hast thou profaned greene field hast thou set thy foot thou hast defiled thy filthy luxury possible paint forth life true fashion hell torment thereof thou onely iudgement mightst truely perfectest counterfet thinkest thou peraduenture passion blindeth mee anger moueth ignorance violently thrust verily thou couldst capable seeing thy owne errour suffer thy selfe informed onely turning thy head aside thou shouldst finde thy action aeternized euen adam reproued thou thy selfe art already condemned ala amendment may bee expected inveterated canker happy vnclue himselfe labyrinth vnseaze himselfe thy griping talon fled confused court •… hou followedst poore village withdrew selfe solitarie shade thou madest shot drewst thy venemous shaft mee neuer letting alone still vexing pursuing bring vnder thy rigid iurisdiction tyrannicall empire well assured protection carry mee correct thy crooked disposition giue respect good manner thou owest noble qualitie confidence thereof get free thy arresting hand thou despising goodnesse ciuilitie thing neuer yet came within reach thy better consideration hast rashly vnaduisedly bitten many illustrious worthy person extolling wit though idle accusing others lightnesse defaming third lye falsehood thou art mu campestris fieldmouse better thou art still nibbling hard rinde sowre vnsauourie melon thou commest sweet wholesome fitter nourishment thy stomake fals loathing thou canst feede without surfetting thou imitatest importunate troublesome eareoffending fly vntuneable buzzing scarabee dwelling sweeter sort flower flyes forth delicate garden pleasant wood settle cowesheard fall vpon dunghill like noysome place thou doest make stay vpon high morality diuiner wit onely contentst thy selfe dogge said foxe answered cleaues close vnto thee thou hast read remaineth still thee hauing made thine owne neuer againe forgotten vnfortunate foxe thou must likened one must like reuiled persecuted like vnprofitable mischieuous member commonwealth inioy priuiledge thy honour freedome thy flattery though thou wouldst inrich wealth thy praise commendation wicked men shame dishonour rather desire reprehension good end doe like vnto themselues thy depraued estimation cannot bee bad thou takest much libertie vnto thee thou art vnbridled beast headstrong iade occasion matter bee offered vnto thee thou runnst away thou kickst flingst thou tramplest men good name vnder thy feete thou breakest bound modestie tearest piece stand thy way whatsoeuer else shall seeme good vnto thee faire flower thou scornefully treadest vnder thy feete crowne temple vertuous giue fragrant odoriferous smell nostril noble deadly razourwounding slash thy sharpe tuskes mortall stroke made thy hand shall heale man discreet vnder whose warme shade shall happily bee defended stormes tempest thy blustring malice discreet reader vsuall troubled sleepe sad melancholy dreames striue strongly imagination without beeing otherwise moued awakened come themselues remaine broken tyred wrestled tugged hand hand braue fierce bull one world doe finde selfe getting former proeme mind still beating vpon barbarisme disequall number ignorant dolt whose censure submitted selfe faring therein thrust himselfe voluntary exile hauing power afterwards owne hand reuerse banishment ingage selfe promise compose booke inforced hold honest word must confesse made false vie set vp rest iest driuen see earnest word bindes player know full well considering rudenesse wit shortnesse study beene fit feare carreere make libertie licence mine needed might well haue beene spared considering selfe booke bad good may drawne may possible wherein wit wanting zeale profit others may supply defect working vertuous effect happinesse light vpon shall bee sufficient reward greater paine make boldnesse •… worthy pardon shall need discreet vse long proemes prolixe circumlocution neither eloquence word vainely worke force speech dotingly perswade iust doth felicitie consist procuring fauourable censure remit selfe correction craue helping hand vphold weakenesse put selfe wholly vnder faire protection thou reader art desirous profit hereby thou wilt truely consider wrote booke common good eye thou wilt conceit hath beene done therein haply performed priuate interest vndertaken ostentation wit neuer much pretend could finde sufficient worth put selfe vpon wing vaine flight perhaps say hauing like vnto waterman turnd backe eye contrarie way looke one way rowe another direct little barke mine haue desire land vpon mine honest word hee deceiued thinketh sole purpose guide prow publike good might worthy obtaine great blessing labour might serue good vse thou shalt finde many thing cleane wrought like painter first colour laid carelesse hand slubberd ouer omitto polish flourish ouer cause gaue hinderance therevnto others somewhat refined better shadowed willingly auoid follow loth finish full fearefull carefull committing vnaduised errour vnconceiued offence others boldly vnmasked laid open discouery worthy drawne without vayle fit presented publike view haue much say vnto thee desire •… e yet may tell thee haue written vnto thee yet haue left much would haue written reade becomes thee reade doe scoffe fable shall receiue intertainment thy hand accept line giue thee minde wherewith offered vnto thee doe cast dust sweeping house vpon dunghill obliuion consider may filing paring price rake gather heape come conuenient quantitie put crisole thy consideration giue fire spirit assure thee thou shalt extract gold wherewithall inrich thy selfe arrowes mine owne quiuer honey set thee mine owne hiue much sweetnesse sucke holy learned men merchantable ware wellconditioned recommend vnto thee goodthing doth proceed hand god thing bad whereof glory doth result diuine maiestie hauing part euery thing imbrace giue friendly reception may profitable thee reiecting otherwise whatsoeuer else bad meerely mine albeit confident thing cannot hurt wont many time doe much good discourse thou maist moralize thing shall bee offered vnto thee thou hast large margent left thee doe thou shalt find lesse graue discomposed present selfe person picaro rogue subiect booke thing many sport thy selfe iest play wagge afterwards shake hand great feast must haue meat mouthes dish taste pleasant sweet wine must cheere heart helpe digestion musicke please delight eares vale amice declaration better vnderstanding booke hauing written poetical history purpose haue printed one volume discourse whereof doubt might cleared diuided might offer themselues appeared seeming iust thing remoue inconuenience beeing might easily done word purpose bee presupposed guzman de alfarache picaro hauing study come good latinist rhetorician grecian shall deliuer vnto first part hee returned italy spaine went forward study purpose professe state religion make himselfe churchman reason often relapsing vice left course spent yeeres therein himselfe writeth owne life aboord gallies hee remained put oare fault hee committed hauing beene famous thiefe notorious offender shall see large second part improprietie beyond present purpose first part shall set tract doctrine rather seemeth agreeable vnto reason present vnto man cleere vnderstanding holpen learning punished time making benefit idle time hee gallies likewise see many ignorant poore soules sentenced death spend remainder time thinking soules health diuert thought worldly thing make short offence disordinate action licentious desire commit whose merited exemplary chastisemen expressed categoricall strong tearmes argument ex contrario wit reward fortunate success shall follow liuing vprightly spending time well shall course life apply himselfe certaine determined end make himselfe opposite antipode inconstant figure insuing discourse wherein admirable order good obseruations hunting hare till killd beene well bred stead falling hunting fell gnawing bone found way giuing v vnderstand infallible demonstration knowne danger wherein child stand childhood trayned vp without obedience good education parent without curbe rush careere youth vpon vnbridled horse irrationall vntamed appetite carry away headlong precipitate thousand inconueniences dashing themselues vpon many rock till one bone left vnbroken one limme left vnrent life good likewise sheweth vnto v man lesse subiect like misfortune destitute noble science speciall misterie groundes hope vpon vntilled doctrine nature schoole without exercising talent imploying wit without putting himselfe profession hauing experimented arte inclineable vsurpeth office quite contrary owne inclination omitting none hee imbraceth attempting make triall losing himselfe time pretending inconstancie vnsettled disposition seeme idle man notwithstanding idle put sickle another man corne venter vpon profession belongs vnto sleepeth take ease leades retired life treasurer matheo aleman hath also well defended himselfe like obiections iust occupation life wherein busied himselfe doth teach v well thereby booke finding therein opposite historie pretendeth imply bred vp tender yeeres studie humane learning could challenge keeping learning need call account spent idle howers metaphor takē magistrate successours doe take account thing haue passed •… ime residence office pedir residencia residencie idlenes much lesse historie hath thrust himselfe another man profession properly owne annexed study desire write withdrewe distracted thought honourable intertainment maiesties paper time contador wherein albeit sufficient exercising office yet seemeth hee haled thereunto violence returned afterwards former exercise continuation whereof watchfull indeuours hath formed booke v mixing sweet harmony delight profit horace requireth inuiting v pleasure instructing v grauity taking scope publick good reward common benefit young men shall finde obligation haue parent good lawfull education haue drawne darkenes ignorance shewing northstarre ought guide confused sea troublesome life long idle short well occupied shall point good manner vnfitting reader child bookes learning shewe themselues vnthankefull master throughly esteeming iust zeale shall saue rigorous censure fault must ineuitable contradiction diuersitie opinion thing wondred rather naturall cannot auoyded certaine man cannot write hee shall please whosoeuer indeuour goe take nature greatest miracle doe knowe greater beauty either placed diuersitie whence proceed many diuerse opinion diuers formes men face rest say world one man one taste ad gvzmanvm de alfarache vincentij spinelli epigramma qvis te tanta loqui docuit guzmanule quis te spinellus stercore submersum duxit ad astra modò musca modò et lautas epulas et putrida tangis vlcera iam trepidas frigore iam que cales iura doces suprema petis medicamine curas dulcibus et nugis seria mixta doces dum carpis que alios alios virtutibus auges consulis ipse omnes consulis ipse tibi iam sacrae sophiae virides amplecteris vmbras transis ad obscoenos sordibus indè iocos e modò diuitijs plenus modò paupere cultu tristibus et miseris dulce leuamen ade sic speciem humanae vitae sic praefero solus guzman prospera complectens aspera cuncta ferens hac aleman variè picta veste decorat lege desertum tu que disertus eris gvzman▪ de alfarache vpon owne life borne without parent cradle haue sowne seed might inable good youth chose uico fort father whose stepdame fortune quickly inslaue trauels study found eftsoone formes change moone building ruind quite like pillar onely stand sight others forewarne course runne lest like selfe chance vndone story life lius againe obliuions pit dead remaine whose blurrs faire letter writ time shall triumph ouer vnhewne piece wood long haue beene knotty rugged rinded vp sinne polisht neat workemans hand altar set memoriall stand lesson others liues leade mine owne misfortune reade hernando de soto author two great thing see wise booke contained notable knaue yet author subiect graue discerne others harmes men may learne owne fault tamend shape course good end likewise may know loue goodnesse must owe teach none learnd man ti common voice good either side choice picaro honour gaines aleman immortall remaines gvzmanvm dalfarachia nobilem erronem et praedonem publicum à clariss rei que militaris expertiss duce diego puedeser captum vinculis constrictum nec sine ouatione britannias perductum este procul elegi nihil hîc dolente dignum vocem premant epica non hîc celebratur hero fl •… bili nil opus lyrâ facilis hîc prostat uenus sed nec tubâ mantuana bella canuntur bellula grande nimis reboantes davum dedecent cothurni nec iamb turbet furor hilares lyaei iocos multo que minùs loripes fugitiuum dic scazon quale iam dic metri genus nobilis guzmane praedo te tuos que more sonet expertes legis ordinis nam marini dei uitijs nunc irritatus leo fremis nunc remulcens caudam canis adularis colubrinâ saepe linguâ immane quiddam sibilas saepè sophi meditantis pendulâ seuerus togâ uitae praedicas maeandros uafer sic et fallis omnes et teipsum multiformis vt stupore plenum fuat quibus hamis catenis illigauit versipellem et hoc monstrum cicurauit uoce qui donat anglicâ aureis catenis nempe quibus vinciuntur aures nempe circeo poculo tumidos quod sopit angues nempe thracis plectro lyrae quae sequaces reddit vrsas hisce comprensus artibus retrò manibus revinctis curru host cantillana giuen eate yong mule misfortune befell said guzman good vpon way quarrell host chap vii man misfortune discoursed purpose haue story told god ancienter time guzman thought thiefe apprehended afterwards knowne hee set liberty one clergyman promiseth tell v story entertaine time withall vpon way chap viii wherein guzman de alfarache relateth story two louers ozmin daraxa argvment ferdinand isabell king queene spaine tooke baca citie moore wherein daraxa beautifull noble damozel taken prisoner queene isabell brought seuill left custodie luys de padilla ozmin yong gentleman well descended inamoured lady hee suffered long sicknesse imprisonment faire daraxa went said citie together diuers accident happened table chapter matter contained second booke chap guzman de alfarache going caçalla towards madrid proues quality condition miserable man vpon occasion grauely discourseth effect want shame castle ayre came serue host wicked disposition kinde men chap ii guzman de alfarache leauing host went begging madrid comming thither set himselfe learne play rogue beare basket way discourseth hunger beggery honour hurteth soule chap iii guzman de alfarache go discourse vaine honour way offer vnto man consideration manner person ought beare himselfe office gouerne himselfe high place wherevnto called chap iv guzman de alfarache deliuereth learned witty discourse conceiued himselfe uanity honour touching way vpon uices seru •… nts▪ shopkeeper notary proctor iudges artificer apothecary physician lawyer chap v guzman de alfarache lighted cooke seruice faire sentence good lesson sheweth serueth blameth gaming gamesters declareth pretty theft performed relateth vice despenseros cooke butler like officer lord abused seruants king miserable condition opposite party continually crossed one another whereunto may adde sollicitation woman worst aduocates least importunate suitor put together leaue thorne sting finger dare touch vpon thou man malediction thou doest presse hard thou doest weary tyre purpose bout onely giue thee best satisfaction answer thy replyes proceed infinitum neuer make end waight vpon thy sophistry friuolous question therefore doe tell thee thou shootest randome speakest non sequiturs like thing wherein thou canst preuaile thou wouldst make thy part good much truth thereof otherwise already determined yet suite goe thus giue occasion much mislike offence remedy must bee contented thing sometimes bee possibly auoided god deliuer thee iudge qui habet legem scrinio pectoris interpreteth law hee listeth himselfe owne conceit shall leade hauing neither text doctor side make good hee doth notarie thine enemy kinde creature bribed falsifie order profit register thing otherwise reported court case thou wilt giuen speake like wise man thine owne discretion iudgement whether thou hast said sufficient proue father vndoubtedly faulty besides receiued opinion physician vsing complexion like slibberslabbers kinde infirmitie sicknesse painting selfe say whether father sound curling pate crisping haires greater dishonesty vnseemelier sight doe commend allow permit spaine saw mine owne eye time knew clad one beene much made heretofore began conceiued pitie trouble take compassion asking matter sad told hapned vnto inne scarce made end tale brake forth youle laughing ready burst breake forth choller face mine pale ash set fire coales anger kindled brest cock stood vpon owne dunghill scarce mine owne man also found selfe disarmed desart selfe held tongue said nothing vnto could crowe would discretion dissemble man cannot helpe patiently brooking rather grinning laughing end doubtfull obtaining must throughly first consulted reduced certain ground principle opinion various honour vitreous glassy subiect breaking time haue misbehaued selfe happely would haue laid hold first aduenturing gaine vpon might haue runne hazzard certainty losing competition thing auoided cannot auoided must need haue let equal rather two thy superiours thy inferiours haue care thou doe ouermatch thy selfe strong thee lest trample vpon thee tread thee vnder foot euery thing hath vice must account giuen although forbeare yet heated warmth choller yet boyled within could choose tell friend doe see coated foole fooles cap head else occasion thus laugh rather increasing ceasing laughter beene taske put vpon description laughter part beene enioyned play fast came gaping mouth fistwide let head fall tone side hee able laughing hold vpright laying hand hard able one vpon belly another side feare bursting scarce able sit vpon beast falling seemed extreme straining himselfe would euery bout haue come tumbled downe ground answere three foure time could neuer come doe sooner offered speake vnto presently fell fresh laughing till chuckt againe pot runne ouer fell boyling god thanked yet last great invndation sudden breaking forth water ouerflowings tagus could greater began fall little little patch piece word word well could hauing taken little breath deliuering minde halfes like one stumble go go stumble blunderd forth word vnto good youth doe laugh ill successe doe misfortune glad whit laugh hapned woman scarce two houres since happely meet two young fellowes camerades walkt along together seemed habit souldiers one clad medley greene suite gray ashcolourd cloth white doublet cease comming vnto gentleman saw thorow well physician still continue visit got vp one morning early went church physician came visit found home asked seruant whither gone like foole seruants still inow master hurt profit told gone forth masse church nimble doctor putting spurres mule make haste went speed said church searching last found said vnto agods name sir doe meane commit great excesse go abroad without leaue gentleman knew well inough came seeing need put hand pocket tooke purse drew foorth crowne putting hand told take master doctor faith gentleman perceiue sacred place cannot priuiledge see farre couetousnesse foolish physician carry farre vertue quicke noble disposition gentleman betooke beast fetching rise got vp vpon backe away vve went together wee scarce gone furlong place met two churchman sate hard expecting passenger would carry horsebacke towards caçalla dwelling beene seuill certaine suit law carriage countenance might well know good life pouertie well spoken men kind courteous one 36 yeeres age aboue fifty made carrier stay agreed done got vp vpon asse wee proceeded iourney great laughter honest man excessiue beyond measure could scarce go tale betwixt euery word would let go sluce side whilest like flood furiously breakes foorth laughing suddenly flush vpon house men vittaile vpon way man shall meet many time bare couple hen onely amongst fiue hundred person see want good cheere make vp good mirth man laughter threefold discourse farre spleene outtalke tongue delayes many speares side euery deferring farther prouoking vpon thornes hath longing desire know thing vvould willingly haue one word come treading heeles another quicke nimble pace come possible huddling mouth neuer woman hath beene child euer earnestly long thing know successe businesse mee thought consume pine away vvas held suspence could haue burst anger eares vvere put hauing present hearing could expect great matter must arise glorious ingenious fabricke made show began conceit vvith selfe whether fire falne heauen consumed house therein whether young fellowes set house fire rosted hostesse aliue least lesser reuenge could taken ofso vile creature whether stript starke naked hung vp heeles vpon oliuetree giuen thousand lash till left dead lesser thing laughter could promise howbeit must confesse beene wise considerate haue beene ought haue excessiue laughter condemned lookt great matter presume good thing could proceed one thus immoderate laughter euen moderate doth kind manner accuse man lightnesse argue indiscretion want iudgement store vanity vvhich discomposed reason compasse though neuer much occasion offered marke madman onely note absolute asse complete foole last god thanked mountaine brought foorth mouse conclusion told v thousand stop iumpes wonted bound curuets laughing hauing stayd drinke little iest put vpon ho •… esse two young fellowes wine tarry comming companion left behind perceiued hostesse house brought plate froyze sixe egges three starke naught bad set going diuide froyze tansey twaine seemed vnto made certaine kind resistance refusing parted one piece hanging like torne ragges taile another whereupon seemed somewhat bad signe vvell like began search little narrowly vvhat cause thereof vvere long discouering truth might discern certaine knob knurs bin body self might first sight haue seen world went vvhere fault lay young lad easily haue swallowed gudgeon good manner haue slightly past ouer vvere little curious courtlike sifted finely found seeming three little round bump like three little chicken head clotted together cleared doubt finding bils pretty fooles somewhat hard growne none tendrest pad lay straw vvas presently perceiued taking one betweene finger going crush breake piece put foorth bill began though dead peepe foorth head spake alowd vnto told plainely vvhence vvas couered plate clapping another thereupon vvhispered somewhat secret amongst themselues vvhat vvas knew howbeit afterwards manifest selfe presently one called sayd hostesse haue thing else v little sight bought sabalo knowne fish sauoury called sabalo quasi sapalo à sapore latine call alofa frista clupea fresh water doth v •… ally dye rondelecio de piscibus lib 〈◊〉 cap 15 sabalo vvhich fish like shad put vpon ground rub scale telling haue fish vvhereof vvill shall spare slice two meat haue none euill rellish man scarce fasten vpon teeth hee told see sir flesh hath newly killd want time mortifying making tender hereupon companion taking q quoth lack mortifying hanging ayre eate tender short inough make gentleman squeamish hath fed cradle spicebuns sugarcakes fresh egges meates saue hard teeth stomake shrunke vp shoulder held peace one knew full well another kinde world one dayes patience danger vnderstanding kinde language longer could herewith rest contented still mee thought meat ill smatch know thinking thereon presently came minde vnnecessary oathes mine host made night vowd swore began prettily well flesht forget mother teat noynted aloe wormewood like bitter stuffe thing doe like whereunto beene formerly accustomed said que delos ingratos estaua lleno el infierno hell full thing ready might champe vpon strawe make end prouender put helping hand needfull rubbing forehead eares well able whilst busied laid cloke vpon bench hard like quicksiluer fire smoake winde vanisht away instant could neuer set eye could deuise world become thought selfe either mine host consort make themselues merry therewith hid iest iesting matter beganne sweare good earnest knew become made diligent search euen gate shut yet opened body house selues mine host therefore thought impossible lost might peraduenture forget selfe haue put apart place hereupon sought vp downe house going hall kitchen hap come backcourt found great plash fresh bloud hard mule skinne fairely stretcht full breadth length fect yet cut eares large part head towards forehead neere whereunto bone belonging head onely tongue braines wanting sooner perceiued presently confirmed doubt hereupon streight goe forth call companion made show hide bound breakefast supper said vnto thinke sir thing trow sugarcakes newlaid egges comparison eate home veale forsooth extolled sky host promised prouide v dainty cheere thinke supper breakefast hath bestowed vpon v hath dealt well v pray haue beene excellently well vsed good man none coozening host cheating innekeepers sell cat cony put away mutton veale innocent man may goe vnmaskt throughout world care see lookes face honest man integer vitae sceleris que purus vnspotted life conscience free ill dealing owne integritie made bone curse hostesse euill vsage ghests strooken dumpe full wonder see showd word say head cast downe bosome went slinking away amazed strange sight day till parted company could get much vvord saue past parting take leaue came seemed bee drawne gut shall heare anon howbeit vvas euery man may imagine well pleased vvith vnhappy accident yet notwithstanding floud laughter might meanes dammed vp current thereof turnd another way wherewith euery moment heart soule ouerflowne manner quite drowned wonderfully ouerioyed misfortune vvhich much lesse grieue great share vvith vantage inough strong beliefe man mine host could possibly conuay away cloake began somewhat boldly charge vvith euer incident good cause put strength weakenesse adde courage hath right hath courage fainthearted began put home told plainely hee answere cloake stolne scornefully denies •… ering fleering earnest vvas merry make himselfe wherewith patience much mooued could hold threatned choller vvith iustice yet touch new businesse spake one word seene vvas young lad poore boy body take part began domineere ouer telling rod pocket like reproachfull word termes onely befitting coward men base condition himselfe worm turne againe trod gentlest lambes grow mad much wrongd vpon multiplying word one begetting another latter worse former last wee fell foule fewnesse yeeres weaknesse strength would giue leaue tore halfe brickbat side bench thereby threw hard euer could driue hit withall hid himselfe behind pillar thinke beaten braines beene fully reuenged wrong hee scapt hand ranne fast legges would carry chamber whence came foorth haste sword drawne hand may see manner men roaringboyes since faulty 〈◊〉 coward great gull doth seeke sword whilest fearing might follow stood vpon gard two pibblestones pluckt pauement hee saw ready hand courage began abated dare draw neerer vnto noyse outcry made vpon occasion whole inne vprore preuent notary priuate gaine euery one said businesse belong vnto whereupon grew difference oddes betweene themselues vpon contention grew second quarrell lesse fierce tumultuous side diggd vp god tender heart mercifull nature spake thus vnto iupiter man know weake kind creature framed frayle brittle matter corruptible substance soone dissolud turnd nothing therefore thinke fit holpen held vp v yeeld succour assistance possible vve could exchange fortune vvere state condition euery way equall doubt vve iust therefore make great reckoning matter doe must proceeded part verily perswaded mild gentle correction sufficient remedy present momus would faine haue spoke mind tongue itcht bee let loose hauing already entred free language would haue lasht farther beene commanded hold peace forbeare till came turne haue full hearing hee would gladly haue taken hold occasion haue incensed iupiter fairely offer selfe vnto obeying present meditated meane long oration vvhich meant make accusation wherewith thou chargest man iust gainesay contradict vengeance vvhich thou shalt take yet withall great respect beare vnto thee vtter thinke plainly shew vnto thee haue conceiued minde word free passion hope shall offence thou destroy world vaine thing thou hast therein created imperfection thee vnmake thou hast already made mend thou findest amisse much lesse vvould haue thee repent thy anew hold fit done thee thou must either giue giue freewill thou giue must necessarily manner men forefather thou giue shall men thou shalt haue created vaine great glorious frame heauen earth starres moone sunne together composition element million thing thou hast made exact manner singular perfection importeth seruice pleased take consideration remaineth one thing done set right againe without seeking remedy shall driuen vse violent rigorous proceeding preiudice clemencie thou iupiter gaust god content vvhom haue long pleased thee longer vpon thy pleasure thing heauen earth haue dependency beene wise could haue continued thankefull towards thee haue conserued themselues iustice obedience towards thee thing repugnant goodnesse thy nature iustice vphold protect inlarging thy fauours towards multiplying thy blessing vpon since haue dismerited disobedience thou oughtest sort punish fit tyrannous manner strong hand possesse great blessing offend thee thereby thou oughtest rather take god stead send downe brother discontent amongst like fauour vnto doth resemble neere man hardly discerne one meanes euer hereafter come acknowledge misery thy mercy thy happy estate owne wretched condition thy ease trouble paine thy glory thy power owne weakenesse thou shalt see cause thou maist distribute thy fauours shall deserue according thy louing kindnesse recompence euery man according thine owne good pleasure making thy benefit alike common good bad suffering men equally enioy one happinesse course taken opinion onely sufficient punishment vnto also bring due acknowledgement errour haue spoke minde shall leaue vnto thee thou mercyimbracing iupiter doe herein shall sute best thine owne good liking shall make thy seruice briefe aduice ended oration momus momus man ancient enemy venemous tongue began lay labouring exaggerate offence set forth vilest colour induced thereunto much goodnesse sake inueterated hatred euermore bare vnto mankinde notice taken passion knowne disease cause seeing remedy god must taken away stroue defend strength could make taking strong hold tugged hard desirous retaine still amongst iupiter perceiuing vvorld vvent coyle kept came downe amongst thence away heauen wherewith men broyle well pleased though thus deceiued thinking preuailed purpose obtained vvhat desired since god still amongst vvas well thought errour former time deceit yet liuing still amongst hath continued euen present age men thinke content remained stil sure inough heere vpon earth nothing onely bare raiment outward shape resemblance inioy discontent clapt cloathes thou beleeue otherwise conceiust contrary thou art vvide truth meere stranger thereunto wilt thou make plaine vnto thee marke well shall say vnto thee weigh consider thy selfe kinde manner thou thy selfe shalt deuise feast sport bankets musicks delight ioyes whatsoeuer else may moue thy inclination highest point thine owne desire suggest paint forth vnto thee life shall aske thee way whither goest thou thou wilt answere perhaps proudly feast content giue granted thou doest receiue place doth affoord thee garden fresh full flower riuers plated siluerstreames fountaines distilling drop pearle may much cheere glad thy heart suppose thou hast banketed thy selfe sweet pleasant arbour neither sunne offend thee ayre annoy thee thou didst inioy thy desire full height thou hadst sport pastime man could wish yet notwithstanding contentment absolute vvorld watred vvith sorrow though thing thou hadst distaste giuen thee hadst euery thing according thine owne mind yet thou returnest home thine house layest thee thy bed take thy rest possible thou shalt find thy selfe weary dusty sweaty haue lost thy stomake taken cold grow heauy melancholly sad peraduenture become either mad dead amidst greatest pleasure happen greatest misfortune vsually wont vnto v vesper feare horrour vesper vvhere night passeth merrily away beginning middle middle end midst thy idolatry shall bee taken thee set thy heart therefore vpon slight let goe thou didst know trust time doubt thou wilt ingenuously confesse disguise deceiue thee cloathes coozen thee maske blinde thy eyesight whereas thou didst verily thinke thou hadst content safe inough thy hand thou hadst nothing outward raiment discontent doest thou see content vpon earth true content onely heauen true content heauen therefore till thou named amongst honest men many little matter sticke sweare thee thou neuer didst neuer saw money tooke beare false witnesse thee vnlesse thou bestow wine vpon otherwise content greasing fist conclusion honest sergeant thinkes heare thee mutter speake amisse telling mee thou thy part art honest man dost exercise thy office well without abuse vnto confesse much say thou art one know thee tell friend let v speake secret betweene selues body may heare v doest thou know confesse ingenuously truth speake thy fellowes thou knowst much thou canst choose indeed talke thee quite lost clergyman shooke countrey resolution held carried place vnknowne vnto beene pinspoynt matter haue set light cast heele especially considering end must set libertie come cleare truth would last shew selfe make knowne world man took drawn along like dogges paire couple afflicted manner thou mayst imagine euer like misfortune happen vnto thee know came passe one amongst rest lookt stedfastly vpon said one whats feare mee haue taken marke amisse much haste haue run errour answered thinke hee replide doe know seeke want left thumbe youth see sound part whereupon went read requisitoria iudges warrant another padilla ozmin young gentleman well descended inamoured lady suffered long sicknesse imprisonment faire daraxa went said city together diuers accident happened soone mumbled vp prayer quickly dispatcht shut prayerbookes putting alforjas kind wallet v giuing diligent eare vnto good priest began promised history manner catholike king ferdinand donna isabella siege baça well fought side brauely defended valiantly assaulted long time knowne vvhich side better vvhere aduantage vvas like fall fortune equally spred wing albeit king force greater exceed number men yet moore likewise many vvonderfully strengthened good disposition situation city queene donna isabell remained iaen making prouision thing necessary campe king ferdinand vvent foorth person supply army hee diuided two part one planted ordinance recommending care thereof marquess cadiz aquila luys fernandez portocarrero lord palma commendadores alcantara calatrana besides captaines souldiers himselfe vvas incamped accompanied chiefe nobilitie gentry experienced men armes hedging citie euery side seemed center midst large circle two campes lay halfe league one compasse runne right passage stopt beleaguerd halfe along mountaine meanes distanced one league thereabouts could hardly succour one another agreed councell warre hauing thought fit make certaine trench castle king owne person often visit albeit moore labour meanes possible hinder designe yet christian made good worke valiantly defending vndertaken day past ouer head wherein vvere two three skirmish past betweene many side hurt slaine worke thing great importance cease vpon wrought thereon sufficient gard continually attend night day happened rodrigo hortado de mendonça adelantado caçorla sancho de castilla beeing gard king commanded make good place till condees cabra urenna marquesse astorga enter regiment certaine exploit put execution moore hath beene said watchfull seeking disturbe worke descended top mountaine 3000 foot 400 horse set vpon rodrigo de mendonça adelantado sancho began fight battell growing hot betweene moore relieued many sallied city king ferdinand present seeing thing went commanded condee de tendilla assaile side battell time grew bloody side king seeing streight wherein condee vvas hee wounded manfully fighting moore gaue order master de santiago assist force one side marquesse cadiz duke nagera comendadors calatraua françisco de bouadilla charge troopes vvhere artillery planted moore thereupon drew foorth another third squadron vvas brauely fought side vvell moore christian king himselfe conflict discouered campe armed vvith haste could vvent foorth ayde thicke vvere troopes came succour moore vnable longer make resistance betooke themselues flight christian still hauing chase making great slaughter pursuing euen suburbes citie vvhereinto many souldiers entred got rich pillage taking principall person prisoner number daraxa moorish damosell onely daughter alcalde fort beauty owne perfect one euer eye seene yeeres vvere rather shorter full seuenteene well growne bud vvas ready blowing beeing true height excellencie set downe raised much higher discretion grauity gracefull carriage spake spanish well man knowne vvould haue taken haue beene old christian might haue past amongst speake purest language king highly esteeme lady accounting iewell great price therefore sent treasure queene wife made lesse reckning receiuing graciously well owne desert worth principall ranke qualitie descended king daughter honourable person also try whether might meanes make citie yeeld without farther fight shedding bloud whereupon treated kindnesse best vsage shee could deuise farre exceeding fashion lady neerest person captiue kinswoman entertained kindest manner could greatly desiring excellent piece nature surpassing beauty possesse body soule might fowle paganisme sullied defiled sufficient reason themselues haue still sight besides content receiued talking conuersing shee able giue good account state whole country euery particular passage warres though yong tender yeeres maturer age wisest counsellor kingdom albeit king queene hapned afterwards meet baça citie rendred vp hand vpon certaine condition yet queene would neuer suffer daraxa side great affection bare vnto promising alcalde father doe many particular fauours absence much grieue loue saw catholike maiesties bare vnto somwhat lessen sorrow conceiuing much honour profit would redound vnto thereby rested himselfe contented pocketed vp griefe silence queene told would neuer without length carried along vnto seuill desire shee winne christian dispose thereunto little little vsing violent tractable meanes tooke one day aside said thus vnto thou canst time daraxa truely vnderstand well affect thee great desire haue giue thee content requitall whereof shall intreat thee sake grant one request thou wilt exchange attire thou wearest put cloathes shall inuest thee withall appertaining mine owne person weare enioy thy beauty much aduantaged habit daraxa mildly made answere shall willingly performe maiesty shall pleased command obeying herein discretion mee consideration worth weake apprehension shall day forward thinke better hold good doubtlesse cannot otherwise maiesties ornament adde grace imperfection rich dressing supply poore defect daraxa replide queene modesty make derogate selfe euer nature made perfect worke shee sumd vp thy selfe insist vpon praise sufficiently expressed graciously accept seruice willing tender make thereof vnto v daraxa apparelled spanish fashion residing certaine dayes palace till time catholike maiesties departed thence goe siege granada therefore well trouble attend warres also might take sauour thing faith queene thought fit leaue house luys de padilla man quality fauourite shee might entertaine selfe donna eluira de guzman daughter virgin giuen charge care entertainment expresse order vse respect shee want nothing might giue content albeit accordingly receiued feasted courted pleasure place could affoord yet grieued much see selfe farre natiue home besides cause gaue much discontent shee discouer vvith cheerefull countenance pleasant semblance shee made show seeing maiesties pleasure dispose shee esteeme fauour expresse lookes gesture damsell parent betrothed moorish gentleman granada whose name ozmin whose qualitie condition together disposition point sutable daraxa hee young rich sweet behauiour personable discreet aboue valiant full courage euery one part well adapted disposed receiue many fit well become besides dextrous spanish tongue hee bred vp heart casiile naturall countrey thing worthy commendation vertuous young men glory parent breed vp child knowledge tongue exercise armes loud espoused lady tendernesse louer could insomuch hee manner commit idolatry reuerence respect bare vnto would might hee suffered doe haue set vp statua vpon highest altar hee wholly imploy memory sences kept continuall watch ward owne spouse made thankefulnesse whit debtor loue equall qualitie affection truely correspond euen condition surpassing rest honest course life wherein conserued themselues sweetnesse discourse letter passed betweene louely message sent fro indeered according true desert visited seen one another often neuer treated loue mouth mouth speaking eye parled many time tongue silent neuer omitted occasion talke together many yeeres yet many young speake properly euen childhood loued visited pleasure parent knit perfect friendship child streight knot fastest loue make harmony fuller desire neerer linked possibly might strong alliance marriage taken effect manner concluded beene crost vnlucky houre rigour austere planet baça besieged vpon reuolution thing warlike commotion thought fit deferre wayting conuenient time wherein marriage might solemnized greater mirth iollitie triumph feasting performed youthfulnesse qualification required sweet louely couple seemed necessarily suit estimation greatnesse parent haue heard already daraxas father mother owne kinswoman daughter sister boabdelin king citie treated match betweene ozmin cousin german mahomet king granada surnamed little faire designes contrary successe desire fortune bent browe daraxa remaining power catholike maiesties left behind seuill soone ozmin heard exclamation made sorrowes hee vttered sigh vented true herald proclaimed heartsgriefe moue men compassion could choose share small measure saw lamentable effect great affliction losse solely wound put home heart soule sorrow seaze vpon short time tooke hold vpon manly yet delicate body whole frame thereof temper fell last grieuous sicknesse dangerous difficill cured remedy distant cause vnknowne effect whereof dayly increased mortall signes death cause increased medicine ministred vnto rightly applyed good worst malady physician truely apprehend nature disease essentiall point restoring man former state health afflicted parent despairing recouery rendred vp hope life physician giuen ouer opinion impossible hee liue iudgement strengthned confirmed accident ioyntly concurre openly expresse themselues painfull torment sicke louer treading last step life goe euen entring doores death conceit came sodainly head representing selfe imagination wrought effectually seemed draw fruit somewhat better though sicknesse yet still full danger yet compared miserable estate wherein hee stood amendment could time greater longing desire put execution conceit formerly entertained plotting imagination might come get sight beloued spouse gained breath grew somewhat stronger stoutly resisting thing might hinder intent whereupon licenced sorrowes shooke hand melancholly taking leaue bidding farewell euer wholly intend health meanes beganne degree grow better better cleane contrary expectation vvho seene low hee brought desperate estate hee true old adage desire subdueth feare trampleth neck inconueniences leuelleth difficulty way neuer steepe neuer rocky good cheerefull heart sicke man best sirrop comfortable cordiall world amber corall pearle gold rabble restoratiues nothing vnto therefore good man make himselfe merry thou seest man wax merry sicke thou maist boldly say mend time gentleman vp vpon foot though yet weake scarce able walke vp downe chamber long sicknesse hauing yet made legges vnable beare body forthwith furnished himselfe moore guide interpreter long time serued king granada intelligencer putting vp good store gold iewels iourney taking good horse browne bay petronell hanging arson saddle sword dagger girt side vpon certaine night appointed depar •… ed citie fashion habit spaniard going way knowing well coast country well acquainted part passed within view enemy campe hauing left behinde bypathes secret passage came loja neere vnto citie hard fortune meet captaine field went gathering vp men fled army forsaken colour soone spied two tooke hold moore feigned hee pasport seeking one bosome another pocket part could finde captaine perceiued beene rode way made shrewdly suspect tooke along bring backe againe campe ozmin dismayed herewith suffering alteration countenance great boldnes free la •… age making benefit nobleman name▪ whose power spouse feigned himselfe sonne stiling himselfe name rodrigo de padilla came message catholicke maiesties father touching daraxa health failing witnessed wanne lookes hee making home conuenient haste hee could otherwhiles hee affirmed lost pasport way returne againe thereinto betaken himselfe path would serue turne hee still insisted haue goe backe whilest either would vnderstand care button whether returned pretension onely gentleman ranke quality hee pretended himselfe haue blinded eye dubblons general hand equall sealeroyall much power v much wee finde firmed instamped noble metall poore shagrags silly snake steale armie returne home say haue teeth sharpe one poor soules doe onely exercise power executing order made kind fugitiues haue hope profit may make good gaine seeke ozmin suspecting whither brauings tend finding foot began halt followed close began thus speake vnto misconster noble captaine thinke shall grieue whit returne backe againe ten time one another trouble reiterate step haue troden nay would willingly repeate way againe againe health see wanting vnto mee since necessitie returne made euident plaine vnto let intreat sir put trouble seeing much life worth considering weakenesse wherein taking rich ring finger put hand haue throwne vinegar vpon fire streight grew coole vpon kindely said vnto sir god good speed well perceiue seeme bee man principall note serue king pay would noblenesse point honour forsake field vpon great occasion shall waight vpon loja giue order passe forward safety remaining good friend reposed themselues tooke leaue attended like misfortune arriued length seuill vvhere information gotten came know street house vvhere daraxa dwelt hee vvalked many faire turne thereabout different howers diuers dayes neuer good hap see regard shee walked abroad vvent church spent vvhole time needle recreating selfe friend donna elvira ozmin perceiuing difficulty compasse desire suspicion vvhich might giue ordinarily stranger vvhatsoeuer place come men eye vpon desiring know vvho vvhence come vvhat seeke liue especially frequent one street another cast carefull eye either vpon vvindowes doores particular house hence ariseth enuie hence muttering murmuring multitude hence though none interessed businesse hatred vvithout cause vvhisperings vvere already begun vvhereupon vvas inforced auoyding scandall forbeare dayes vvhilest seruant meane performed office person lesse esteeme therefore lesse obserued hee making discouery onely comfort himselfe walking way night extraordinary howers imbracing wals kissing doores threshold house forlorne kind hope liued time till length fell vvhich sorted desire seruant taking care vpon round house three foure time aday found end luys making vp certaine wall vvas falne downe take occasion foretop aduising master put poore canuasse frocke like base garment thrust himselfe amongst rest labourer worke liked vvell inuention put execution leauing seruant looke horse vvealth iewels vvere lodging might helpe himselfe therewithall need vvent foorth worke vvhither came demanded vvorke stranger told vvages supposed part vvas vvilling bee hired rate rather sit set roundly vvorke striuing outworke albeit many cross discontent yet recouered perfect health yet phrase drew strength vveaknesse heart command flesh vvas first still came worke last left vvhen rest vvilling take ease refresh themselues hee vvas still seeking something vvherein might busie himselfe insomuch found fault vvithall fellowlabourers euen misfortune enuy likewise hath hand made answer knew idle luys vvho noted diligence liking vnto resoluing vvith himselfe take seruice affaire house particularly keeping garden hereupon demanded vvhether skill kind hee told little desire seruice vvould short time inable much well pleased speech person found euery thing sufficient carefull mason made end repayring wall ozmin gardiner luys vntill day euer possible see daraxa good fortune fortune willing haue sunne shone bright morning skie cleare heauens propitious scattering cloud former disgrace discouering new light helpe whereof saw ioyfull hauen longindured shipwracks first euening exercised new office saw spouse comming alone softly pacing step thorow spacous walke beset myrtle muskeroses iesmines flower gathering one vvherewith adorned haire attire vvould neuer haue knowne true originall vvell agreed liuely counterfeit vvhich imprinted heart likewise plainely perceiue great beauty could belong body selfe much perplexed vvhen saw debated himselfe whether best speake bashfulnesse great vvas preuention hindred shortnes time wherein passed along hung downe head making hole earth dibbe hand setting choyce slip daraxa turnd head aside casting shee saw new gardiner stedfastly began looke vpon viewing vvell side face vvhich conueniently discouer selfe vnto place represent selfe imagination vvhere often beheld beloued like seeme vnto vvhereupon sudden sadnesse seized vpon fainting fell ground vvhen shee came selfe taking hold rayles garden vvere vvrought wellordered cane according fashion country sent forth sorrowfull sigh attended vvith infinite store teares leaning hand rosie cheeke called many thing remembrance vvherein haue insisted vpon euery particular perseuered recordation might easily haue beene authour owne death put well could another new desire intertaine soule sight deceiuing conceit little parcell ozmins face represented selfe vnto hereupon rose accompanied vvith generall trembling vvhole body heart panting shiuering vvith aguish fit loue turning againe contemplate anew image adoration vvhich attentiuely beheld liuely transformed selfe seemed vnto beene dreame shee perceiued awake sight serued vvas afrayd ghost fairyapparition afterwards vvhen vpon better view saw vvas man man phantasma vvished might vvhom loued notwithstanding vvas mightily perplexed mind cast many doubt vvith selfe beeing able deuise vvho man sicknesse layd palenesse cheekes vvhich lost wonted colour thing besides fauour feature proportion carriage assure truth yet office habit place vvherein hee stood made discard kind thought disdeceiue selfe grieued drawne errour persisting obstinately wish able abstaine discouer particular affection vnto resemblance vvhich vvhom dearely loued wherupon doubtings anxiety know vvhat hee vvas sayd vnto friend vvhence ozmin suddenly starting manner cast vp head looking vpon beloued sweetest pledge tongue knit close roofe mouth fullest knot loue hauing power speake word able life great passion answer tongue replyed vvith eye watering earth abundance teares fell guttering downe cheekes flowed two cleare fountaines instant entred garden rodrigo sonne heyre luys inamoured daraxa alwayes wait vpon step might thereby inioy occasion contemplate beauty might auoyd suspicion sooner spyde ozmin returned roundly labour daraxa walked leysurely along wont rodrigo perceiued sad semblance inflamed eye growne red weeping alteration countenance presuming somewhat offended lookes shew well pleasd made towards ozmin asked matter might discontent albeit vvas fully yet recouered forepassed perturbation yet inforced necessity vvhereunto driuen told sir see came hither exchange much one word therefore told part mind know whence passion proceed especially first day entred place neither fitting aske question discretion open heart vnto answere went way purpose learne daraxa selfe intertained himselfe displeasing subiect larger step shee made speedily wheeling lodging shutting doores went diuers euenings morning two louers luckily met inioying vpon seueral occasion flower honest fruit tree true loue wherewith gaue ease vnto griefes intertaining true pleasure desire hope happy time wherein without shadowes interruption might freely inioy content short vnsecure extraordinary continuation companying together close treat thing vnlawfull made loue saw made worthy intertained much frequencie sweet conuersation exercise freely world argvment going discourse aduentures two faithfull louers ozmin faire daraxa base vile condition commonly keepes court audience onely sauce moue appetite without daintiest dish haue rellish best morsel sauour bird flippantst vving moueth nimblenesse doth greatest mischiefe
