suretiship others haue payd debt themselues beeing vtterly vndone thereby child father folly want maintenance sent hospitall much money hath bin lent borrowed continuing friendship kindnesse betwixt man man whereby end falles doth onely lose friend money nay many time come passe parted money hath meat put mouth ready starue want food hee hath ouer aboue pay yet dare •… aske forsooth ashamed speake would haue thee know thou knowst already shamefastnesse shamefastnesse likened like vnto web weauers loome one thred broken rauels whole worke thing whereby hurt may arise vnto thee driue thee narrow shift spoyle worke breake threds sunder assure selfe thou wilt rather thanke thinke arnisse good aduice counsell inconuenience thou must suffer hauing done desired thy hand let smart craues rather thou thou hast done modesty shamefastnesse case stand vpon man making marring thing onely proper vnto fooles fit thou shouldst haue kind modestie thy selfe thou art alone thy selfe foule shamefull act knowst thou colour metall hee made free thy selfe shall neerely concerne thee let tye thee vp like dogge vvith chaine clogge behind doore thy ignorance cut slip collar get loose runne away fast thy legges carry thee onely ashamed thing sayd shameworthy thou callest modestie modesty vsed shamefastnesse thing notable ignorance better meere foolerie selfe beene ashamed haue wasted many sheetes paper volume containes acquaint thee sad story miserable life whereunto might adde many ride poste must hasten away promising deliuer vnto thee farre greater thing concerning life god say amen tell would haue grieued much haue returned home without cloake especially hauing come foorth one vpon backe willing laught could choose doe see singlesole gentleman like naked cottage lookt bare wall without hanging besides made point shame stood much vpon hauing put resolution departing beene pusillanimity basenesse mind haue much bare thought returning backe againe thought neuer haue like occasion againe though thinke neuer man selfe played idle tricke therefore way stood thought reputation hang arse pull foot backe already set selfe forward made matter shame turned afterward vndoing ashamed speake boldly vndergo foolishly another asse neuer good old hostesse ran still mind vvho make account fall ere long hand chance light vpon beleeue shall get kerchiefe head make walke haire eares throw sirreuerence durt haue water inough store •… set vp chinne resolued reuenged treading necke setting foot old withered windpipe throwing first ground thou wouldst throw dishclout would god thou paltry proud boy thou vnruly young man thou senselesse old asse either vnderstood thou didst know manner thing shame point honour reputation considering great disorder thou doest idle course thou runnest said vvith selfe reputation lye vpont honour ingaged must goe trust god hope faile mee hauing thus set vp rest resolued passe forward purpose make iourney madrid vvas court brauerie gallantry world nothing bee seene saue rose lillie great plenty aboundance thing vvith many knight order golden fleece many duke grandes spaine many men title many prelate many knight habit many principall gentleman extraordinary ranke quality aboue young king newly married thought selfe handsome young lad vvell shapt reasonable good fashion behauiour would haue gone together eares mee striuing haue away many thing present themselues vnto mee farre simplicitie deed easie think thing bard bring painted thought made dish hot cold boyld rost easier thinke doe business may bee soone conceiued easily effected imagination thus paint forth vnto thee thinke vpon thing suppose like vnto pretty little boy riding vpon hobbyhorse windemill made paper hee beares hand vpon top cane little sticke come first hand bring thing passe liken old man baldheaded weakehanded lamelegged leaning two crutch go scaling high wall strongly defended haue spoke much say lesse thing oftentimes seeme bee well disposed night candle darke taking pillow counsell proueth vaine counsaile pillow sunne sooner appeares vanish away instant like thinne cloud heat summer could haue seene mee made account might easily haue perceiued care breaking sleepes framed thing thought castle ayre fantasticall chimera scarce put cloathes put againe throwne mee plotted many thing none proiects hit right fell crosse quite contrarie proposed vaine lye illusion falsehood deception imagination like duende one spirit fell lucifer tesorode duende duendes treasure say estate 〈◊〉 consumed gone man knowes vanished like spirit duendes treasure cold ember dead coales goe onward way hauing gotten short cane hand stead walking cudgell thought plimmouth cloake cloake back neither doe credit keepe mee warme would haue done onely serud vnderprop mine arme whilest gaue breath weary legges trudging along couple chanced ouertake mee trauelling vvay mule thought selfe could hold lustily keepe company could kindnesse pay charge pescar con mazo properly mallet wherewith car •… ters dr •… 〈◊〉 ch •… maço e renta c •… erta fish pole certaine rent thinke wise one sute english prouerbe know two differing thing neuer boy betweene goe along looke mule ride hard though heart afterwards found wery hard towards rode gently inough cruellminded men pace softer bowel compassion ioggd still along kept close wee gone three league thereabouts neere noone heartstrings ready breake trotting galloping would cast behinde though gate easie yet put considering youth weakenesse body height speed men rather beast men shape spake word beleeue monstrous couetous neere part spittle knew would serue medicine miserable wretch would exchange much one word vvith mee would helpe mee need intertainment way entred vpon discourse told mee story honest clergie man haue beene halfe weary good company wheresoeuer chance light vpon kinde good company effect worketh meat drinke soule cheeres heart trauellers recreateth mind refresheth body make forget wearinesse riddeth way easeth griefe expelleth melancholly lengthens man life particular priuiledge hath make horseman footman wee came together inne wee bait case little difference betwixt one dead ene quite heart cleane tyred might get morsell bread put mouth forced buckle vp selfe bestirre stump lay aside ceremony forget stand vpon point moreouer straind selfe beyond strength humbled selfe stood nature applyde selfe wayt vpon put mule stable carry luggage lodging sound lusty health got plague meeting first dash one sayes vnto stand aside yong gallant get gone haue need seruice traytors enemy god thought selfe vncharitably doe men beginne mee hope haue giue victual faint way would take pitie set vp behinde set downe dinner stood right ouer somewhat aloofe thinking would haue tenderhearted affoord one bit trencher fell short hope came thither time franciscan fryer foot sweat sate downe rest himselfe anon pul mee wallet hung left shoulder loase bread piece bacon horrible hungry could scarce stand vpon legges fetch breath faint growne want food hauing whiteliuerd whoresonne courage dastardly kinde bashfulnesse speake vnto relieue want lookt pittifully vpon besought mine eye good dumbe eloquence would giue bit something god sake good fryer read petition lookes haste could make life lyen vpon speedy said blessed franciscan fryer charitie god though want selfe yet seeing thee necessitie thou art would rather goe vvithout selfe see poore brother lacke take pretty boy quoth hee much good may doe thee see wonderfull goodnes god eternall wisedome diuine prouidence infinit mercy bowel hard stone doth sustaine poore silly worme prouide food filleth thing liuing heauenly bounty able vvherewithall vvould meere couetousnesse giue mee much one crumme table vvhat reliefe could draw seruiceable indeuours mendicant poore beggerly fryer onely god sake meere charitie seeing vvhat extremitie vvas quién proprias necessidades tiene mal se acuerda de agenas hee neuer knew want meant hath little feeling another man misery mine vvas saw tender yeeres almost broken heart hauing spent tyred selfe keep company yet vvere sensible wearinesse tooke pitie commiserate vvants good honest fryer freely share victual wherewith filld belly vvell satisfied good man hee vvent towards seuill beene goe vvay hee ransomed mee misfortune made happy man runne contrarie course take seuerall wayes yet goe way good man shall euer call name gaue mee halfe loafe hee left bid farewell telling mee thou must content thy selfe child shouldst thou haue put lyning lappet iacket faire softly set forward way time gone three league night supper selfe vpon bread without meat vvorld vvould giue ought else eate carrier day inned mine host house bid goe sleepe vpon straw past ouer trauell well could poore needy must doe might seeing could doe would made light supper may well beleeue vvithout oath rise next morning full stomake vvas depart ready leaue inne host come vnto hard •… rted host mee demaunds quarto mee lodging therefore could pay cunning rogue great desire haue stript mee iacket good cloath saw put streight hee eager vpon mee eye brimme full ready runne ouer water one carrier tooke pitie mee carrier k •… e haue soules saued blasphemer fellowes haue soules slept betweene v said mine host let poore boy alone vvill pay fellowes askt mee sirra whence vvhether goe hee made answere mee paid mee vnciuill people ye aske question hard matter knowne may easily guesse hee runne away either father master mine host said vnto mee sayst thou boy wilt thou take wage dwell mee thing stood thought vvas badde bargaine yet seemed harsh vnto mee learne serue childhood beene taught command told would get quoth hee rest heere imploy seruice stable deliuering haue little •… ay spaine oates al ordinary feeding horse chopt straw barly strawe barley see keepe good account score vp truely euery man take neither may misreckoned take care sir quoth shall doe hayre thus remained hauing victual vvithout allowance feeding say vpon free cost worke vvas rather sport vnto mee otherwise holpe well passe away time till night carrier came vvas little nothing doe ordinarie passenger vvas trouble worthy talking learned steepe barley warme water make increase third part giue false measure cunning strike hand knew hincar el pulpejo hollow mine arme runne ouer manger man put trust looke beast giue prouender would bee sure coozen one third part measure yongsters vvould come neatly tricksie manc •… billetes de ligas vigotes garter trim mouchatos spruce could carrying show gentleman diuell page lackey attend vpon vvas good holding bason onely don indure fine shauing wee droue good trade vvee came vnto taking charge hackney set vp place vvere appointed remaines others left went one halfe allowance halfe presently supplide though bad measure came pay gaue reckoning whole bargaine hen pig foale asse helpe share bountifull nature mind magnificent neuer sticke trifle offer stand small matter magnanimus non curat de minimis could aske neuer made bone matter mouthes measure neuer weighing set price thing size set downe proclamation iustices ordered kinde formally hung vp euery inne particular taxe euery thing specified neuer kept therefore made little reckoning thereof onely set vp doores end alcalde notary esçriuano may licke finger receiue monethly profit fee belonging thereunto take occasion see whether fixed vp cedula purpose picke quarrell vvith neglected thereof make pay soundly stable already well knowne euery horse allowance much come piece straw prouender standing kitchen sport alone v made v merry quicke vpon call come nimble hauing learned lesson aforehand bringing reckoning many marauedi thirty two part ryall sixe penny ryals gentleman many marauedis miche yee god diche heartily welcome euer sure reckon rathere ryall ouer blanke vnder many like good wise men would neuer examine reckoning lay downe money presently saying lo friend thers due freshwatersouldiers nouices yong trauellers plant first leafe would aske v wherefore come much c cut owne throates make v inhaunce reckoning higher put v iumpe besides raysing price generall alwaies finde tricke adde something though vvere boyling olla pot p •… k 〈◊〉 wherein •… sh thing sed▪ figure metonym olla taken boyled olla podrida great one contayning diuers thing mutton beefe hen must vnderstand word host kind definitiue sentence appealing purse swaggering roaring serue turne brauings vvill little benefit hostes part company old catchpoles dogged curres scuruie condition haue still mouth hunt dryfoot till come good towne hee bawle vpon like olde cryer hath set vp vvill accuse iustice would haue set inne fire bastonado cudgel vvould haue forced vvife daughter onely hee might thee mischiefe reuenged vpon thee besides lure house catch foolish bird withall shewes prouision poore trauellers vvhich man come inne afoot vvould haue stayed goe horsebacke thou chance forget thy selfe leaue thing behind thee giue thy good word vnlesse thou haue better lucke shall layd vp sure inough thy finding shall tell thee theft tyranny impudencies villanies daily passe innes victuallinghouses neither feare god minister amongst matter iustice either none else take part god forbid vve beleeue thing supposed iustices corrupted take remedy thereof matter small importance thing vvorthy following many wainmen goe vp downe carriage refraine trading great expence charge innes trafficke ceasseth euery feare haue bitten host victualler receiue good payment euill vsage professing kind publicke theft haue beene eyewitnesse seeing many thing touching kind insolencies vvhich deliuer would require large discourse heare like amongst barbarian vve censure accordingly yet vvhen see home eye moued thereat sweare vnto profitable conueniences trauellours mending high wayes repayring bridge reforming innes requires lesse care matter greater moment regard commerce trafficke honour hurteth soule beeing lazie life like halfe well lesse sort purpose vvas better speake best innekeepers boy vvhich somewhat worse blindman mind traueller thereon set vp resolution therefore would though cost mee thousand liues haue beene found base office daily passe doore many haggardhawkes young wandring lad much yeeres growth money purse others begging almes god sake whereupon said face cuzman resolues part hoste matter bidding mine host god bwy vvent foorth seeke fortune carrying coppermoney along gotten good warre lawfull purchase made store small quickly gone spent fell boy haue good world might haue sate downe pereamus comfort found charity cold maruell deare yeere generall scarcitie thorowout kingdome dearth andalusia great must want kingdome toledo farre greater commodity grew heart therewith resolued follow occupation longer though want neuer great hereupon minded make best could cloathes backe began vnbinde booke diuide leaues separate one thing another boy fumble citterne hee come play thee able strike true note tearing would bee thine musicall eare harsh would sound yet thou doest wilt perceiue thy selfe commest vnderstand thy place thinke thou vnderstandest truer two want knowledge thou hast onely lost thy lord loue together time thou hast spent nothing left comfort thee withall foolery thou hast committed therein follow thine owne trade exercise thy selfe thing thou well vnderstandest thrust thy sickle another man haruest meddle thing fitter others thy selfe much thy fault thrust vpon thee haue thou answere commutation lye heauily seene thee offi •… r compared 〈◊〉 waxe office may knowne thee thou office often fals waxe much light little whereby light come drowned quenched case torch great weke small othertimes happeneth light turned bad officer euill effect •… downwards melting waxe aboue presently extinguished put see good thy selfe little office thou art put farre beyond measure thy merit little light thou hast smoothered sudden thou remainest darknesse otherwhiles thou turnest thy vertues towards ground inclining thy selfe vnto euill thou dost make thy office melt top waste consume light thy robbing thy coozening thy ouercommanding contemning poore vsing cause delayes rich possible speed poore thou dealst rigorously rich gently mildly one thou frownest thou smilest poore thou proudly tramplest vnder thy foot rich thou salutest cap hand bowest thy body vsing rest great deale loue kindnesse death come thee vnawares seizeth suddenly vpon thee thy life quickly end thy damnation remaineth euer others disposition may auoid incurring worse inconheuience thou hast put hard taske vpon considering slender satisfaction able giue thee shall tell thee according talent poorenesse vnderstanding shall giue leaue consider thereon thing properly appertaining vnto god god secret concealed man whose iudgements inscrutable hidden men angel shall intermeddle straine selfe therin shortnes apprehension shall able reach vnto well knoweth proportion gift giue vnto euery one much needfull saluation therefore man shall faile office misse preferment god saw fitting cause best knowne vnto himselfe hee foreknew would meanes worke condemnation willing saue hath predestinated better place much said concerning doth obtaine deserueth fauorite person power prince shall either blocke man way strippe office worthily holdeth iudge inward intention heart men neither able examine must goe vpon trust make iudgement externall outward thing see know doth oftentimes tread awry peruert wrest thing ill sense may lawfull v speake rusticall phrase applying language heauen earth say vpon margent great man account god doth vse doe marke thing better looke narrowly shut one eies make sight surer mindes hit marke hee aimes say wil demand men cause wrong knowing threatnings ye iudges earth ye haue iudged vnrighteously haue prepared hard insufferable punishment reside synagogue god iudge griefe many thousand pitties men knowing true aduenture come vpright true iudge accusation certaine brought condemne restitution wanting ought make without sinne cannot forgiuen yet would time serued take order make amendment foule fault▪ true peraduenture wanting would whisper eare say sir may doe well sinne thing ought trouble conscience well euery wise man would doe place bestowing office kinsman acquaintance friend seruant neerest vnto speake truth thou couldst doe thou didst remoue right place put vnfit improper looke ouer thy cardes little better thinke well businesse thou wilt tell friend errour thee thou couldst doe thou couldst •… thou didst sinne thou didst sinne well done doe listen word fooles flatterer thing concernes thee much doth better thee thou wouldst gird vp thy loynes looke vnto may doe thee hurt seeke time preuent lest remedie come late confessor giue large absolution like vnto taylours tell thee garment haue made thee fit thee well thou knowest better whether wring thee whether streight vneasie thee sitteth thy body god doth permit thou didst seeke one whilest thou wast liuing place authoritie tell thee truth time thy death thou art thy last agonie anguish soule thou shalt meet true friend shall tell thee rather sooth thee vp thy condemnation looke thine eies open wide thine eares suffer busie bee satan put honie swarme inhiue themselues sweet word leade thee high ready way damnation returne againe vnto kinde men respect god doubt punishment regard man must plainely tell thee open doore murmuration giue occasion people speake thereof publike sticking vtter said end thought haue beene kept secret taking pittie compassion many merit ill rewarded disproportionable exchange seeing euill euill meanes highest esteeme good reason goodnesse excluded shut assure god hath numbred haires head suffer one fall ground though men therefore may chance faile yet let comfort themselues haue good god friend neuer forsake world thus thing goe therefore neither haue empire dignitie haue honour much looke vpon keepe thy selfe thou art guzman continue honest friend man still let others god name councell commonwealth oracle state let neuer thinke vpon thee enter place whence thou canst get thou wouldst doe put thy selfe danger may bring continuall feare desire haue much lest chance taken thee little lest thou bee driuen beg doe pretend thing way flatterie doe intangle thy selfe many business lest disquiet thee seeke vsufructuarie free inioyer thy life vsing well thou maist liue safe thy estate shouldst thou keepe stirre trouble thy selfe morrow iong continuance doest thou man else know become mayordomo king pelayo chamberlain conde fernan gonçales honour held neither memory remaining shalt thou next day forgotten thou hadst neuer beene much greedinesse much thirst much coile one belly great vanitie w •… growne eate waste much held small reputation another backe third honour thing thee thou offer trouble thy thought thou shalt liue old man else thou shalt old thy time leaue leaue say swelling pride huge gyants thrust vp wall let stand bugbeares fright child good nothing else cloath thy selfe winter may keepe thee warme summer may couer thee going slouenly pompously▪ rather decently richly eate may suffice nature preferring moderation excesse whatsoeuer necessary meerely superfluous neither rich man liues poore man dy diuersitie abundance meates rather disease otherwise breeding viscous slimy humour whence arise grieuous sickness mortall apoplexy twice thrice nay foure time happy art thou risest morning libertie pleasant thing thou wilt houre thy selfe listeth without thinking seruing serued body although trouble haue master also trouble haue seruant shall noone feed freely dinesecurely runne vpon score thy cooke indebted thy cater make prouision victual dispensero send thy coales merchant sellar gather spai •… sell coales pound wet moisture stead bring thee dust stone wherewith thou wilt coozened deceit world thou man else knowes saue god alone seeke excell brauerie affect much neatnes feare euery spot may fall vpon thy clothes loue rich imbroderies carefull keepe fearefull lose bee enuious suspicious let occasion moue thee lie doe purchase preferment vndermining others worke another man ruine worke thy selfe fauour thinke fitter thee goe alone accompanied quicke slow pace rather laughing weeping eating dancing without noted best tauerne thee thou meetst best wine best cooke shop thou lightest best morsell market place thou maist make choice best seat thou maist like publike feast winter get thee sunne summer shade thou maist couer thy boord according thine owne minde thou maist make thy bed according thine owne liking without paying one pennie either making standing maist choose whether man shall see thee disquiet thee contradict thee keepe thy selfe aloofe lawbusinesses liue stranger sutes action free thy selfe false witness feare part thy good amongst become master thou hast let man able aske thee penny keepe thy selfe safe decree beware trust vpon termes aboue small glory vnto thee take heed thou becomst surety man giue cause haue execution come thee thou doe like others shunne contention debate manner suite law last rest thou satisfied contented nothing may oppresse thee breake thy sleepe thou maist rise betimes morning thinke vpon thing may turne thy good reforming amisse men doe would yet good god forgetfull poore hauing opened way vnto whereby may liue contented poore man may 〈◊〉 himselfe well liue happely giuing cold body able beare necessarie euen smallest moment daily spent great man house came thither first confesse man would trust mee farther saw great confidence little little got credit degree first pleasing man contenting man fine willing serue able must haue care please haue men pleasure gaine friend putting forth money interest sowing must doe receiue pleasure friend •… oes kept auoyded seed fruitfull soyle man ought venture life keeping friend spending wealth vnprocuring enemie one sentinell see hundred eies hee like dragon stand vpon tower malice looke action afarre watch v mischiefe doe amisse importeth much haue enemie hath let carrie himselfe towards though readie become friend wouldst thou know behold name thou shalt finde man behaue himselfe towards enemie one deuill mortall enemy one selfesame thing doe thou sowe good workes thou shalt reape fruit first whosoeuer hee benefit wrought chaines therewith imprison noble spirit binde heart vnto bond loue thing wherein might put selfe forward neuer slothfull neuer giue way iust complaint come mee euer giuen faction raising calumny euill report vpon abhorre colour nature aboue scandalous offensiue person wee scandalous person like vnto properly compare vnto sponge sucke one place haue wrung another doe drop themselues vsuall men see thou trust shunne fellowship abhorre company though thou wert sure get end thou shalt sit downe losse shame enough priuate house cannot suffer greater calamitie commonwealth contagious pestilence makebates sower discord courtchamblets sprinkled ouer holy water whose glosse word make faire shew vnder print quickly gone lie deuill foule deed euermore chiefe studie haue peace men daughter humilitie humble minded man loueth peace daughter humilitie peace loueth beloued author thereof god ill company done harme begun well gone better wherewithall eate drinke laugh bee merry might haue passed carreere life great deale content many time ended businesse would take nap sweetnesse sunne shewd selfe dinner sometimes made sleepes mooneshine remaining view faire light vntill morning nothing done home lackies page court company crackropes notable wag would make page waggery guzman free fryingpan fright snake hang back weigh downe cry sackes mill chance found asleepe would clap flie made waxe vpon instep shoo letting burne till shoo skinne scorched began stir stretch would knauery breake forth cry fire fire fire otherwhile would roll vp carde piece paper tunnelwise setting fire blowing flame would put directly vnder nose till pillar smoake ascended nostril awakd almost choakt remember vsd manner knew world whethersleeping waking standing sitting eene mad lost wit amongst beene held fast falne one corner stone house dasht braines thousand piece yet tooke patiently neuer opened mouth pocketting many like wrong passed ouer correcting selfe might conserue selfe choosing rather kill choller choller kill que el que todo lo quiere vengar prestò quiere acc bar hee reuenge wrong prouerb shall sooner end himselfe larga se deueder à mucho si se quiere viuir poco man would liue long must short cuttednesse hath cut many man life time slighting iniuries letting quietly goe growes end wearie ashamed whereas thou shouldst risent take heart would neuer leaue persecuting thee vexing thee still mine owne part haue complaind wag made stirre businesse sure would haue made anatomie poore scullion must haue turned skellidon beene way sometimes make triall mee would lay bait putting money place could choose finde would watch see whether lightfingerd art taking vp number still take vp nere lay downe knew meaning found tricke would faine put vpon mee prouerb said selfe serue turne otro perro con esse huesso craftie curre taken bone must throw dogge shall doe good mee haue mist marke master haue leapt little short shall goe beyond mee shall make selues merry misery make merchandize credit furnish almoneda open sale •… ne guzmans craft pr •… serue credit almoneda infamy therefore rest till laid come himselfe fetch away still hauing eie another take thence lest afterwards might said man otherwhiles would take vp selfe come bring master giue hauing alwaies great care keepe wound cleane like good fencer come fairely without least vennie touch world giue another man cut legge slash arme receiue homethrust full stocada owne bosome shewes himselfe bee foole science filcht stole whatsoeuer came way still carried cunningly man could haue cause suspect thing appertained charge wonderfull prompt guzmans diligence office diligent albeit master beene carelesse willing doe worke done neuer stood looking master would bid goe would saue labour formost fellowes bird brought fall plucking feather scowre spit make cleane vessell sweepe house make blow fire without saying another doe consider selfe seeing take pleasure stand like loyterer thumbes vnder girdle one much trouble thought fine kinde deceiuing time doe faire meanes must otherwise haue done perforce made indifferent whether worke worke one since first last must done one v euermore doe vttermost indeuour farre abilitie knowledge would lead reseruing alwaies decorum due office euer action scarce made end pulling bird presently runne morter fall pounding sawces boyld meates roast iron vtensels kitchin spit andiornes tongs fireshouell pothookes like kept neat cleere lookt like many swordblades whereon cuttlers vpon desired loues put selfe tinaja large wide vessell earth big tunne antonius drawes etymologie tinea alio nomine dolium spaine vsually fill water oyle wine like tinaja water yet without droppings kinde sliminesse hanging side none cleanest earthen vessell stood outward court vnder porch got well could willing doe would haue clap lid ouer lo done returnes estrado shee scarce set brother come seeing great smoake house said vnto sister meane turnd gallant thinke outbraue smoake maruell doe let raine drip driue mee hence haue wee supper much smoake must promise much good cheere trow great deale fire say little roast went thus talking along entred kitchen sooner seene prouision get againe saying here braue doings indeed newes see sister v two pray married night came hither house curious banquet guest inuited vnto confidence haue honour maintaine reputation giue father house vnfortunate brother must know truth businesse else like blacke night excused selfe vnto way cannot tell partly good world like bucket well full empty sooner vp downe againe one thing chiefe comfort time prosperitie gained credit day aduersitie count least rich seeing become poore left stampe impression men mind vvas noble free disposition former action vvhich able speake themselues though selfe silent captaine made reckoning acknowledging courtesy vsed towards vvas vvilling able help poore man scarce inough serue owne turne conserud least buen punto good esteeme first knowledge anon vvere acquainted bearing kinde respect house whereof came supposed parent vvas inforced stripp selfe laying aside gallantry began cloath selfe againe meaner poorer fashion put rich though vnregarded roabe humilitie thinke brauery scorned thing nought vvhen vvas flush full money considering vvith selfe vanitie necessitie could vvell sute together one chaire able hold rich man braue borne withall hath wherewithall poore man vaine like cameleon whatsoeuer drawes suck ayre without substance rich man vaine poore man proud condemned guzman set himselfe serue 〈◊〉 captaine therefore rich man vaine ought abhorred poore man proud indured insupportable one scandalous saw able liue selfe therefore got serue captaine making master vvho little vvas companion waited care cooke howbeit commanded kinde respect considering vvas excess childishnesse illgouerned youth brought low ebbe vvas driuen serue hee thus farre assure himselfe vvould doe thing vnworthy gentleman vnbeseeming birth parentage interest world man doe would rise seruice held faithfull secret patient hee made treasurer secret affiance alwayes shewd selfe thankefull vnto hee manifested necessity made knowne vvants vnto spent pretension besides prolixe time excessiue trauell paine whereby hee last obtained intreating bribing flattering seruing attending crouching creeping making legges bowing head ground cap hand quicke nimble pace trotting vp downe street morning night early late without intermission remember told going palace king fauourite trick proud courtier put hat whilest entring coach lookt vpon would haue eaten shortly gaue vnderstand much delaying dispatch making daunce attendance court many faire day till thought hee sufficiently punished purse patience shall euer letany good lord deliuer v power malice meet miserable thing much pittied idoll one affect particular adoration considering man representant poore kinde comedian act part vpon stage world come forth office thus thus attended least resembling person play done long must presently enter tyringhouse graue turned dust ash one sonnes earth common mother v grieue captaines pouerty know remedy much vvant necessitie want great person thing moueth much compassion noble much doth poore man pitie rich iewels left vvhich might sell need vvere thing doe honour great large house wrought many goodly faire pillar whose pauement alabaster hewne fouresquare last crosse court enter lodging stood one end thereof well furnished fairely hung vvith hanging sundry sort colour like vnto arambal moorish word 〈◊〉 sort hanging arambales seemed somewhat better bedshead leand wall close adioyning therevnto stood little low stoole would haue make selfe vnready seruant appointed attend offred seruice pull cloathes ragged selfe knew vvell put either vnlesse tooke great deale care disposing one piece another one part whole put proper place impossible discern know ierkin breech saw layd abroad stretched vpon ground hauing vndone knot fastened together want point let slide bed foot thus soule slouenly lowsie man could well worse crept sheetes bed soft good sheetes cleane sweet laid began think selfe sure good old man kinsman v thus kindly make himselfe knowne vnto till morrow morning good beginning cannot giue new cloathes deale kindly since poore miserable estate giuen good entertainment questionlesse wil faire fortune befall yong diue bottome drift lookt vpon superficies went farther outward appearance either wit experience might haue considered selfe great offer haue great end full courtesie full craft grande offerta grande pensamiento kindness done nothing mysterie man aware alwaies obserue maxime generall rule man shall offer courtesy extraordinary nature heretofore hath accustomed doe eyther meanes put tricke vpon thee else stand neede thee seruant bed went forth chamber leauing candle burning spake vnto wishing put told must hold excused would doe night time flye vp downe countrey almost euerie corner certaine bat rearemise extraordinarie bignesse place offensiue doe much hurt remedy haue light standing one bed side meanes indure seeke auoid flying away blind corner likewise told country full hobgobblins robingoodfellowes great enemy light dark lodging play part many shrewd turne beleeue greatest simplicitie world said went wayes sooner gone presently got vp made fast doore afraid robbing nothing lose suspition iealousie one mischance might befall yong vnfriended vnknowne strange place neuer hauing thought made sure returned back againe bed fell presently asleepe inioying great content sweet quiet rest pillowes spanish colchones like finer sort english matresses quilted wooll flaxe 〈◊〉 country wakened sudden confused noise foure part diuels seemed shape habit blacke curled haire fearefull vgly vizards vpon face hauing walkt station chamber came last vnto bed vvherein lay putting fright lost sences time vvithout vvord speaking plucke couerlets anon sheetes wondred god name would become fell fast could life crossing blessing selfe ranne ouer prayer called thousand time vpon name •… svs vvere daemonij baptizati christen diuels therefore drew still neerer neerer vnto put vpon colchone vnder nether sheet blanket euery one tooke hold corner haled forth middle roome much amazed extremely troubled saw prayer could preuaile insomuch neither dare durst yet able open mouth speake much one word▪ might haue world labour roome highroofed fitted purpose amongst began blanket tosse vp aire vse doe dogges shrouetide till growing weary could hold longer left winnowing sufficiently fanned already laid downe againe found leauing dead couered cloathes went way came hauing first put light disioynted broken piece beside selfe day know whether heauen heere vpon earth god pleased preserue knew end vvas eight morning vvilling rise found selfe reasonably able get vp thought smell sweet body cleauing sheetes clay could clammy plaister cling closer put minde old master wife cooke although perturbation vvithout one disorder yet much afflict crow could bee blacker vvere vvings therefore rubbd ouer body cleanest place could meet vvithall sheetes vvhich vvhen done beganne buckle harneys vnto fall knitting old knot older cloathes longer vvas making ready consider vvith selfe vvhat diuell befalne mee last night rose vp found limms almost shaken piece bone bruized manner ioynt verily haue thought beene dreame lookt round roome could meanes finde vvhich vvay come doore vvas impossible shut sure vvith mine owne hand found 〈◊〉 lockt left began cast selfe vvhether might hobgobblins robingoodfellowes vvhich yongman told mee ouernight thought could vvere hee done ill aduise beforehand vvere mad merry sprite delighted much light melancholly diuels darknesse whilest musing businesse deuising selfe vvhich way could get lifted vp hanging see behind could espy little outlet last lighted open window butt vpon court thorow crost presently said selfe way bull brought hurt came window albeit euery rib bodie bone throughout rattle skinne making noise world chessemen doe shake together bag yet dissemble could regard slouenly part plaid till see selfe quite cleare house threw vp bed handsomely could couering close might come might smell fault finde feeblenesse retentiue faculty deuils brought againe torment anew seruant brought thither came mee towards nine clocke told master expected church must goe thither vnto would willingly haue man stay behinde chamber might get start intreated would doe kindnesse bring doore vnacquainted house knew way brought forth street returned backe againe saw come cleere beene borne wing foot body sound whole tooke tomar la calças 〈◊〉 dinner summer time sestear lye downe take nap place shade coole roome lesse noble men house tradesman cittizens houre improper vnfit either doe least desirous take rest would strange troublesome vnto offer wake importunity time irkesome vnpleasing vnto next would haue thee take rule true one haue calld knockt one doore twice either nobody within within willing answere thou perceiust get thee gone stay longer thou maist well lose thy time thou shalt get money neuer offer draw latch thrust open doore put enter within house hapneth sometime opening doore without knowledge house dreaming accident dogge may suddenly rush fiercely forth vpon thee carry away halfe buttocke bit doe know scuruy cur come know v well doe sure hated wil neuer let v passe without barking biting dog missing desperate roguish boy faile fall vpon thee telling thee thou wouldst loth heare well thou scape thou beggest almes thou must laugh change thy note tune thy voice may carry show one sicke though thou haue health inough thy selfe spare thy neighbour hauing speciall care face keepe euen correspondence eye mouth equall iust compasse head bending towards bosome rubbe thy face morning thou risest cloth rather dankish dungwet thou goest abroad thou maist seeme neither faire foule thy cloathes clap many patch though bee neuer hole let diuers colour much importeth poore man cloathes rather patcht neat cleanely yet slouenly cause loathsomenesse sometimes fall comming man begge almes hee take gloue put hand pocket whereof thou wilt glad laugh thy selfe thinking hath purpose bestow almes vpon thee whē end thou shalt see pull handkerchiefe blow nose thou must bee angry seeme grumble matter may may bee giue thee somewhat though doe whereas shall perceiue thy proud sullen carriage giue thee nothing thou shalt finde thy selfe well vsed see thou repaire thither dayly deuotion shall abound shall thy stocke increase see thou neuer depart doore till thou haue prayd friend deceased intreat god pleased blesse prosper action answere euill language milde word rough speech apply soft tearmes thou art spaniard pride ill beloud abhorred wheresoeuer come draw money another man purse must rather begge brawle craue curse prou la bezerra mansa mama de madre agena dela suya pray blaspheme gentle calfe suck milke strange teat well damms shall giue thee almes answere deuotion god bee thanked god blesse worship grant much health peace content house great good mercy daily doe shew vnto poore tricke got mee great deale money answering gently •… mildly holding vp hand lifting vp eye vnto heauen would call backe againe giue besides taught faigne selfe leaper make wound flesh raise swelling legge benumme arme set counterfeit colour face alter whole body curious principle art end might twit v teeth vpbraidingly say vnto v limmes sound selues strong healthy wee worke liuing charitie relieue lusty stout young rogue many friendly office many curious secret nature whereof made good vse hide thing found capable apt receiue whatsoeuer put began say vnto see foot already stirrop goe vnto graue would willingly leaue chaplaine behinde pray vnto god fell true said within short time died wee v meet many time together repeate part make shew manner exclamation would best become v make profit studied night inuenting diuers methodes formes benediction poore man got liuing making formes v sell vnto v rate many comedy tragedy little enough needed moue mon mindes stirre vp compassion festiuall dayes would vp betimes pardon indulgence stirring might prouide v good place church small benefit vnto could get neere vnto font holywater little chappell whither make station wee would goe progresse runne ouer countrie leauing village much cottage bordering thereabouts goe vnto whence came well furnisht would giue v bacon cheese bread egg great abundance besides cloathes couer nakednesse pittying much poore miserable condition wee would many time begge draught wine god sake complayning much paine weakenesse stomacke much would say haue thing wherein put wee alwaies carried little iarre v vnder colour drinking water held somewhat lesse halfe açumbre would euermore fill brimfull gaue v sooner gone doore presently empty bota quasi imbuta latine verbe imbuo briefe bottle boracha made let •… r carry wine bota one word margented company carried behinde girdle would well hold foure açumbres remember hap fill full one street alone inforced goe home powre forth little earthen vessell call tinajuela came backe againe get vsually went shod good haue beene vnshod head couered good haue gone bare shooes shooes hat hat shooes sandalfashion old enough torne enough hat sutable vnto one would scarce hang foot scarce sit head wee seldome wore shirt according accustomed humilitie still scabbed head haue past well found meat put mouth haue gone seeking new trick new inuentions gouernour came day vnto church heare masse knew willd rise saying vnto come along gouernour gaeta cure guzman sore legge bestow shirt thee put thy backe beleeue went along lodging knowne would haue vsd haue reacht best culuerine haue made come within clutch faire word wit head saw safe getting lookt steadily face said vnto thy colour fresh thy skinne cleere thy body sound thou art fat plumpe faire thy complexion good thy limmes strong rest thy skinne smooth sleeke come passe thy legge thinkes doth sute hang well together rest answered troubled kinde deliuery sir know hath pleased god presently knew thereupon vpon legge halted found whereupon eye doore see could shew heeles get away could selfe amongst lye sh •… may 〈◊〉 pay owes said vnto friend vvould haue mad whats matter sure either wit doe well vnderstand selfe payd alreadie whatsoeuer brought hither selfe saw mine eye money payd truth face presence let speake may taken witnesse whether content tryde going seeke truth decide difference award done businesse feigned herselfe bee asleepe calld aloud vnto shee bethinking selfe ill dealt withall doubt shee doe last resolued selfe feigne selfe dumbe lost speech might pay others truth becomes dumbe cause bought professed enemy whereupon hath continued custome euer since truth growne dumbe payd soundly mute therefore hee speakes truth let pay fort consent world go hee worthy doe seemeth vnto haue painted mine imagination truth lying compared truth lying like string wrest peg instrument string hath delicate sound sweet pleasing eare peg doth skreeke squeake creake like cartwheele hardly turnd wrested string gently yeelds willingly stretching inlarging selfe till haue strained liking peg go still twirling turning wrung wrinched pincht vpon string iust stand case world betwixt truth lying truth peg lying string well may lye goe working winding selfe vpon truth peg leaue print signe therein making sound harsh vntuneable eare end go although difficulty turning winding lye long till truth remaine whole sound like peg lying crackt broken like string treated truth torment affront affliction guzmans course life runne thorow indured could end haue set safe one good port haue brought ioy fortunate ilands whole course life lying coozenage roguerie soe like string instrument came put tune could indure least straining presently brake able say resist withstand truthes stretching hand went still turning twirling one mischiefe another one euill worse one deepe calleth vp another one waue come headlongly tumbling vpon necke fellow pin turnd raisd vp page god grant may come downe lower thing receiueth violence strained guzman turned page course contrary nature impossible must reuert returne center low high place vvhich doeth naturally affect desire tooke mee height glory brought downe lowe serue opposite nullum violentum diuturnum disposition shall see long continued course hee walkes fast quickly weary passe suddenly one extreme another cannot done safetie conserued difficultie tree take deepe rooting neuer beare fruit quickly dry withers away newly put office cannot suddenly take deepe rooting say hee settled therin yeeres hardly thriue strange soyle doth sort nature proue end vnprofitable himselfe vnfruitfull others great aleape rise picaro page though manner correlatiues haue kinde relation one another habit doth difference distinguish could choose grieue oft thought vpon common vvith others fell quite contrary mee said que la honras quanto ma creçen ma hambre ponen honour man desire farre liking vvas rather prouerb mee loathing high place please profest mee cada vno en lo que se cria let euery man betake himselfe wherein hath beene traind bred vp fit thinke prouerb take fish •… ater breed peacock therein put oxe fly eagle plough feede horse vvith sand sup falcon straw •… ake man risibilitie speake like logician facultie laughing bred vp among fleshpots egypt center vvas good victualing house circle good honest tauerne end vice vvhereunto bend amaine tooke pleasure health life vvhat contrarie tooke ioy vvas vvas willing make mine mouth daintily fed backe delicately clad eye swolne much sleepe hand want worke soft silke belly guzman whilst page vvith much pampering hard bract drumme buttock brawny thickeskind much sitting chap like monkies nimbly walking side vvhen meat tell hovv possible content selfe indure put set pension stay waiting day long doore night stand torch hand leaning wall standing vpon one legge like crane till almost daybreake sometimes part supperlesse frozen sure cold expecting visit goe come like ladder others goe vp like smith paire bellowes ascending descending beare others company waiting vpon lord caroche early late onely set season certaine time houres day night red winter vvith durt choaked summer vvith dust holding trencher betweene thumb meales belly growing leane lanke alonging desire feeding best dish eye wishing soule euery daintymorsell boord meat mouth besides going vpon one message returning another tyring legges wearing shooes allowed euery moneth paire vve forced goe fifteene dayes thirty barefoote thing yeerely passe first ianuary last december page getting end thereof aske v haue thriud yeere haue got answer hand sir rest vpon lord loue fauour referre selfe discretion goodnes eate meat drinke drinke winter feeding cold summer hot haue kinde poore pittance little clocke page stomake must goe still 〈◊〉 hower master none best commonly somewhat latest aman good goe without weare cloathes giues see liuery rather seruitude deuotion cloath mee giuen keepe warme doe lord honour must made minde cost money paye choose colour greater gaines consist cold fare one v could finger full trencher scrap picking teeth wee aboundance wee intertained selues like poore relicks left refuse fruit worth eating thing worse fruit labour winde blew fresh wee got matter ten twelue matter eight penny nine penny quartes v great summe raisd money many drop flake waxe wee tooke torch sold old cobler hee amongst v could get vp little stocke worth thing though neuer small man sufficient patrimony great thing might buy pennypasty cooke like odde kinde iunkets taken manner sure whipt labour iudgement onely permitted vnto v steale say stolne held lesse euill two beene permitted might haue beene suffered doe would cunningly haue imployd wit kinde would short time haue beene able set vp chandler shop make benefit mine owne torch filch fellowes base crafty withall neuer saw busie themselues thing desirous lose meat victual consumed belly afterwards sold profit yet thing thousand shift roguery saw one take honycombe table presently wrapt handkerchiefe clapt pocket page steales honycombe waiting table story punishment waited table could carry speedily would haue done hauen safety land good place desired hapned heat weather warmth touch vpon honey clung fast finger end whereat fell laughing went away ashamed sowre sauce sweet meat besides neuer tasted honey hee soundly lasht breech dropt waxe fast combe honey misfortune neuer haue befalne perfect kind roguerie would neuer haue beene seeke slight cleanely conueyance sword might rust scabberd might still keepe hand vre euermore practising vpon toyes trifle petty thing worth talking onely set fellowes wit aworke giue bone gnaw vpon diuell thinke brought fooles blockhead court foolish page fit court let euery good morsell slip besides mouthes troublesome wearisome kinde waggish part plaid trick youth nothing else fell afterwards fault would haue sworne others farre thought neuer haue offended licorish sinne euen sinne gluttony doe know whether proceeded eating behinde hanging bed cryes woe wretched vnfortunate woman shall doe pardon good sir must gone late afraid husband misse went way passing midst cardinal seruants attending vpon lordship cardinall importance dri •… ing nayle wall pulling paire shooes thing easie done naturally offer themselues vnto v first sight •… ist thou quoth lord well set wit wor •… g within eight dayes shall shew selfe nimblewitted 〈◊〉 one bestow thee thy labour thou shalt haue another besides bargaine thou shalt faile therein thou shalt binde thy selfe receiue punishment shall bee agreed vpon lord said eight dayes eight dayes man life time inough conscience businesse long may putting large time may either grow cold bargaine memory dye thought vpon accept fauour offered mee lordship morrow time shall finish businesse shal willingly resigne vp selfe secretary hand punished discretion assure selfe would willingly haue tawing might reuenge himselfe vpon late passage put vpon great grie •… e sent pitch yet gone haires come againe lord laught thus bargaine driuen betweene v next day following already forehand well assured businesse could would haue presently cleered selfe debt willing let bond runne till time due boord couered lord set downe dinner feeding thing first brought procure better appetite meate looking face smilingly said vnto mee guzmanillo little night come time past giue freed bargain master nicolao hath rod pisse prouided paiment think plotting may reuenged thee thou thou maist satisfie thy selfe vpon might aduise counsell hee deale thee much thy sake owne whereunto answered sure lord punishment secretary hand yet sure conserues mine yet store money set vpon cast ought lose poorenesse person would venture confident chance thus dinner past till last course almost ended ready bee taken away time went courtcupboord taking thence siluerplate filld conserues barrell stolne therewith came table set downe lordship lord saw brought blest himselfe began wonder much matter himselfe barrel owne custodie within owne lodging kept thought safe inough would trust body regard bargaine driuen betweene v kept key himselfe bore alwaies last cals chamberlaine vnto wils goe count barrel see opened illconditioned went finding number place iust first putting came forth againe told lordship tale whole intire barrell missing sound wellconditioned least suspition ought hee could perceiue amongst much least hayre head ah ah ah said lord tricke serue tu •… ▪ poore one thou wouldst make v beleeue thou hast taken one barrel thou hast bought thy money turned himselfe towards secretarie told domine nicolao astigne guzmanillo ouer vnto doe list vvith punish thinke fit hath lost wager secretary made answere may please lordship take correction owne hand dispose please part haue doe come neere shadow dare haue much already tickle vpon new score make pay old together gaine nothing reckoning hold bee vnhappy dangerous wit nature would reuenge conuey next time nest hornet breech venemous vermine either poison sting death therefore lordship put ouer vnto leaue punishment discretion freely absolue thereof willing imbrace friendship haue yet said offended degree need absolution matter worke vpon needlesse seeke introduce forme good word haue performed promised wager mine haue wonne bee true speake make plainly appeare vnto punish pleasure aske fauour hand de que siruen la palabras donde ay prouerb •… bra need word workes say say againe confidently conserue brought yesterday onely whole barrell thereof present whole vntoucht chamber saue little haue set lordship cardinall crost himselfe wondred vntill dinner done table taken away nothing else blesse himselfe hand desirous bee certified truth thereof rose vp went lodging bee eyewitnesse himselfe lookt vpon barrel whereon set certaine markes found faithfull true number full iust key owne custody could deuise herevpon verily beleeue bought barrell conserues said vnto guzmanillo doest thou thy selfe corrupted since sinne mine many produced cause bad effect became mine owne hangman chapter x guzman de alfarache discourseth ill companie hospitalitie patience put cardinal house placed himselfe embassadour france playde knauish prankes hee relates storie heard gentleman naples ending giues end first part life could told iustly complaine finde fault body selfe lord thus dismist turnd seruice truth made earnest sute importunitie seruants instant haue come backe againe vnto bloud whose heat yet allayd still boyled brest come wonted coolenesse ill consider mine owne good rather haue sayd well ill considering ill well thus discarded wandred vp downe mine owne pleasure fancie lead thorow streetes rome conuersation wicked destroyeth soule prosperity purchased friend mine owne profession seeing vnprouided went vp downe like masterlessehound one would inuite another howbeit cost mee deare meale made ill company though giue nourishment body yet filleth soule ill humour vtter ouerthrow destruction good morsel well satisfie hunger ill counsell lewd conuersation vndoe whereof nothing remaineth repentance began neuer till know danger saw water come vp chinne ready runne mouth vice come stealing vpon man enter silence smooth still file cut without noyse heard till haue wrought man ruine easie receiued hard reiected kinde friend bellowes kindle flame set whole soule fire little sparke raiseth great blaze might well haue recouered allowance meate mine owne put mouth steward told lord giuen order dayly come fetch send would selfe obstinate would none lewdly giuen rather indure hunger ill company feed vpon best meat honest ciuill people quickly payd home first gaue counsell refuse boordwages relying vpon aduice soone weary helping longer relieue would doe shunne auoyd might starue succour looke thing called hospitality entertaining friend guest touching hospitalitie carry kinde mysterie euermore found mouth inuiteth honie hand gall promise liberally giue sparingly bid ioy eate sorrow hee bee another man guest must content ordred haue besides guest manner men ought must rich well passe otherwise shall welcome must tread many step house breech must scarce warme chayre must sit long boord feare troublesome doe flatter thy selfe thou art liberally freely welcome man giues thee good word speakes kindely louingly vnto thee tels thee thou art heartily welcome haue euer obserued true rule amongst lawes hospitalitie man may dyet kinsman lawes hospitalitie seuennight elder brother moneth friend yeere bad father life time father weary perhaps entertaining sonne rest take dislike loathing company thou shalt stay beyond time hate thee death picke one quarrell thee serue turne set thee packing put crooked pinnes thy bread lay baytes poyson thee may rid thee admit thou art inuited married man wife bee closefisted crib wealth owne somewhat proud scornefull say thy mother thy sister fine woman part greedy couetous whine anger see thee looke scuruily vpon thee grudge thee thy meat cha •… e husband bringing thee thither curse thee wish choakt better hard crust thine owne house better little home great deale good cheere abroad cramd capon another man miserable thing set thy foot vnder another man table friend growing weary needed shame leaue already cast streightning hand towards farre giuing thing could shamefully deny without blushing needed maske disguise dissemble businesse could boldly bid goe therefore driuen seeke wall whereagainst leane betake selfe tree shelter vnder whose shadow might quietly take feeding extreme want like prodigall sonne would willingly haue returned home beene content heart one meanest mercenary seruants lord house misfortune dead gone beaten rod affliction began humbled fully resolued turne ouer new leafe betake selfe better course life late came day faire fit may would haue nay stand good reason que pierda por el mal qu •… rer el bien poder throught badnesse lose goodnesse power went distance two moneths betweene good bad fortune beene stayd wellgouernd youth want patience cause much euill running head giddy braine least good could haue befalne would haue beene though meanest seruants honest prouision life might haue runne venture better fortune seeing fell yet must thanke god well bad good cannot say malignant starre cause thereof mine owne euill inclination worker woe starres non compellunt sed inclinant incline constraine starres doe inforce man make men apt doe coact ignorant fooles sticke say sir destinie auoyded shall shall vaine striue tell thee friend vaine thing say thou doest vnderstand truth thereof aright necessitie thou thy selfe makst morall outward thing thou hast kinde freewill conferred vpon thee whereby thou maist thou wilt gouerne thy selfe thy action thy starre cannot constraine thee heauens ioyned together force power haue cannot compell thee thy thou forcest thy selfe leaue good apply thy selfe euill befalls man part occasioned himselfe guzman serues french embassadour euill following thy dishonest desire whence thy cross calamity come vpon thee entred seruice french embassadour lord glory held strict amitie lifetime tooke likewise great pleasure witty iests merry conceit would faine haue serue loth intertaine mee lest might taken vnkindly receiue another man seruant considering good loue friendship betweene well vsd well different end lord directed action profit benefit person master intertaine seruants diuers end onely owne priuate end pleasure tooke ierkes wit merry tale would tell pleasing message bring lady mistress made loue settle set place office seruant large largely paid either hee would giue paiment himselfe else selfe would take presence pleasant iest speake plainely chiefe minion fauorite though pleased call buffone iester guest seldome neuer wanted wee complementall waited punctually vpon eye still guest attended wait table foolish presumptuous person obserued attend attending either impudent foolish troublesome guest came thither vnbidden vpon would put thousand iests would make sit dinner time without drinke would haue thought many melones sowne dry ground others would giue little pinching glass wine ouerwatered othersome ouerwarme without snow ready eate meat would take away plate set saltmeats ill seasoned little oyle none best would dayly inuent new deuices abuse palate might take dislike come hapned vpon time englishman claiming kindred men good bad behauiour bee respected according tale englishman embassador common custome come dayly house master grew weary besides hee kinsman neither noble bloud indued good quality aboueall conuersation full impertinencies kind captiuitie keepe conuersation certaine kinde men man heart rise grow dislike though neuer saw againe another sort men steale thereinto thrust themselues affection good liking vpon first sight winning good v procuring best wish either hatred loue hand one power meere lumpe lead man metall world dull heauy piece flesh word meere blockhead one night newly set supper hee began lay open vanitie telling thousand lye one vpon necke another wherewith embassador much offended able suffer one goe foolery spake spanish vnderstood said vnto would could bee rid foole weary euer speake dolt asse meaning winde whereupon tooke friend taske followed saltmeats smart sharpe left behinde kinde tartnesse tang vpon tongue wherewith bitten calld cooler tooke almost faster could fill wine gulped downe gulph swallowed vp glasse vvas great draught answerable often powder tooke well last powdred vvith vvitnesse quite blowne vp▪ saw yeelded himselfe prisoner pot hee aboue one thirty many peepes tooke one garter knit sliding knot vpon instep one feete fastened vnto stoole whereon sate table vvas taken away offered rise take leaue goe home lodging vvas sooner risen seat fell along floore mouth teeth nose shrewdly hurt bloud gushing amaine vvas come himselfe next day saw vvhat ill case vvas face batterd vvith fall shame hee vvould neuer come neere house businesse well carried succeeded euen vvould haue dart doe hit right anglerods strike sure tale spaniard 〈◊〉 guzman shewes himselfe 〈◊〉 knaue hee fish bite carry away bait leauing angler deluded hooke empty hapned vnto vvith spanish souldier longer marke whoreson traytor crafty subtill rogue hee full cunning shift hearken well pray vnto passed betweene v wily rascall came house noone embassador ready sit downe dinner comming vnto told lordship souldier borne cordoua principall gentleman place though want therefore besought would fauour farre forth might taste bounty embassadour tooke little purse wherein crownes without offering open hee gaue purse gold vvas within seemed exprest himselfe contenting himselfe continued still recounting seruices wherein beene running one thing another embassadour setting himselfe downe dinner make ado like pulling stoole set himselfe cheeke iole lordship gone fetch meat lo vvay might perceiue two ierfalcons like former vvere newly entred within court vvhen vnderstood dinner vvith court ierfalcons lord one said true souldier either diuell sinne hath clapt gyues vpon legges cheating rascall still get start v winnes playes elder hand heard thus mutter maunder came vnto askt whether knew gentleman vvithin one told know tauernehaunter whose father hath many time oft pulld buskin cordoua hee keepes shop vnder wall great church vnhappinesse twenty gentleman v goe italy returne hundred infamous fellowes vvill equall themselues vvith best boast themselues descended ancient gothes vvhen come knowne thinke gumming mouchatos making beare vp stiffe starcht wagging three foure feather hat growne noblenesse bloud purchased name valour beeing better notorious coward feather starchtbeards fight field stout heart men stiffe courage come let v goe make effeminate raskall next time meet leaue comming quarter fyle himselfe ranke went wayes vvhilest vvent considering vvith selfe kinde cattle three thus sought grace set forth themselues somewhat angry two taking bee braggadoccios meere puffes well vaunt made themselues ill language vsd defaming vvho sought honour himselfe without cost preiudice others vvas likewise little moued newcome guest bold insolent carriage might vvell haue contented himselfe vvith vvhich giuen gone wayes without impudent sit downe table swaggering vnciuill fashion moneths minde longd breake one iest vpon put home able auoid thinking goe forth fetch wooll forced come back fleece shorne failing much intent purpose intreated mee giue drinke made vnderstand beckned vnto hand drew neerer vnto made third signe turnd mine eye another way looking demurely carrying mee sober composed countenance though much doo forbeare laughing looking well vpon perceiuing either plaid foole knaue would speake becken vnto turning himselfe towards embassador thus said vnto sir beseech lordship thinke ouerboldnesse much presumption mee haue offered though vnbidden sit downe lordship table regard many excuse render lordship may haue offended therein broken rule good manner plead somewhat fauour first qualitie person noblenesse house doth deserue common ordinary courtesie secondly souldier make mee worthy prince table whatsoeuer haue purchased honour sword profession lastly may adde therevnto necessitie common may befall man well selfe presume lordship keepes free honourable table relieue selfe therefore conceiue lordship hold necessarie souldiers selfe hauing worth good part expect inuited boord therefore shall desire lordship pleased command one seruants giue drinke spaniard perceiue doe vnderstand though haue often called lord upon commanded v giue drinke could otherwise choose doe bid yet would haue sworne hee haue thus gone away buckler well brought drinke poore penurious glasse mixed much water wine left manner dry hee little serue spaniard turne inured suffer much hunger thirst little pittance rather drop draught passed therewith well could till dinner done page hauing conspired alltogether looke face eating lest speake againe vnto v signes giue drinke binde v bring vnto old beaten souldier knew well vse weapon wit hard v likewise beat v ward thought beene sure one bee put hee filld belly well satisfied himselfe last course serued lordship giue leaue quoth goe drinke rising vp boord remouing stoole went courtcupboord taking thence biggest glasse powrd forth much wine water himselfe thought fit hauing quenched thirst putting hat making legge lordship got roome went way without speaking one word lord ready burst laughing see hee put beside tricke wondred awhile resolution boldnesse fellow said vnto guzmanillo souldier sauours somewhat thee thy countrie carried away brauados impudent kinde behauiour whilst talking table libertie free kinde carriage spaniard assume vnto themselues newly come house gentleman naples sooner saluted lord told purposely come vnto lordship acquaint one cruellest strangest accident hath hapned time lately fell rome embassadour intreated relate vnto might better heare deferre taking away brought chayre wherein set thus began speake citie dwelt young gentleman age twenty one pitifull lamentable •… ident two noble louers rome twenty yeeres noble bloud rich wealth goodly presence vertuous able actiue owne person valiant gentleman fell loue damsell young gentlewoman rome age seuenteene wonderfull faire honest equall state condition good loue one loue burne name dorido clorinia parent bred vp retiredly dorido clorinia 〈◊〉 faithfull louers suffer treate conuerse whence danger might arise vnto neither much shew selfe window seldome looke vnlesse chance excesse beauty able loadstone draw youthfull nobilitie rome desire loue parent one brother iealous honour insomuch two louers could inioy would true clorinia one truly loue could meanes hindred shewing selfe dorido oft past way neere adioyning owne window another friend marryed might liberty stand disposed acquainted loue often dorido past way would giue signe token thorow little hole made purpose partition wall betweene whereupon would presently make haste window see receiued louer short yet full content couetousnesse strictnesse time could afford continued thus good comfort none tooke fugitiue pleasure seeing transitu past along street like shadow soone gone seene dorido impatient poore content desirous improue fauours receiued sought meanes might conueniencie inioy sweet sight seeing might permitted proceed whereupon began enter strict league amitie brother whose name ualerio whose friendship wrought valerio brother clorinia himselfe fastnesse feruour ualerio could liue without dorido occasion moued many time carry home house wishing master thereof make bold therewith wanted thing owne command freenesse meanes liberty leisure contemplate diuine beautie dearest loue baytes loues led along gaining still ground gathering strength vnto manifesting loues lookes clorinia weaker two peraduenture inflamed opened minde maide called scintila desirous doe mistresse seruice went seeke dorido met said thus vnto scintila seruant clorinia dorido bootlesse dissemble businesse longer time hide thy selfe vnknowne vnto good liking betwixt mistresse good loue yee make may see doe goe deceiue mistresse selfe hath reuealed much vnto intreating would meanes lay open heart vnto signifie vnto much loues farther declaration thereof hath mee sent greene silke riband hopefull token desiring sake honour much weare arme assure selfe perswaded come recommended vnto owne hand selfe haue seene many time hang dressing hayre henceforward may rest confident faithfulnesse towards great desire haue doe seruice dorido heard strooke amazement neither seeme like well neuer great good conceipt wench iealous discretion holding fit instrument businesse great trust consequence fearing lest loues might weaknesse come discouered seeing remedie clorinias owne act none dissembled dislike best manner could made shew vnto much esteeme loue seruice ready would vpon occasion deserue free voluntary offer dayes past doridos desire increasing speake face face mistresse finding meanes doe loue ouercome difficulty make thing facill seeme almost impossible opened way thereunto shewing meanes vnto whereby might come compasse desire fastened wall house clorinia dwelt butted open street piece old wall whereof one halfe falne downe runne decay scarce high reach vp window belonging house little beneath hole stopt vp moueable stone might taken put againe pleasure serue clorinia sometimes stead lattice viewing thorow without seene passe fro street well knowne dorido often seene mistresse peeping hole opportunitie seemed fauourable desire whereupon brake scintila intreated would stand friend telling since scintila good fortune hath beene haue found well affected loues willing pleasure afford best furtherance therein refuse put selfe hand assuring selfe wil alwayes thing haue care loue beare mistresse desire haue doe courtesie doth oblige vnto know since time surrendred vp soule clorinia put possession heart making true lord owner life haue got thing thereby saue correspondencie affection expressed lookes hauing yet interpreter mindes eye lacke better commoditie fit conuenient meanes debarrd priuatio generat appetitum augmenteth desire euermore priuation occasion throw little water seene dorido got vpon wall standing wayte good houre knowing scintila said softly vnto shee willed stay awhile shutting window go doridos heart meane fell leaping bosome another vvhile father mother perceiue shee rose place sate againe past fro one another side house till parent abed saw approching place appointed whither came troubled conflict betwixt loue shame modestie affection goe backe inforced therevnto scintila last came come interview saw themselues thus happily met together dorido transported therewith although premeditated beforehand would say vnto strucken quite dumbe word say lesse trembling hauing coniuncture might giue breath either one bring pronounce much one word either good bad last little little frozen tongue recouered little warmth made shift exchange word side wherewith saluted dorido intreated hand willingly gaue tooke kist againe againe blessing stroking face therewith neuer suffering depart mouth thus taken pleasure faire hand stretcht forth pleasing touch delicate softnesse beautifull countenance vnable enioy pleasure could place time affoord farther content sweet exchange mutuall loue intertained themselues great whilest hand speake themselues silent talke one hinder speech scintila made haste part feare discouered dwell longer vpon complementall kindness dorido many indearings loue tooke leaue clorinia would post away apace hee went home lodging offering sit downe could rest himselfe seeking case himselfe rising vp sought place whereagainst leane likewise could quiet hee romed vp downe roome walking fro vnsteddy legges disrest desire nothing could giue case content thus suffer thus weare wearisome time till night following time appointed whose minute measured glass distinguish houres giuing himselfe ouer idle curiositie houre come went place appointed expecting vvhen signe giuen placed himself▪ hollow nooke old gate ioyned wall neere vnto window get vp hole hee saw two gallant passe loue couple gentlewoman streete walked vp giuing many turne fro waiting street cleere might make benefit like occasion doridos good friend ignorant inamoured clorinia well acquainted one dorido somewhat reserued loue made clorinia would discouer himselfe vnto feare giuing suspition yet master therefore whilest continued walking durst mount vvall lest haply might chance see albeit night darke yet bulke body might like confused lampe masse discerned walkt vp downe still prying fashion though walkt along street large minding matter easie perceiued therefore know getting thence remoued himselfe little farther looking still would gone else intertaine themselues owne standing might betake himselfe saw stayd still houre vvas come thought himselfe mistris come finde knowing cause thereof might taxe much carelesnesse accuse lacke loue draue holpen choller desperation fully resolued set vpon meaning chase away make head stand seeke defend themselues kill could might well haue done well regard greatnesse strength courage also euery way well prouided besides anger set raging fire whetstone set edge fortitude would haue added greater force valour especially set vpon small aduantage vnawares considering much perill owne person present estate business hand might ouerthrowne ill managed rash inconsiderate course pawsed matter grew little cooler biting lip wringing hand casting eye vp heauen griefe fell downe swoune close vnfortunate daughter lesse breathlesse comming presently themselues againe began greatest lamentation euer heard bewaile great misfortune befalne able moue eye pitie powre forth teares aboundance see young handsome gentlewoman butcherly inhumanely abused middst excessiue sorrow began consider themselues life daughter lost likewise lose honour discretion held fit hazard together resolued therefore themselues keepe deed secret leauing lamenting drying eye smothering sigh likewise quieted house bearing clorinia thence many remedy applyed somewhat brought selfe saw selfe midst mournefull parent pitifull manner sorrow redoubled vpon receiuing increase shame shee swouned anew wherewith parent griefe afresh renewed terrible manner heart beene rent body root began gather breath bewailing misfortune till able doe moue stone compassion take pitie wofull miserable condition presently began great secresie treate cure valerio brother went forthwith fetch surgeon friend whose secresie confidently assured night exceeding darke therefore tooke lanthorne along crossing street hap discry dorido farre carelesse kinde fashion comming along street purpose goe see mistresse ignorant passed began call vnto sad mournfull voyce drew neere vnto heauy cheere hee sayd true friend whither art thou going goest thou peraduenture condole v great disaster tragick sorrow must shorten life hast thou either seene heard like mishap vnto vnfortunate accident hath befalne dearest sister clorinia woe yet thee art true friend cannot conceale must hide world besides know assuredly thou wilt beare part sorrow companion misery nay know thou wilt one v vse diligence reuenging wrong labour thou canst finde hath beene cruell murtherer sister wilt thou dorido sure thou wilt dorido whilest hearing sad storie stood amazed like man beene bereft sens wonder able stand vpon leg wordstrooken heart recollecting himselfe degree holpen desire vnderstand world went striuing fortifie himselfe fierce assault already shaken wall hearr troubled voyce began inquire matter ualerio point point deliuered vnto particular told going call surgeon intreating would goe along fearing lest life clorinia much delay might runne hazard dorido accompanyed albeit hee need comfort himselfe giue comfort vnto others yet notwithstanding framing himselfe thereunto well could length brake thus friend ualerio dolefull misfortune lamentable case vnfortunate sister clorinia doth neerely touch workes true sense sorrow lesse selfe may giue pésame come condole disastrous mischance truly sensible thereof dare •… ow haue aduantage sorrow exceed mine seeing griefe doe v little good end weepe take vvhich cannot holpen aduice vvould consult done case may perswade would haue diligence vsed finding traytor hath done villanous act end vengeance full reuenge may taken neuer yet executed vpon taske shall put vpon vvill take charge selfe doubt one meanes shall come finde goe call surgeon fit token apparant euidence vvas onely act none wherevpon resolued himselfe inflict punishment vpon equall iust disdaine answerable heinousnesse offence determination went home owne house entred lodging shutting doore let loose reines teares grieuously lamenting sad mischance thus vnhappily befalne mistris clorinia said delight eye ioy heart see harme thou hast suffered sake vnfortunate cause thereof traytor horatio thus deceiud thee thou supposedst haue beloued dorido vnhappy mistris life haue brought thee miserable passe haue killd thee body else disturbe thee thy rest drew thee thy retyred reserued course life accursed chinke accursed eye euer yee peept thereinto accursed tongue madest motion meet talke together deare clorinia clorinia life yet life death since mine must follow thine cause ill yet spare selfe much life liue reuenge notorious wrong liue thou clorinia till thou see vengeance shal done vpon traytor shall exemplary iust may remaine memoriall succeeding age heere solemnely vow sacrifice thy sacred innocent ash impious bloud vile traytor horatio one hand hath taken thee giue thee two hee cut one vvas innocent harmelesse cut two wicked sacrilegious let heauen therevnto laid downe foot pittifull complaint bewaile heauy accident worthy eternall teares surely sorrow would haue made end extremely seazed vpon violence passion afflicted soule beene vnderpropt vvith desire reuenge thus betweene death life hee spend night next day following went visit clorinia whither come parent brother began afresh renew teares imbracing weeping one ouer another till last
