deemst thou honour cloake couer foule spot reuenge may mitigate great wrong giue satisfaction answerable sorrow tell v pray comfort looke liue without hath giuen v life dorido able abstaine teares comforting afflicted parent brother told wee spend time teares lamentation may import v albeit willing propose ought rather proceed body else selfe yet occasion secresie wherewith fit carried obligeth therevnto know well haue seene griefes generall misfortune hath befalne v well mine rather mine sorrow ioyned vnto mine addition make heape mine owne bigger besides see thred life cut face expect death bitter thought would haue beene pleasant vnto made end clorinia ye ignorant likewise know great worth quality shall ouersway mine singular loue friendship ye haue borne must equall scale laying euerlasting obligation vpon deserue case make mine owne challenge thing proper vnto world may vnderstand take hereafter shal intreat third person demand way grace request pleased giue clorinia wife wherein ye shall doe two thing first ye shall thereby recouer honour secondly ye shall execute reuenge hand mine heauen shall propitious fauourable vnto blesse life shall liue remaine though according worth deserueth yet answerable desire haue serue making vp loue wanting meanes ought succeed hereafter righting wrong fit world take notice husband wherevnto obliged dorido parent friend make good therein discreetly taking course vse doe goe presuming actiuenesse person lance wrest masked disguised encounter aduersarie thing aduenture depend much vpon fortune hit right make selues knowne misse goe away ashamed shall neuer see face well whatsoeuer hath beene done kinde howsoeuer carryed hath enforced defend selfe argueth great paine taken worthy excuse following tracke step imitation workes grew first hee esteemed good pay againe money following onely differ hath made second part first onely imitated second shall doe like third elder hand shall vye vpon whereunto put shall refuse see assuring selfe shall shut haue place amongst rest field large pleasantnesse subiect whereunto sharpnesse appetite likewise giue helpe part daily come booke cony berryes gloss made thereupon faire angelica dayes castilejo aduise case would nimble fingerd taking pen hand till haue wearyed eye perusing inlarged vnderstanding may bee made capable receiue whatsoeuer shall bee brought vnto would whose chase cannot choose follow nay come confer mouth mouth partie himselfe impossible goe way many conceit thrust bycorners hid wherewith euen owne proper author much troubled vpon sudden present mateo aleman armes learning sister pratling sophister seemeth thinkes tell doe well follow military profession let elogiums alone leauing schollers seeming vnto two different nature consort together shall able point forth vnto one many caesar dextrous letter disciplind armes may take away occasion cauillers alledging forward vsurping office orator taxing mee much boldnesse inconsiderate rashnesse rock vneuen author go excusing himselfe wayes beset bush bryers doubt shall make iourney seeme easie vnto thee assured promise shal able make vnto thee bringing thee safe end thy desire pardon bold proceeding taxe inciuilitie treat thee manner confesse faile respect due vnto one thou art consider pray say spoken thee thou shouldst reprehend others perhaps haue much need reproofe selfe goe talking randome like play blindmanbuffe thou maist vvell tell tongue runnes ryot talke like foole madman shoot bolt without feare wit vnaduisedly throw stone hand knowing may light harme may doe shall answer foole said fell throwing stone oft threw would cry aloud saying take heed take heed master cannot fall amisse whereeuer light must need hit right likewise tell thee que como tengo la hechas thinke man good wretched condition many beare minde conuert violet poyson throw durt vpon snow thought trample fresh fragrant rose vnder feete might sort haue beene happy mee stayd well gone discourse know albeit haue beene troublesome vnto thee thou wilt hold excused therefore shall need craue thy pardon begge thy good word attention purchasing whereof principally pretend albeit many peraduenture haue tasted apple deeme impertinent superfluous mee thinkes possible bee albeit bad thou wouldst make arrant asse coxecombe forsooth idea would forme yet cannot perswade selfe thou hadst set thy figure right thy iudgement truely grounded man thinkes himselfe man men would make iudges himselfe anothers opinion thinke selfe thou thinkest thy selfe euery man hold owne fashion best owne life vprightest owne cause iustest owne honour greatest owne conceit hit rightest tooke counsell pillow seeming vnto mee indeed true prudent consideration doth euermore beget happy euents much haste mother various vnfortunate issue whose handmaid repentance doe graunt one absurditie thousand follow vpon therefore end may erre vsually hapneth fit wee make faithfull examination principle found well chosen impediment end consisteth glory purpose told thee benefit thee teach thee way thou mightest great deale content safetie passe thorow gulph dangerous sea wherein thou saylest blowes shall receiue thou good counsel hunger mine industry must thine thou mayst suffer hunger indure affront whence thy honour rise since thou hast heard said que à que se te hizo rico que te hizo el pico made thee rich made thee likewise open thy beake thou mightest ready receiue blessing therefore thou must striue imitate discreet sonne law knowes sweetnesse behauiour courteous carriage gaine good hardlaced father law thy mouth may proue important graue great doe satisfie thy desire knowing▪ haue rather giuen thee trouble content vnfolding one part life hyding thee perswade selfe many haue already said better beene god neuer giuen thee consequence thou hadst neuer spoke notoriously bad wicked beene better thy selfe haue smothered others knowne thou art farre wide truth thou hast good ground thou sayst much lesse therefore perswaded thou meanest well thy drift herein faire honest thou wouldst seeme make shew rather afraid doe shrewdly suspect touch thee quicke wagging rod doth though nere come neere thee much affright thee thine owne guiltines make thee shrinke galld backe make horse winse saddle touch men whipping themselues vsd religious person fie •… sh remembrance stripe sauiour suffered v •… sh time complaine owne lashing doth halfe much feele smart stripe giues himselfe doth paine anguish anothers hand come dresse cure wound either tell thee truthes lye lye would god lye know thine owne naturall inclination thou wouldst bee well content heare nay play champe vpon bitt would make thee carry white mouth pleasing thy selfe froth vntruthes deliuer truth vnto thee bitter pils vnto thy palate thou findest fault lay open thy fault displeased please thee thou finde thy selfe sound health thy neighbour sicke weake lightning shall light vpon another man house thine owne scape flame thou wouldst better beare thou left vntoucht morsell vnsauory thy mouth phesant partridge shall well receiued kindely entertained thee thou mayst like eele slip hand seeke figleaues slippery trick hold fast haue shall easily thinke escape hand tell thee thou art willing heare thou wilt thou mayst choose generall confession make publike opening packe laying thee knack trinket doe therefore shew thing vnto thee thou shouldst either imitate euill action rather thou shalt come know thou mayst learne thereby correct thine owne thou seest falne wilfull would ordred looke thou well thy step thou mayst hate auoyd occasion wrought take good leaue bad fall set thy foot thou hast seene slip thee let trippings stumblings serue many markes make thee wary thou art man mortall peraduenture neither stronger wiser selfe looke well thy selfe runne ouer leisurely carefully house looke well thy selfe let others alone thy soule see thou haue made euen greater better part dunghils filth manner beastlinesse doe sift prie narrowly thy neighbour see thou canst finde feather bird foot stayres whereat thou mayst picke quarrell heere know thou wilt tell preach vnto thee hee foole seeke cure sicke physician hee medice cura teipsum cannot helpe himselfe hardly giue health others wholsome medicine good cordiall man haue viper tooth sting scorpion shall ill himselfe aduise another ill doe denie one thou sayst befall thee betideth nimble cunning caruer lord table curiously cutteth vp brawne wing legge dainty fowle hauing respect qualitie guest serue giues euery man seuerall plate studying please content eate rest satisfied well contented whilest himselfe go away weary hungry mine owne cost paine discouer shelfes quicksand dangerous rockes vnto thee end thou mayst fall vpon dash thy selfe piece runne vaine fruitlesse vndertaken man labour lost vpon respect whatsoeuer doth pretendeth obtaine desired end rhethorician doth alwaies perswade physician cure pilot arriue safely port must together comfort life receiueth punishment indureth affront making himselfe example shall looke vpon betake way present selfe vnto mee place imitating therein rude clownes also nice courtier passing along roperia hee charily tyes vp one bunch carefully brings home wife blacksmithes face looking frowningly vpon said vnto good houswifery care house good let thing runne spoyle money easily come thinke make reckning sauing penny brought nothing dowry care seemes end go forward sinke swimme alls one see waste looke pray vpon radish cost money tell haue done well haue looke better vnto keepe pray call thinke wastefull woman world worse two may thanke selfe would vnthrift bring whole bunch house fewer would haue serud turne wife laid vp safe willed night might fall crafty hileding demurely sober countenance without least shew choller dislike set downe hee sitting downe supper vvho falling earnestly vnto spake wife said troth wench sweare vnto thee meat world rellish better hath halfe good sauour taste old radish protest vnto thee like better thousand time thus lyther withered see fresh cripsie prethee wife proue one tell bee say poore woman little fancie make tryall thereof shee faith beleeue spaniard carrying doe kinde high spaniard generally carry great command ouer wife hand ouer wiues forcing manner therevnto sterne lookes word made eate one sore much stomake certaine kinde men contented onely commend themselues like capri •… iou humour extrauagant person angry offended bee otherwise others doe pressing follow humour contrarie owne seeme approue least sticke praise likewise another sort people discommend men taste considering de gustibus non est disputandum diuers various condition countenance men though peraduenture two may bee found may resemble one another yet impossible like may perceiue difference therefore must driuen doe heere hap doe comedy one first fortune one formost stage writer wherevnto likened came nothing well fitted spake vnto would leane little tone side mouing somewhat aside others thought much complaining hindred sight likewise giue content forced shift foote one made stand would haue willing see insomuch knowing accommodate selfe pleasuring put merchant eares vouchsafing giue hearing standing stiffely prouerb right legge gaue leaue shift themselues heare see well could melancholly man sanguine chollericke flegmaticke ciuill conceit conforme selfe according stile making mistresse pate pen possible second many humour satisfie different desire need besides making euery particular man seuerall booke liue many men liues sundry author approueth true second part opinion haue liud one onely would falsely intitle mee withall testimonie great wrong haue done therein true life shall onely set downe selfe goe prosecuting hangd finde selfe fit time neither indeed doe deserue suffer mee therefore liue since hath pleased god giue mee life might correct errours time may amend fault punishment misfortune thou wilt truely informe thy selfe serue thee stead lookingglasse whereby thou mayst see linke little better together past present come third part end thou making one continued piece worke weauing well handsomely running along euen threds thou maist better becomes thee instructed truth thing marke whereat haue aymed white seeke hit dainty discouering conceit bee pleased saue mee labour yet let bee carried may ouersights let rest lest might seeme speake passion reason though iudicious perswaded excuse iust complaint thinke place impertinent purpose returne againe way whence haue stept little aside say would haue euery man make choyse owne plate order end booke wherevnto likened fall dish amongst many shall serue boord hee hath minde vnto leauing vnto others vvhich shall please palate agree stomake would naturally owest vnto offer thee loue shall receiue thee shall rest fully satisfied remaine besides requitall thy good indebted vnto thee infinite number thankes take pleasure hearing talke shall willingly would auoyd whereby come passe increase yeeres decrease credit thou vnfortunate miserable wretched old age thou sacred temple old age venerable thing old age necessary yet regarded thou sanctuarie safety thou stop desperate carreeres life thou inne rest weary bone thou art much abhorred life thou art hauen men desire attaine vnto respect thee farre come neerer vnto thee sticke prophane thee thou vessell prudence thou art derided foolish thou art honour selfe respect reuerence art thy best friend reputed infamous thou treasurie knowledge art despised contemned either great defect thee euill disposition whereof latter certaine come vnto thee wanting ballast graue counsell sound aduice like ship without sand grauell keele keepe steady lacke whereof barkegoes roullingand asse hereupon began mourne grieue anew seeming vnto perpetuall eternall slauerie last long therefore humbly besought iupiter hee would haue compassion suffer long season indure hard seruitude yet dismerited fault committed would otherwise could choose euer offend ten yeeres might suffice liuing base fashion time would faithfully promise vnto serue man wel truly like honest asse meeknesse course life receiued answere rest wit thirty yeeres grieued answere comforted hope mercifull iupiter besought might beast euen thought many indured iupiter made good request granted desired ape kissing hand hee beene borne courtier low conge took leaue went away companion friend asse dogge thing thus finished set order iupiter last created iupiter man man making perfect creature rest giuing immortall discursiue soule gaue power dominion ouer created vpon earth making vsufructuarie lord thereof man well pleased tooke great delight beholding goodly creature faire beautifull curiously organized handsomely shapt strongly set great powerfull prince insomuch hee beganne thinke himselfe excellent fabricke worthy immortalitie therefore intreated iupiter tell become hereafter onely long liue iupiter replyde first determined creation kinde liuing creature particularly man hee resolued haue giuen euery one thirty yeeres life apiece man herevpon beganne much maruell wonder matter short time made admirable piece worke opening shutting eye like vnto flower life passe away scarce bring foot forth mother wombe entring head earth rendring vp body graue inioying age delightsome pleasant seat wherein created therefore considering himselfe lately passed betwixt iupiter three beast beforementioned hee humbled himselfe vvith lowly pleasing countenance bespake thus supreme iupiter demand shall troublesome vnto thee h •… man treat god thy diuine order decree intent shall neuer extend selfe least breach least shall euer require thing thee shall fitting craue shall stand thy willingnesse grant alwayes conforming thine humbly begge boone thy hand thou wilt bee pleased since brute beast vnworthy thy fauours haue refused life thou gaust happinesse whereof depriued reason well vnderstand haue euery one surrendred twenty yeeres thou grantedst vnto bestow yeeres vpon haue refused life may thereby inlarged thou better serued iupiter gaue eare petition granted vnto man liue owne thirty yeeres marry spent hee inherit three order first enioy ass twenty supplying office moyling toyling world tumbling tossing fro first one place another carrying recarrying home againe carking caring prouide necessary life thou must doe thou meane liue another day thy thirty fifty fifty seuenty thou shalt liue like dogge barking •… e snarling another grumbling growling vexing thy selfe offending others lastly seuenty ninety thou must play ape counterfetting thy defect nature vsing trick toyes know foolish fantasticall deuices hence wee often see come age folly old men old would faine seeme young tricking themselues vp neatly sprucely ietting like yong gallant vp downe street gay cloathes visiting lady making loue mistresse vndertake know impossibility may accounted iolly stout gentleman representing indeed euen iust world ape doth neuer quiet thinkes himselfe well pleased action imitating man though neuer come man terrible thing bee indured men despight time discouers deceit ought likewise put errour apply themselues runne course contrarie truth tincture playstrings lee slibberslabbers play iugglers boxe coozen others discredit themselues artifice could eate sleepe sounder liue longer troubled fewer infirmity disease course take teeth haue shed would come againe keepe falling yet remaining meanes could repaire feeble limmes recouer naturall heat quicken anew old frozen bloud others nayles till wee bee toucht quicke captaine heard say frostbitten maruelling mystery roguerie suspected knauerie though knew knowing doe fell laughing without speaking one word spanish embassadour calld vnto said friend guzman life shall smother whats matter prithee let v know thee one selfesame time thou laughest yet seemest angry must need good conceit therefore seeing lordship hathlaid downe great pawne life shall though loth much tell protest vnto lordship rather haue held peace sworne life would sooner haue tongue drawne backwards nape necke vtter least sillable shall fully deliuer vnto lordship shall therefore vnderstand captaine laid command vpon would breake iest vpon doctor worthy noble friend girding cut beard saith fashion beard iust world like one vpon flemmish iugges anights put presse made two thinne trencher scrude wonderfull close ghitterne closer shut vp case may come forth next morning euen corner bearing grosse forme broome narrow aboue broad beneath muchatos rulerwise straite leuell line haires iust euen priuet hedge newly cut answering vniforme manner hauing point thereof forme quadrant drawne neatly might make fairer larger show goodly beard accompanied roman bonnet like briefes largs singingmans booke doth grace lesser grosser note sufficient make held great scholler faire outside qualification men seene cauallos argeles horse one white foot farre side behinde hauing part body another colour yet come good race great blockhead though bred vp vniuersities whose ignorance great deale larger gownes like herein vnto kinde melon coozen v gloriousnesse colour seeming good melon show indeed worse pompeons stuffe goodnesse captaine would haue mee said selfe made mee cry tell himselfe would would none lord behinde lordship may pleased lay command captaine know wil ready thing else doe lordship seruice captaine blest himselfe saw whither driuen nayle wondring subtilnesse witt cunning conueyance himselfe rest company laughing none witting whether truth lye past thus betweene v doctor hauing head well warmed wine knew whether best angrie turne iest lookt still vpon euery one eye fixed pawsed carrying countenance betwixt anger shame last vented himselfe spoke thus vnto lord profession would permit giue selfe satisfaction impudencie deserueth lordship might easily beleeue would comply obligation wherein stand bound progenitor honour house lordship presence doth priuiledge insolent boldnesse place afford weapon tongue lordship may pleased giue leaue demand captaine old true sayes serued emperour charles fifth warres battell tunez come passe neuer white haire beard blacke one head young would seeme doth say present ancient piece seruice long agoe let tell v pray iordan hee hath washed saint recommended himselfe end may offer vp taper shrine haue recourse vnto helpe shall haue like need let first declare let goe game play mine well since hath first trumped let v trie soonest beate one another winne trick reason hee carry away shall get thing crossing haue trumpe hand whole boord fell laughing afresh especially master two thing treated hate detest desired reformation man hauing well obserued passed herein hee said vnto mee tell guzmanillo thou doest thinke since thou hast conceit consists word lye colour haires beard lee made purpose vse proposed argument haue thee resolue question told answer make lordship haue said truth yet lye beard chapter iv doctor finding himselfe aggrieued guzmanillo wronged presence many gentleman would bee reuenged spanish embassadour take vp quarrell french causing another guest table relate accident befell constable castile aluaro de luna highly commend iest indeare farre doctor thereby inraged insomuch sorry prest farre giuen great applause signifies metaphorically reconciling friends▪ begin grow ch •… one another warder tooke vp quarrell making discreet handling matter merry meeting onely friend exception bee taken thing merrily passe amongst captaine good naturd man well behaud old beaten souldier good fellow laught heartily let passe iest blessed himselfe vowing protesting hee neuer spake one word vnto mee euer thought touch vpon point though nipt yet discreet gentleman souldier amongst iests broken well lance doctor haue vsd worse would either haue heard seeme set light thought reason doe spake came one beene much iniurd abused doctor certainly knew onely author mischiefe set vpon mee fierce terrible manner doctor grows angry guzman cut word teeth able pronounce plaine much eagernesse heat choller hee would faine haue risen table haue eares haue pummeld soundly head nose haue buffeted cheek would suffer doe seeing could reuenged would hauing weapon left beat withall tongue roundly laid letting reines loose rage bestowd liuery vpon calling vile name hee able reckon vp whereof made little reckoning rather helpe teaching say madded rest see mee thus mocke scoffe hee said made breake worse grow farre violent outragious bitter iest beene excommunication ioynt consent generall councell gone euery one v finger therein card paid almost nay almost master stopt furious course one knew well huge dust foolish cholericke fellow sometimes raise owne others hurt businesse growne exceeding foule french embassador seekes 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 sought pacifie best reason hee could vse vnto one would faine turne water another way diuert euill intension towards hee might better doe hee beganne shuffle card anew sundring one hee might wholly cut former offensiue conuersation hee turned himselfe towards caesar neapolitan gentleman told sad accident befalne dorido clorinia likewise one guest said vnto sen̄or caesar since hard hap vntimely death faire clorinia knowne rome gentleman heere present let v intreat doe v fauour deliuer vnto v became constant dorido haue great desire know hee sped may please excellencie said caesar shall heare due place time fit season meet mingle misfortune amidst merriment sute well beene walking thus abroad hee vvould sunne bee able offend withdraw himselfe home house hauing one day amongst rest inlarged walke intertained himselfe longer wont doe pleasant garden neere adioyning riuer pisuerga recreating himselfe beholding varietie walkes beautifull flower delicate arbour shadie tree sauourie fruit heate entred farre hee aware feare returning backe conueniencie content hee tooke sweet delightfull recreation hee resolued remaine take full pleasure place vntill time euening heates bee ouerpast whilest seruants busie prouiding thing necessarie dinner might better meane passe away time intreated two gentleman accompanied thither one luys de castro rodrigo de montaluo would tell louestory whose successe beene full danger full care none could bee greater well knew two gentleman onely gallant court great louers lady besides noble name blood discreet valiant actiue person faire feature behauiour curious cloathes witty iests vnoffensiuely pleasant word generally well tale strangenesse successe best deserue luys de castro vvas first beginne thus hee proceeded may bee lord constable louers recounting misfortune goe painting setting forth feined sorrowes left mee wonderfull rich good land short sent packing past away one thing another till end became poore lordship fauour onely prop doth vphold mee without must haue falne though must tell none least heard recount thus may please giue hearing thing passe long agoe went walking abroad neere riuer side talking discoursing thing farre reach hope vnlooked came luys ancient seruant belonging gentlewoman mistresse secretly deliuered letter hauing opened read ouer done gaue likewise might peruse againe againe wondring much content thereof cause also hauing reasonable good memorie carried away speaketh manner deare sir haue little reason accuse ingratitude seemes vnto haue iust cause doe possible one forget haue thought truly loues since know mine owne obligation constancie would haue likewise vnderstand though perhaps acknowledge much neither doe haue heretofore committed fault action correspond desert reason could stand decorum due maydenstate danger might insue thereupon marriage desired mine owne life obedience daughter disturbe command earnest importunity parent violently carryed away moued thereunto vaine interest title countesse hold since force yeeld body vnto word sillable letter looked vpon euery line twice weighd man would weigh gold ballanced iudgement found light bare full poyze putting mouth hee kist thousand thousand time ouer hee first lookt lord conde gone forth vpon iourney newly returned reason certaine indisposition body seazed vpon way intreated v notwithstanding would haue patience stay till went palace acquaint lady countesse comming▪ went staid much amazed luys quite heart difficulty might offer themselues considering crosse fortune neuer leaue persecute good woman gone vpon errand meane till make returne ranne ouer many briefe countesse said vnto mee rodrigo time offred vnto v inioy faire occasion owne discretion may iudge soone gone know likewise obligation true friendship firme affection haue alwayes made shew beare vnto luys say faile way misdoubt yet sake beg hand bound courtesie grant request haue already vnderstood count husband finding himselfe halfe well returned well aduanced way backe iourney came home weary presently got bed haue left fast asleepe may fallout turning waking hee stretch legge arme towards side bed lye finde place empty body must great deale danger must runne besides great scandall would grow thereby house therefore whilest friend luys selfe shall entertaine time talke shall bee quarter houre thereabouts would pleased goe lye downe place remaine bed may meanewhile abide safer assure honest word shall thereby incurre danger besides count old neuer wake anights vntill broad day doth seldome neuer turne aboue presently fall asleepe againe hee tyred iourney indisposition body present feare hee much offer stirre moue himselfe say hee turne touch foresaid reason dreame body selfe god knowes excellencie may conceiue much troubled mee countesse put mee vpon perilous piece seruice action cowardize foule themselues illbeseeming gentleman seemed vnto mee fly refuse vndergoe businesse giue satisfaction either mine owne honour friend loue countess request told would willingly heart doe seruice withall earnestly intreat would stay long intertaining loues seeing ignorant danger whereinto sake thus voluntarily thrust selfe promised nay swore vnto would would tarry away aboue halfe houre countesse put mee nightdressing smocke put cloathes shee led along withdrawing chamber afterwards made lye downe bed light chamber darke hell still silence softly laid selfe vvhat deale care might knowne deale feare lest deceit discouered least thinke concerne could bee lesse death count chance awake regard went thither naked vnarmed must fight fist onely try strength armes would helpe admit haue struggled count fortune escape hand yet could seruants house knew way order flight griefes indured went little farther luys countesse laugh talke loud might heare euery vvord almost said lay bed wherewith feare much increased lest happely discomposed carriage might chance awaken count mightily vexe almost mad mee could call vnto keepe lesse noise seeing would yet affaire beating ayre clapper ringing bell hang mouth loud men may heare sound thereof censure accordingly giue euery one occasion thereby construe action list themselues regard good fewest doe iudge amisse reason ill themselues bee ill common voyce choaketh good name tare doe come gentlewoman romane performe romane act knowing went worke ouerthrow wisely discreet carriage woman tempted •… dnesse sought preuent seigning selfe somewhat touched loues passion vpon point yeelding wholly ouercome one day maid making ready instant businesse looking vpon smiling cheerefull countenance said vnto nicoleta called assure thee thou hadst wrought vpon vsing many strange inuentions hadst spent many elaborate well studied word suit thine thou hadst ere made mine yeeld hath hitherto stood long wish well vnto guzman approue discreet proceeding businesse besides master merit woman whatsoeuer neuer honourable qualitie without much sollicited haue beene ought imbrace loue friendship offer seruice nay thorow rome neither mine owne house thee canst instrument pleasure euer yet communicate since come passe popular voyce runneth great libertie able longer hold withstanding loue noble gentleman intreat thy hand thou wilt dispose order greatest secrecie may speake therefore guzman waite attend hereabouts night finde opportunitie one night giue entrance may see talke concerning carriage loues master reduce vnto remembrance former distaste receiued wretched estate miserie liud base kinde carriage drie fodderings giue might incourage goe brauely resolution simply beleeue entred hereupon came forthwith flying vnto flinging armes abroad strongly twining necke claspt hard could life demanding reward good newes albriçias hand receiued would relate vnto past betweene mistresse tooke hand fabia master giuing nicoleta little purse pocket crammd spanish pistolets made vnwilling take cloze fist pull backe hand modestie held betweene forward backward like phisician offred fee iocund smile gaue thankes courteous liberalitie tooke leaue master continued rendring account loue giuing parabien thereof kinde discourse like spent euening night appointed houre tooke vp standing gaue watchword made signes ordred betweene v neither night three foure following could agreement made betweene v take effect one day amongst rest hapned fall small withall shrewd driuing raine wherein wonted houre make accustomed prouerb walke dabbled say vp con lodos hasta la cinta girdle came thither reasonable well wet night darke suited amisse fortune hap would god neuer hapned haue end desire thing interest matter concerne pleasure content importeth much cast feare vndergoe difficulty daring resolution shew courage time became discretion forward come call beating forehead wall corner house raine long time cold bath called vnto willed haue patience stay yet little longer end cloathes selfe dungwet drie thred might perceiue doore open softly nicoleta call vnto mee mee thought breath came voyce brought comfortable heate thorowdrie ouer sudden thinke forepassed trouble cheered vp sight fregonçilla b maid seruant wash starch like seruices keeping thing cleane muget de buen fregado la dishonesta que se refriega con todos couarruuias p 413 soule comfortable hope inioying beloued fabia nicoleta exchanged word scarce bid mee welcome lo mistresse came downe calling seruant said doe heare nicoleta get vp see master chance aske come call whilest meanewhile stay talking sen̄or guzman interim darke could scarce discerne one another much possibly could doe begin question concerning health seemed wish well vnto welfare beene matter importance much contentment replyde vnto like demand compliment performed deliuered large message master acknowledgement many thankes owe vnto vndeserued fauours vouchsafed shew vnto great seruant hee inlarging theame elegant oration studied purpose end come conclusion thereof greatest force argument word began gather strength gaining good could fasten farther attention like waxe worke would seeming amazed startled sudden perturbation abruptly said vnto sen̄or guzman loue life let mee intreat hold excused conceiued feare present instant hath seazed guzman notably mocked fabia manner vpon mee thinkes euery body eye vpon mee house watch obserue therefore god sake let intreat enter heere way right ouer shall finde lodging chamber get quickly tarry till haue giuen turne two house see coast bee cleere people safe shall presently returne againe vnto pray haue especiall care meane stand still make least noise world gaue credit vnto went straight directed mee thinking gone athwart little open entry making haste good speed lighted ere aware huge spanish word patio la parte de la casa de cubierta couarru verb patio beastly hogsty stood filthy durty court sooner gone two three step stumbled much haste vpon great dung mixen fell head iust wall giuing selfe sound knocke lay senselesse little life left little little came selfe againe scrambling vp well could went groping along walles hand child doe play blindmanbuffe see could finde appointed chamber could finde outlet saue whereby made entrance rounded againe imagining selfe reason new receiued blow could haply meet vpon sudden wandring thus vp downe maze hap light vpon little narrow lane whereat going forth hauing house office end ill couered wholly neither ouerhead vvas onely tone halfe old broken great pitcher full ordure beeing fixed fast ground beastly berayd round yeelding sweet sent whereby began coniecture danger consider selfe many misfortune befalne well saw world went sought get came found doore shut fast vpon mee hope getting forth rained extremely showred downe fast vpon forced shelter selfe vnder poore miserable old ruinous open cannot tell whether tearme rather houell house standing vp knee durt whose perfume none pleasingest passe ouer remainder night vvas farre worse indured toledo lesse perill person two misfortune mentioned first part put house proud genoues kinsman onely falling raine afflict mee came drizling mizling downe vpon mee full open gutter least drop bigge pea beganne thinke selfe become mee could imagine made mousetrap ouernight would next morning deliuer ouer cat conceit runne head entred discourse wherewith might comfort selfe saying free god stormy blustring northerne windes tempestuous night giue leaue escape life till day master ship shall finde mee heere say vnto shall maid brought hither husband would lesser harme vnto mee two married vnto see bone marrd torment make mee confesse made would rather seeke content answere kill bury afterwards stinking churchyard end life miserable manner thus went beating brai •… e discussing fro would issue end businesse lo anon two clocke morning perceiued doore opened vvherewith misery suffered turned ioy flower comfort thinking fabia returned came doore found vnlockt body liuing thereabouts beganne bee afraid heart beganne misgiue conceiuing behinde wall doore house staid waiting comming forth might ease safety rid life vnsheathed sword taking one hand dagger went little little taking notice poore little morning light step trod vvhich many hard bee hit againe entred feare shame got last street doore likewise found open set feete vpon threshold opened eye plainely perceiued already past punishment ouerboldnesse albeit tricke beene put vpon mee easie digested yet iest might haue falne far worse comforted selfe well could looked errour acknowledged fault champing vpon thing walked along street came last home owne house opening chamber doore put cloathes got betweene blanket recouer heat water windes lost manner lye till ten clocke morning tumbling tossing able shame fall asleepe thinking deuising selfe answere make vnto master deale plainely truely acquaint whole passage businesse would great affront vnto mee plaid vpon euery moment whole vollies iests moue euen child street scoffe laugh prouerb deny intertaine lordship vaine idle hope thought likewise fitting nicoleta already recouered albriçias well rewarded good newes therefore might seeme vnto bee meere inuention defeat money todo lo veo matas por rozar del negoçio que esta bien compuesto tiene muchos inconuenientes couarru verb •… todos eran matas por rozar fat saw fire businesse goe well handsomely many inconueniences went ill one side worse way euer sought winde prouerb saltar de la sarten dar en la brasas leaping frying pan fire whilest thus musing selfe might inuent meanes set right one seruants house came knocking doore told mee lord would haue come vvretched vnfortunate man said selfe shall doe haue found prou traer la manos en la masa andar metido en algun negocio finger creamepot haue taken mee manner theft discouered put shift must answere selfe well coragio quoth coragio guzman thy spirit wont faile thee manner wert thou euer yet put plunge length thou didst fairely come sunne yet clouded time discouer true path tooke thee night yard bring thee well lord withdrawing roome well got mee vp shifted cloathes put fresh sute best fine gallant disaster hapned vnto mee hyde mee vp vnto lord expected comming sooner seene •… presently askt mee world went chanced sooner come giue account past betwixt fabia selfe told made mee stay waiting street vntill midnight expecting faire birth businesse proud end bee shittenarsd girle dismist non licet telling could possibly either speake mee open doore also signified vnto would goe lye downe vpon bed see could take rest finde selfe halfe well hee gaue leaue doe wherevpon went chamber put cloathes got mee bed fell victual remained till almost night hatching thousand conceit head wasting wit limbeking braines without drawing iuice substance thence regard rage anger also sundry thought imagination troubled minde able take rest either side lay tumbling tone tother lay backe straightway waxed weary sate vp bed hip feeble beare vp bodie wherevpon resolued selfe rise sooner taken cloathes hand put foot bed one groomes stable came chamber told mee sen̄or guzman pretty wench beneath staires foot inquire stay waiting comming portall within gate apocks vpon quoth haue doe diuell take mee goe downe either bid goe stewes else tell within imagined vvith selfe rome time rung disgrace roguish harlotry came laugh scoffe mee make themselues merry misfortune iealous came purpose play wag mee therefore willed dismisse went wayes night master willed continue wonted station told found selfe halfe well wherevpon aduised mee get mee betimes lodging call thing wanted need would send physician vnto mee kist hand thanking best fashion could great fauour loue towards mee got mee forthwith lodging vvhere remained retired alone done rest day next morning sooner vp receiued letter nicoleta complaining mee hauing come visit mee day would bee spoken withall giue notice past night betwixt selfe mistresse great businesse round street next night following telling mee shee waited comming till midnight vnto added word lest lesse perplexed confounded might cleere doubt wrote answere telling would faile sometimes euening come visit back lane behinde house fabias house stood betweene two streetes backside whereof right principall gate little posterne doore ouer pretty little lodging chamber one little window belonging vnto whence nicoleta might conueniently talke vnto euen day time lane little frequented scarce passable narrow full durt mire euen time bad foule hardly much adoe considering late raine could get place speake nicoleta well come thither ready receiue shee began aske mee become great occasion hinder come seene night yet mistress sake might haue taken paine formed many complaint accusing inconstancie men made loue vnto woman much good affection bore inconstancie idle young men get conquest mastery gotten desired receiued pledge quickly slight wholly forget likewise profession made loue vnto knew innocencie fabias subtiltie went deceiue v thereupon told nicoleta thou art quite way mightily deceiued woman bee would haue thee know thy mistresse hath playd iacke v vp told befalne vilely vsd shee blest selfe crossing crossing selfe ouer ouer thinking thing impossible stood thus talking gallantly clad best brauery strutting leg abroad stretching necke discoursing misfortune carelesse present disgrace euill fortune neere hand fell whilest thus discoursing little posterne thorow way goe stable hapned entred thereat whilest groomes led horse forth water huge big bore bore one groomes found nuzzeling litter made ready horse turning topsieturuy scattering abroad stable much moued thereat tooke vp great bat hand belaboured backe side hard could lay life fat rogue great like bull bayted came running forth hard could driue kinde beast either custome nature vse runne alwayes foreright seldome neuer turne aside came directly vpon tooke sudden could meanes auoyd perforce made way iust betweene leg rode astride horsebacke cleane contrary way keepe selfe falling tooke hold tayle hand vsing stead bridle held fast possibly could able recouer selfe life laine vpon knew present quit selfe handsomely backe whilest deuising selfe might come fairely ranne thorow midst durtie puddle nothing myre filth saue selfe falling might better beare thorow durt forced let goe taile claspe armes side might force could playd binding barrel iuego de nin̄os à punt con cabeça giuing many rap wrong doore flinging vp snout huffing puffing nostril carried spight teeth forced hold fast feare falling durt hoggish kinde gallop three foure street place grumbling grunting went along whining cry calling people together see ayld whilest perceiuing shame danger like runne fell backe mine owne accord regarding light much better beene done mine owne little durty lane besides haue receiued much harme disgrace would haue beene publike haue met remedie mischiefe neerer hand well got vp well could leg bemyrd berayd durt hooted people affronted woman child rome face besmeared durt cloathes top toe playstered ouer myre seemed haue beene throwne belly whale people doores windowes shouted loud boyes flocke one wit depriued iudgement sought might best hide selfe last spyde house hard thought finde good entertainment entred thereinto made fast doore barrocadoed selfe vp close company desirous see fall well could haue wisht fit thing al malo e justo suçeder le cosa bien succeed well wicked punishment fault fell bad entertainment receiued shall heare full chapter following chapter vi guzman de alfarache recounteth house whereinto hee withdrawne himselfe make himselfe cleane another disgrace befell many misfortune passed afterwards betweene lord embassadour hee discoursed politicke graue matter night darke much heart euery house full light sad soule fuller darkenesse weigh consider selfe late master house willing stay reuiling odious tearmes sought driue euill language thinking euery houre yeere till thrust doores guzman make euery one suspicious iealous began suspect tricke stratagem mine owne plotting hauing taken hold occasion get house bring purpose easily passe honest gentleman much way gentlewoman wife wore breech master house friend owne pleasure spanish word •… serrada sienes would glad 〈◊〉 informed propriety phrase •… render better headstrong sure foot wonder husband see vision dreame strange apparition taking euery shadow fearefull ghost conceiuing iealous humour world went coozen euery least apprehension though neuer farrefetcht supposition made presently take allarme whereupon sooner saw within doores called people leauing alone outward porch great gate would suffer seruants doe much kindenesse afford bucket water wash selfe withall poore man cloathes bemyrd hand bedurted face fouly besmeard one white spot seene went intertaining going forth great deale feare lest might chance still waiting gate looke vpon new liuery might better beare name leprosie beheld misfortune company guzman laughed common people increasing standing round thicke together related afresh newly come companie generall dislike detained past relating vnto disgrace befalne whereat laughed aloud making great signes token ioy may reason reioycing reuenge themselues wrong heretofore receiued might see verified commonly sung vp downe street ma enemigos que amigo tienen romance su cuerpo cercado dizen vnos que lo entierren otros que sea enterrado foe friend body haue incompast round crie put graue tshall lye without street full men boyes persecute mee guzman hated persecuted shrill shoutes lowd cryes calling sharpe high key thrust thrust doe yee let foule beast abide vvith put pickled pigge amongst v base raskals almost made mee lose patience iudgement honest folke amongst tooke part mee shewd themselues side sought defend fury labouring pacifie rude rabble threat menace growne shamelesse impudent began throw stone gate desirous haue come forth amongst neither blame excuse selfe would haue done curiositie admits respect like selfe vpon occasion mine owne father thing curiositie doe like shrouetide come yeere doe hold great excesse bee desirous see assure thee doe speake make matter seeme make profit would haue suffered selfe bee seene might meanes haue got good summe money nothing ouer meere lumpe durt hauing like negro white mee seene saue onely eye teeth misfortune befalling liquid kennell rottennest mixen street true knife belonged sword scrapt away much could thing nothing either little nothing better myre reason liquidnesse soked selfe quite thorow cloathes remained wet beene steeped bath held happinesse vnto misery goe dropping street like basket buckcloathes taken vnfortunate seek sh •… n sight men prouerb washingbole carried forth dryed sunne pittifull manner late people gone sneaked lamentable pickle would haue wisht haue beene tooke pleasure therein bee happinesse vnhappinesse regard comfort receiue thence day seeme fortune play wanton went sporting selfe juego de can̄as •… though shee disfauourd like trouble haue heard yet shee afterward assist mee night yea darke night people went way giuing leaue depart thence sound safe free clamour boyes child stayd watching mee got forth throwing cloake ouer face without knowne making large stride seeking possible fly selfe regard store durt euill sauour bare cloathes could dissembled way soeuer went left signe thereof behinde mee beside heat sent might well bee followed afarre strong none past mee would turne backe looke vpon suspect harme chance finde fault others would excuse say let poore fellow alone little slipperinesse gut loosenesse hilt little laxatiue oyle come vpon occasion may bee euery man case well would haue holpe could therefore must pardon others would say inquire farther matter make doe giue ouer haunt crow putde ser el cueruo ma negro que la ala cannot blacker wing others stopping nose went along would cry foh hath store raine falne aware others disciplinante must need haue giuen himselfe great wound stinkes vildly saw mee muffled vp cloake like come whipping themselues holy weeke let aduise friend make haste call quickly water begin swound matter enough worke vpon vvas past fling would sticke aske tell friend sell pound waxe others whats price honeycombes third sure must need perfumer since smels sweet answered silence replyde word vnto meanes past better along though euer anon would bee girding scoffing cryde pock mee bid diuell goe calling polecat like stinking name mumbling softly selfe young nouices doe mattens monasterie payd againe owne coyne hanging head bosome hyde homewards fast durtloaden legges would carrie trouble see dogges euery street come barking faster went much fiercely set vpon especially spanish word gozquejo kinde dogge first great esteeme brought gothland spaine country europe confineth vpon denmark norway called almane tongue gott whence came gothes came castile race dog bastardized manner lost thus vnluckily befalne mee shall cloake dissemble businesse may bee made laughing stocke amongst may boldly tell world besides lye cannot doe house hap see mee others might deny either part whole shall seeme best vnto mee chance light vpon openly taken manner theft found mee cause opened mouth shut able alledge thing mine owne defence inuent lye bee able giue satisfaction make good shall say good decorum vvithout vvrong iniury although shee young faire one obliged take hold faire occasion offered yet ought follow blandishment perhaps great cost great deale caution heed shall best stand vvith fire scorched burnt reason acknowledging ill haue taken hand furie ouerpast prostrating selfe earth confesse fault goe thou sayst following flyeth mee lady manner hand deale doth generous hawke letting bird goe noblenesse mine ill name shall bee quite buried vnderground sake hath beene raised taking therein best course may make reputation hee said vnto mee mee thought resolution vvas admonish young man like thing rich yong necessary lesson yong gallant gallant daring hee indiscreet headstrong hee bee ruled represent say vnto hee doth know friend foe speaking thus looking commending peraduenture walking entring hee hee bee suddenly stabd one time hauing much time receiue blessed sacrament call vpon god helpe extremitie aduise consider bloud corrupted ill humour abound hee liues disorderly giuen excesse ryot vseth little exercise often surfeitings bring apoplexie dangerous disease quickly make end lambe go soone shamble sheepe flatter himselfe hee findes himselfe strong armes foot lusty legges able body free ache either head part therefore safe priuiledgd sicknesse hath established health assurance long life thinkes heare young gallant say poore rascal thou art must come die suffer misfortune poore reason rich alledge poore rich strong valiant discreet nobly descended haue faite house dwell soft bed lie eate list want nothing heart desire liue pleasure doe without controlement trouble caretaking sickenesse doore open old age enter ah poore silly foole thou art samson dauid salomon lazarus good discreet none liue euer world valiant gallant rich thou yet dyd time come haue beene many million men adam time thine yet one liud euer world shall tell truth thing else may good take foole aduenture tell fault dare speake minde freely vnto let spanish prouerb sayes aueriguelo vargas let vargas approue vnderstood 〈◊〉 intrua •… hard decided prouerbe grew first licenciado francisco de vargas colledge santa cruz valladolid man strong braine quicke dispatch king fernando made choyse secretary remit memorial scanning giue account would vsually say made suit vnto aueriguelo vargas couarru verb vargas wee must neither iest great men tell truth wee v weakelings wee ought flatter selues vargas speake point must either desperate foolish shall presume tell prince great person thing thou man vnderstanding haue thing thee worthy commendation presently call thee court frame bill thee executing statute vpon thee scandalum magnatum thou beest buffone common iester send thee porter lodge haue thee whipt therefore thou must neither iest rich mightie yet plaine tell truth bound speake truth know bee accepted whence sure shall get great hatred harme good shall sufficient vnderstanding know thing world passe away shall passe away likewise could content say ouer ouer thousand time together repeat lesson vnderstand truth alone importeth v doth neerely concerne v promise vnto selues accomplish hee holdes himselfe strongest man soundest constitution best composed humour purest mixed element man say well ordered frame nature hath assurance long continuance apt fall house clay lesse substantially built man strength neuer great resist puffe sicknesse best v dunghill heap dust little blast winde scatter away lay v leuell earth let man flatter deceiue himselfe let feigne himselfe nothing intertaine lying sensualitie shall dictate vnto speake vnto thee vtters world besides shee tell thee thou art great powerfull mayst therefore doe thou list thou art gallant mayst therefore goe vp downe take thy pleasure thou art faire rich mayst therefore dishonest dissolute thou art noble mayst therefore lawfully scorne thy inferiours thinke none equall vnto thee thou receiuest iniury thine honour put vp reuenge full thou art gouernour set authoritie ouer others therefore mayst gouerne according thine owne order business thine owne best aduantage though hurt others let maunder worst come come thou needst care thou art iudge mayst therefore iudge thy friend fauour mayst tread iustice vnder thy foot peruert lawes thine owne pleasure thou art fauoured king art able shew fauour vnto others thou mayst therefore vse thy fauour thou shalt prouerb thinke fit shall sute best thine owne liking blow dara vn humo à narizes disgu •… arle •… ojarle couarr verbe humo none good thinkes himselfe man dust kinde dust smoake nose poore regarding thou doest offend distaste stand thy reputation thy office thy dignitie thy honour aske thee thou owest speake thee cloake thou hast wrongfully taken good faith lord must bold tell yee neuer great yee great yee imagine selues though neuer great conceit selues yet best best better little dust make choyse dust yee earth ash sort dust earth let put yee minde beginning dust though tempred little water giuing yee thereby vnderstand greatnesse make yee like beast vnderstand make selues fruitfull heauen entring due consideration selues acknowledgement owne vnworthinesse yee know well enough earth cannot without water yeeld fruit earth become drie vice bee watred deaw heauen holy inspiration good workes may fructifie bring sorth fruit pardoning iniuries asking forgiuenesse wrong yee haue done others paying debt yee owe shewing true repentance yee shall heapes ash good nothing cast vpon dunghill end shall befall ye see happen vnto ash wherof sope made serues take soyles spot cloathes afterwards thing vse throwne forth vpon one filthystinking mixen yee shall bad example terrifie others make afraid following euill course shall thereby saued yee damned pit hell euerlasting burning coalepit whose fire shall neuer goe tell yee truth time tell yee told yee lye youth kinde pride brauery tooke experience teach another lesson riper yeeres haue brought knowledge many errours committed let man indanger himselfe thinke may happen must deferre amendment vpon hope long life vnto hath befalne wit longlife relying thereupon grow slacke carelesse amendment hoping may doe time enough hereafter begin waxe old sharpe easterly winde shall come vpon thee sudden ere euer thou art aware nip thy flower youth cold bitter frost death sheere thee downe ground thy greene flourishing state grasse cut downe sithe mower thou shalt presently wither carried cleane away neuer seene neuer sure come liue thus long man else warrant owne life v bird flye abroad 〈◊〉 singing sporting▪ meane time eagle come seazeth vpon one seemeth best vnto else come owner ground vsing thousand trick deuices take none v know set houre death v know must goe one another likewise haue followed mine owne idle humour thinking vpon settled course world end intend build vp perfect man still meet stone fit building goe author intention setting vp occasion center many line come thereunto lay downe load stone time shall serue returne againe another shall long ere gather bring place returning therefore present purpose say wholly compacted lye euer beene would martyr guzman notable lyer confessor thing communicated therefore would neuer truly impart trouble punctually publish forced manifest would tell one man one tale another another man without comment lyer say need good memorie lyer need good memory none best day would recount case one way morrow another many time many different wayes varie first deliuered bearing selfe manner gaue occasion knew lyer giue credit much generall voyce report went abroad truly really agree vpon thing selfe iumpe matter manner euery one either take away adde thereunto thought best thou thy selfe perhaps art wont doe dayes noueltie beene newly set abroach thing talkt rome misfortune theame discourse •… myrd salt seasoned conuersation came likewise master eare wise gaue hearing spake word master alwaies bound take notice done tyde law goodnesse noblenesse nature remedie amisse hee dissemble could cunningly intersmilings casting eye made knowne ploughd therefore knew furrow turned vp fit master bound take notice euery 〈◊〉 tale told dissemble denie silent side long deuils clouen foot last brake shooes certaine friend consequently enemy taking one day alone told much imported qualitie credit rid himselfe regard publike open language vsed thing lordship intrusted withall euery one might scrue would draw secret committed bosome gentleman place profession proceed according represented embassadours must haue care well master owne reputation selfe vnto lordship contrary would proue preiudiciall owne reputation master seruice discourse mine owne though happely formall word deliuered iust phrase haue deliuered vnto yet verily beleeue like vnto effectuall haue set downe howsoeuer sure none could tell himselfe already knew aduise better able aduise himselfe make question▪ well pleased said vnto spake one word thereof vnto time made shew alteration carryed kinde countenance towards wont doe lent newly come hee made vse occasion liue little retyred talke prophane idle matter particularly woman thus thing runne along regard become common tabletalke towne waited lord chamber page ordinarie seruants tooke little libertie licence language vnto well beseeme make themselues merry intertaine time betweene iest earnest nip mee witty iests pay mee home satyricall lash mariner doe straine tacklings tempest wrest wring bowel within mee last neither home abroad place wherein might rest secure wall whereagainst leane whence eccho sound voice forth sinnes done lost patience manner besides selfe wise man may made turne foole madman one day past along street almost inforced haue committed many foolery said well askt long time wise man might turne foole answered according boyes street shall flocke abuse hoote brought water vp aboue chinne ready drowne made forsweare sufferance renegue wonted patience many little child well greater lubber persecute mee guzman persecuted boyes child wheresoeuer went laughing scoffing mee strange outcryes loud showtings making hideous noise tooke vp stone would haue throwne yong man mine owne stature qualitie yeeres wellbehaued somewhat hot cholericke came running vpon mee held arme fast able moue finger doe hurt yet hee deale honestly mee take part mee defend mee rage fury drawing two three friend came along company making resistance deed word hobberdehoyes like many hobgobblins little diuels haunt vp downe street street house house hauing quieted laid vnruly sprite tooke mee hand bringing himselfe alone home lodging leauing companion behinde keepe backe boyes brought thus home would faine haue stay mee might haue fastned kindnesse vpon haue done courtesie honour house could afford could meanes get accept thereof intreat would tell mee name also vvhere lodging might come kisse hand giue thankes vndeserued kindnesse receiued hee would neither acquaint mee one promising returne time visit onely told beare particular affection well person country spaniard hee sensible disgrace mine owne tooke leaue came home colour changed eye inflamed vnderstanding confounded considering well comming iust nick dinner vvas seruing vp would need goe vp rest page wait lordship table come dining roome found gentleman attending excellencie saw guzmans indiscretion simplicitie saw egregiously playd foole would faine haue holpe selfe getting forth amongst late master already perceiued countenance ayled without casting water well inwardly much troubled wherevpon demanded mee cause perturbation beeing taken thus sudden hauing leisure fall coyning hauing neuer new lye store went plainely worke told whole truth businesse euery particular passage thereof aware telling willing vtter first wine came tauerne without water first truth euer told life master said nothing waited boord beeing able forbeare laughing first truth euer guzman told one clap mee couer cup held hand face another plate held betweene thumb third napkin wherewith hee serud seruer emptyhanded laying one hand face stopping mouth heart ready burst belly hyde feare blurting lord face fast roome legges would carry past farre therein beyond bound modestie excellency somewhat mooued thereat calld aloud vnto quiet rebuking sharper word euer heretofore wont doe reprehending ouerboldnesse presence wherewith ashamed quite altered sensible tearmes honour signes thereof still remaining many thing doth rigour correct loue able effect good sometimes fall errour man may learne thereby take better •… eed hereafter much doth import oftentimes take good fall man may better learne looke foot hereafter know walke steddily surely take notice mine owne deformitie glasse see euery spot quite dasht countenance confounded selfe master woman world would neuer take vpon mee treat louematters broker kinde greatest prince christendome braue resolution would haue held storme laid master remained sad leaning cheeke hand elbow boord holding picktooth mouth betweene teeth beeing much discontented thing mine runne manner must forced doe neuer thought haue done howbeit requisite doe auoiding greater mischiefe seeing himselfe farre ingaged hee giue notable touch reputation hee declare himselfe defence especially considering men seruants reall true marke goodnesse finenesse master cloth willd get downe dinner time forward neither fellowes many dayes together see countenance cheerefull finde tongue affable heretofore wont durst goe doores night day long kept selfe close chamber spending time either reading good bookes playing vpon instrument talking vvith friend insomuch retiring selfe wrought house new respect abroad silence selfe another course life differing led euery man tongue still absenting selfe sight business forgotten neuer beene yong man came often visit mee taken part vilely mockt abusd boyes made mee many offer purse person hee acquainted mee country name cause comming rome get dispensation holinesse hee spent therein great deale money time yet farre effecting businesse first houre heeset foot citie held selfe bound doe good office could pretension giuing credit told mee desire faire occasion might bee offered whereby might repay part debt wherein stood bound vnto intreated hee would acquaint mee businesse would petition lord embassador behalfe negociate speed could hee returned mee many thankes kinde offer told mee hee hit right path wherein hee walke good assured hope bring purpose passe case course faile whereinto hee put himselfe hee would intertaine courtesie whereof made willing tender thus wee past time complement giuing taking turnes ceremony courtship till last askt mee whether vvould take paine walke along palace excused selfe vnto told cause retyred selfe vvell sped mee going abroad mine owne minde quieted noise hurry towne well allayd yong fellow wagge selfe much age beard like mine newly budding forth presently caught hold word desired heare come herein satisfied longing said thus vnto sen̄or guzman haue carried selfe discretion proper vnto may truely bee termed owne hold good sure remedie find difficult put practise make continuall vse sometimes necessarie occasion represent themselues vnto v men inforced whether breake firme purpose religious resolution sir case rather would bee thus mewed vp long time would weare disgrace trauelling abroad rounding italy would returne trauell shall onely take singular content shall likewise obtaine intended end aduantage possibly pretend priuate shutting trauell yeeldeth much delight vp selfe lord house time absence weare thing best physician bee found kinde disease went likewise leading along relation diuers sundry curiosity presenting vnto mee great excellency florence beauty genoa incomparable gouernment uenice thing great delight dispose mee vndergoe course hee taken leaue mee wrought vpon mee night could take rest thinke vpon thing thought already pluckt bootes put spurres vvas onward way wherevpon got mee vp soone day brought lord cloathes hee making ready gaue account resolution hee liked well holding commendable honest course would make much good stop mouthes clamorous told others louing master manner man said mee hee sate musing boord shewd himselfe sad beating braines good much desire see well accommodated great affection bare vnto set wit aworke seeing mine owne inuention hit well told minde goe france haue letter recommendation friend fauour make choyse better liking would wanting vnto deale well worthily one done true faithfull seruice great desire haue gone france great state maiestie often heard kingdome much noble renowned king thing case could conueniently execute longing kist hand thankt excellencie fauours purpose vse deceit carelesse thereof thinkes expressed impresse snake lay asleepe impresse snake spider spider came secretly downe nip head strike poyson worke death whose motto speakes thus ay prudençia que resista al engan̄o wisdome withstand deceit folly man thinke wise man foresee preuent deceit like many trap gin laid way circumspect haue beene suspected trecherie receiued good quality cunning theefe deed heard good word saw man honest fashionable habit sought giue good counsell seemed fauour put life danger saue mine visited thought without hope interest particular profit himselfe
