sayauedra notable theefe familie one qualitie would haue suspected deceit lye told ualençia whose name iust cause conceale spake language castile excellent well true tone thereof possible discerne hee handsome wellfauoured young man well spoken faire behauiour fine companion conuersation would haue suspected haue proud connycatching rascall ceremonious feigned friendship thus deceiue cuning carriage like peacock dressing making faire show therby might better deceiue might haue freer accesse lord house chamber filch thence whatsoeuer could handsomely finger mistrust world rather held honest man durst haue pawnd life truth came day visit finding altred habit sayauedra visit guzman might rob put selfe another kinde fashion cloathes differing wonted weare startled stood afterwards one amazed knowing might thinke might cause change last askt reason sudden alteration told taken counsell resolued goe siena meet pompeyo great intire friend mine thence passe florence afterwards visit italy heard say began take fresh breath seemed glad thereof much commending resolution altring withall owne determination designe vntill seeke fit occasion steale thence odde sute cloathes trifling iewels odde piece gold worth talking hauing heard newes sudden departure lesse would content whole store hee diligent obseruing make vp trunkes putting helping hand thereunto marked laid set gold button chaine iewels aboue three hundred spanish pistolets carryed along lord embassadours house vse play hoord vp igot yeelded space foure yeeres serud good store money gift good luck sake gamesters bestowd vpon good hand cardes euer ready furnish withall present came vnlookt vnto lockt maled vp trunkes laid keyes vpon bedshead whereon sayauedra set heart desire nothing meet fit occasion might come fingring finde meanes falsifie fell iust spanish phrase que quieres boca darle todo lo que quiere quanto pidierè couarr▪ verbe boca hee would haue hee talking iourney telling purposed send away trunkes would stay sixe seuen dayes rome take leaue friend time would siena finde ready mee came thither instant came one lord feruants vnto mee told beneath inquire much desire speake chamber order vnswept fit reason foule receiue visit went downe see interim sayauedra opportunitie take print keyes certaine piece waxe candle end lay sayauedras croft inccozening guzman chamber hee purposely brought along pocket sought mee certaine muleters carrier came luggage came vp deliuered vnto carried away businesse dispatcht friend continued talking together hee offer goe away thought hee courtesie friendship betweene v loue keepe mee company little stay whereas indeed onely stayd towne till counterfetted keyes fashioned smithes hand make breake sleepes shall tell hee continued visit mee three foure dayes together hee thought hee made cocksure bird could escape hand hee came one euening vnto chamber hee sate long face changed colour beganne put feigned hiew hee willing giue hanging head bosome making show hee beene taken great paine head extreme ach shoulder strange kinde sowrenesse bitternesse mouth palate aboue wonderfull heauinesse eye hee scarce able hold vp hee seemed bee lethargie like drowzie disease complaining hee scarce able stand vpon legges desiring mee would giue leaue goe home lodging vvas sorry held great vnhappinesse chamber fitted lodge giue friendly intertainment heart desired intreating saw hee would need bee gone hee would acquaint mee lodging might come visit send physicall curiosity fit sicke folkes rellish taste comfort stomake might serue thing else wherein might bee vsefull vnto hee told mee hee lodged house certaine gentlewoman liud secret priuate case sicknesse suddenly leaue chance grow worse worse hee would aduise mee thereof might come visit taking leaue mee sayauedra ride post syena finely robs guzman •… kes day hee tooke post rode towards siena hee found companion went along muleters might see trunkes consigned hee come siena people seeing gentleman come good equipage post tooke bee principall spantard hee alighted chiefest inne citie presently companion came attended comming giuing seruants waited diligently vpon day soone hee arriued sent one po •… peyo giue vnderstand hee newly come towne friend receiued message knew towne hee ouerioyed going put cloake vvas good ere hee could finde vvay vnfold set right vpon shoulder hee himselfe afterwards told mee hee first threw one way another one wrong side outward another cape doubled order end could hit right much ioy hee carelessely flung onely vpon one shoulder vnmannerly kinde manner came home haste stumbling tripping street sometimes ready fall vpon nose much haste longing desire see come inne sayauedra put person hee tooke vnkindely complaining much make stranger deale vnfriendly alight house might command freely mine owne sayauedra hauing excused vvell hee could afterwards fell discourse talking iourney thing rome vntill night time pompeyo present taking leaue hee might leaue rest sayauedra gaue presence key one trunkes one seruants saying vnto vvithall doe heare sirrha goe along •… n̄or pompeyo take mee sute shall finde part put morrow went away together seruant punctually performed vvhich master commanded vncording presence pompeyo selfesame trunke wherevnto hee directed taking forth foresaid sute cloathes hee locke mee trunke putting vp key pocket hee come way night pompeyo sent good supper neat collation comfit sweet meates admirable rich wine wherewith sayauedra fellowes supt eate drunke fill got bed soundly slept wake till next day morning pompeyo came somewhat early visit seruants intreated hold master excused taken rest night newly falne asleepe hee told sorry hee ill night hee would therefore trouble would goe way come againe anon would meanes giue way telling master would bee angry hee know hee beene none either much wit manner tell wherevpon went presently vp chamber signified vnto sen̄or pompeyo come see hee glad commanding one set ready chaire sent another intteat come vp pompeyo soone hee came asked hee vvhat cause last night indisposition told vvant vse hee weary riding post hee found himsslfe somewhat distempered body ouerheated hee purpose let bloud pompeyo earnest hee would change lodging take house inne sayauedra excused himselfe telling seruants vnruly giuen disorder hee resolued put away take new within eight nine dayes would promise receiue courtesie hand kindly offered vnto intreating meane would doe kindnesse send trunkes one owne seruants hee great trust owne fearing giuing keyes fetch thing hee needed might put tricke vpon pompeyo liked well thought hee therein wisely discreetly onely hee seemed bee well pleased treat taking physicke inne resting contented promise hee made hee performed hee desired vvas sooner come lodging hee laded certaine porter trunkes sending one seruants along hee saw safely deliuered sayauedra hee sent day dainty dinner two friend hauing taken leaue night might goe bed good houre sayauedra companion conuayed secretly another house brought thither taking post departed presently florence whither sayauedra companion post away florence diuide spo •… e come diuided spoile amongst copartner sayauedra craftsmasters subtill fellowes stout rogue principall plotter contriuer pilfring proiects bolonian borne hee great scholler learned doctor kinde art name alexandro bentiuoglio sonne doctor vniuersitie rich man great proiector extraordinarie discourse one build castle ayre frame imagination mighty matter thing great intertainment man two sonnes condition quite opposite contrarie one elder called uicencio ignorant yong fellow silly asse laughter people nobleman gentleman made sport would bolt famousest foolery could bee deuised one hee vvould boast nobilitie another valour sometimes hee would take vpon great musician falling hee would bragge horsemanship poetry aboue hee would professe himselfe bee onely enamorado perfectest loueproficient country might bee said dexalas dexalas penen phrase tending purpose turne catch song would glad bee better informed penen suffer dye folly alexander notable thiefe nimble fingerd strong able body though hee well borne yet ill bred want good education became excellent vagabond notorious rogue keeping euill company man companion like ruffianly fellowes himselfe like like sort thing haue recourse proper center hee ringleader onely principall man amongst hee made sayauedra content himselfe ill company hurtfull little giuing worser sort cloathes thinking could remaine safety got pope territory father alcalde posted bologna carrying away button iewels pistolets retiring himselfe home father house rest fellowes shared fled trent afterwards told mee bologna dispersed themselues pompeyo returned visit mee finding statua fellowes hee askt mine host house become told night went away thence trunkes whether knew hee tooke ill signe suspecting might chance proue end vsed great extraordinarie diligence search hauing notice rode post way florence hee sent hue cry warrant apprehend leauing businesse let mee returne vnto selfe god grant meane may haue good lucke meet theeues recouer lost good dayes afterwards stayd rome iocund merry much dreame roguerie intended great desire know sicke friend whether recouered health worse case left staid foure dayes waiting seeing came sent vnto continued foure dayes longer towne making inquirie amongst countryman giuing al markes signes whereby might know least ghesse man aske preguntar por entunes en portugal thing bee found guzma •… sorrie hee cannot see sayauedra departure entunes portugall looke heare magnificat pr •… erb mattens seeke man moone kinde thing heard diligence could vse purpose verily beleeue sicke dead likewise thought selfe since concealed lodging reason thereof conuenient chamber receiue visit friend much lay looke saw lost labour could possibly heare newes left large recommendation loue vnto lord house taking leaue lord embassadour resolued next day following begin iourney lord grieued much departure clapt hand vpon embassadours kinde vsage guzman departure shoulder taking chaine gold necke vsually weare putting mine told honour guzman bestow vpon thee thou maist oft thou lookst vpon haue thy remembrance one wish thee good gaue also besides mine owne good store crownes would serue conueniently defray charge reasonable well plentifully needed want thing needfull fitting hee thus furnisht hee laid command vpon mee seruant behaue himselfe bee beloud fellowes wheresoeuer hap time time giue account health thing succeed assuring none reioyce welldoing himselfe hoping made end trauell see againe house whither alwayes welcome word kinde vsage fauoured much loue aduice counsell gaue farewell sweet sound deliuered tendernesse exhorting good vertuous course could longer hold bathing eye teares kist hand kneeling ground bestowd blessing vpon mee good highway nag done downe went got vp bid fellowes farewell rode way making vse nagge trauell neuer faile lord seruants ready melt sorrow conceiued departure loud saw must lose would doubtlesse finde want seruices could best doe himselfe tooke content albeit action ill selfe turned much mine owne hurt yet neuer preiudiciall fellowes occasion serued beene put triall dare sweare would haue hazarded liues defence person rather would haue seene mee take wrong alwayes good friend neuer ill office told tale neuer nourisht quarrel amongst neuer crost pretension lord hindred suite wherein interessed could generally well beloued reall courtesy free friendly fashion could gaine greater loue thereby profit reckned lord seruants vnto beene sonne receiued commendation good brother master faithfull seruant insomuch neither seruise dismerited lord friendship failed need publike fame spred abroad touching vnfortunately befell fabias house beene diuulged abroad aspineleaud tongue nicoleta many gossip friend rome babbled forth iest put vpon mee mistresse backe court house neuer forsaken commoditie found lord house lordship haue lost good seruant well faithfully serud see mischiefe wicked woman tongue worke without selfe much mischiefe euill woman tongue good playing tattling huswife discredited master house disordred let man trust woman secret possible wife owne bosome vpon euery light offence may reuenged thee plucke one thy eye content lose owne making little bracke great hole working thee much trouble vpon small occasion went rome like prince well intreated better prouided hauing store crownes spend abroad till durt taken become drie rubbd vnluckie chance doe light vpon v remedy time trauell weare mingo neuer went abroad contentment gallant rich gunshot ill tongue full resolution neuer returne man went forth like new phoenix receiuing fresh life old ash way towards friend pompeyo lookt euery houre hauing prouided neat lodging handsome bed table furniture fitting thereunto came last siena inquiring directed house thither came found within receiued cannot say whether cheerefully heauily sometimes shewing ioyfull sometimes troubled countenance knowing either doe say concerning forepassed ill successe trunkes hee inwardly sad well value lost also tricke put vpon ill account make good consigned vnto hee said neuer word touching trunkes would faine haue kept possible purposed selfe shew brauerie next day like peacocke proudly iot vp downe street siena purpose requested helpe trunkes might change cloathes hereupon inforced open whole businesse vnto putting good hope diligence vsed good course already taken doubt haue againe lose nothing thus cunningly stolne strooke blow heart thereupon sad thou thy selfe wouldst haue beene hadst thou beene case thus stripped thou hadst strange countrie farre thy friend forced seeke new hauing little store money thy purse proucrb one sute cloathes thy backe two shirt thy portmanteau god deliuer v hand theeues robber fraud deceit wicked men late looke harme already done remedy que çoso lo aueys •… rsela 〈◊〉 beuer 1 dor dis gusto dar vn mal trago nadie diga desta agua beuer •… couarru verbe beuer de beuer lo aueys de verter whether would constrained drinke cup auoyding well saw world went helpe pluckt vp spirit set good face matter drew strength weaknesse publike haue expressed griefe made open shew thereof might priuate men opinion beene held baseminded man metall might thereby haue hazarded pompeyos friendship kept neuer stirre neuer coyle adoe thereby haue repayred loss done selfe good therefore sound counsell incounter aduersities aduersities stoutly withstood cheerefull countenance thereby enemy ouercome friend recouer breath chapter ix guzman de alfarache recouering lost good shrewdly complaines small punishment laid vpon theeues wherein deliuereth many thing worthy noting three dayes according common saying continued booted spurd expecting newes could heare theeues chase whether good lucke finde track footing follow vpon heate sent till view come ouertake friend sitting table anon dinde wee talking mi fortune mine cunning carriage theeues thus robd might heare great trampling seruants house others making haste vp staires came told v haue haue principall thiefe taken theft confest put new courage quickned bloud token ioy heart cannot expresse selfe lookes inward content shewd themselues face possible man heart dissemble sudden ioy though sometimes hapneth excesse ioy doth suffocate naturall heat depriue life might haue lighted candle mine eye sparkle growne quicke thought giuing albriçias many demanded •… ranne open armes receiue welcome newes rose vp table sate talking businesse goe meet salute officer beene imployd seruice beene lesse affected therewith selfe came towards mouth full ioy hauing kindely imbraced one another askt world went told like goe well farther demanded manner hee replyde one theeues taken rest could meet would discouer thou hast haply obserued store water hath beene suddenly effect sorrow likened vnto throwne vpon quicke burning coales hath risen vp instant thicke sowltrie hot smoake yeelding almost steame heate coales themselues gaue quenched euen like case word leaue manifest signes ioy diffused themselues thorowout whole body quite quenched water bad newes instant stirred vp infernall smoake choller much adoe suppresse knew would helpe mee dissembled best could pompeyo calld cloake went presently iudge court intreat would vse therein best diligence could fitting done good neither denyed theft confessed fault said others committed seruant bestowd vpon one poore suit cloathes sold spent partly florence partly vpon way returne siena common course kinde opportunitie reforme thousand imperfection presently saw euer see honest poore beggar good proficient trade nay say neuer meanely bred would vnlesse cockscombe haue six seuen maranedis like trifle hat haue summe money lie open people eye may thereby taught tell need haue much already well serue supply want day put bread enough belly therefore get gone giue way poore folkes need euer knowne euer seene beggar poore vnderstanding though new beginner would beg hauing loafe bread vnder arme stand saw another toothpick care sooner saw said selfe thou poore silly theefe thou traitor thy profession art thou asse let euery man know thou hast eaten much remnant yet left behinde thy teeth saw one amongst could play game handsomely nay scarce know set men right place take due time hitting blot saw stiffe taking paine care liue lawfull course disease beyond cure remedie redresse euill experience whereof saw poore young wench time comming rome poore sicke fell begging god sake shee notable tale roguish wench well recouerd health strong bodie bull shee still continued trade begging whose almes shee craued told shame beg shee young lustie able serue worke liuing shee answered shee often troubled cruell paine griping heart fitt tooke caused fall downe ground swound beating foot hand earth renting tearing shee could lay hand kicking spurning came neere sort shee cozen world long time physitians able search nature disease thus shee continued good till shee became owne physitian cured selfe playing hypocrite making solemne profession meerely humilitie shee would goe begging eat thing giuen almes wherewith shee would sustaine sinfull carkasse end would go vp downe house amongst seruants first one another crauing begging thing giue almes none denie fully please much trouble diuell lucke exceeding bad world cannot winne game haue card enough mine owne hand carry sure bird cannot get v importeth v let v feare chase hunt liuely buls safe enough cannot escape v taken manner person vse meanes haue father talkt withall making acquainted businesse whole manner carried giuing large account euery particular thing remitting selfe good pleasure owne discretion thinke meet deserud dealt withall would enforce mee considering faire manner proceeding recouer mine owne rigour law prouerbe euidentia facti besides many pregnant proofes produced good mine deuised hauing made choice discreet person secretly fitting language deliuer thus much vnto power commonly accompanied pride pride still attended tyranny farre compounding businesse made little reckoning taking ill hand treated wishing hee speake deeming affront done vnto honour meere defamation feigned himselfe greatly wronged though knew well enough iniurd without giuing v either good hope good word dispatcht messenger receiud answer hatched thousand euill imagination heart would returne euill euill resolued talke one lawyer vniuersity recommended vnto nimblenesse wit soundnesse iudgement opening case fearing successe thereof aduersaries father powerfull might craue opinion hee would assist best aduice counsell better prosecuting businesse hee plainly told sir well enough knowne towne manner man alexandro also lewd idle course place would sufficient information besides much truth vrge manifestly apparant many know shall heare haue right side iust good cause therefore would aduise frame information desire iustice bologna hath taken notice already theft soone came hither presently knowne clothes none owne well caused altred fitted owne bodie also carried hence lambes sell kinde merchandize whereby make rich returne besides another companion put much trust stole good part good might likewise gaine thereby part pardon indulgence see course must faine take lye releeue may assured best furtherance best counsell giue countenancing cause whereupon desirous bill exhibited presently according information drew one forthwith presented auditore del torrone iudge cause criminall may whether immediatly iudge himselfe notarie know whence came passe sure businesse mine instantly ouer towne particular notice giuen thereof vnto alexandros father man authoritie towne carried great hand amongst hyes haste iudge accusing bold attempt inconsiderate rashnesse pleased terme formed complaint defamed dishonoured house therefore purpose come vnto desire lawfull fauour would pleased doe iustice end might seuerely punished presumption know matter carried betweene beene better haue held peace powerfull man citie iudge seemed willing pleasure began feare occasion quarrell would pickt molehils made mountaines losse turne greater losse making vndoing occasion farther vndoing loue interest hatred euer maine enemy truth many place man befriended truthes enemy cause ended hath money friend sure worke end money great thicknesse yet dulls double abales •… dge iustice edgd sword iustice offer touch gold heauy mettall make ballance iustice light spit heauen need laught better one laugh thee many thou wilt hold thy peace seeme moued let passe take notice thereof laugh thee sleeue hath done thee wrong thou seeke right thy selfe law afterwards ouerthrowne thousand laugh thee thou shouldst foole cast away thy money wilfully amongst lawyer hauing bought nothing therewith meere smoake little vnprofitable breath lawyer scoffe deride thee hath put thee hope thee haue aduantage nation world abhorred spaniard hated place person place person people vnder sunne whose fault know thou goest wandring desarts inne inne priuate lodging common vittayling house thinkst thou honest people haue patron good king alonso innekeepers vittaylers thou knowest poore silly soule kinde vermine therefore thou setst light seekst flie lastly thou shalt endure many inconueniences thy trauels abroad suffering heat cold winde raine bad weather bad wayes inconueniences befall trauellers distastfull company diuers distinct nation one raines another snowes riuers rise thou canst passe night neere thy inne farre growes darke pitch cloud furiously discharge vpon thee lightning thunder thou art impatient spirit thou hadst rather dye thousand death endure goe goe thy wayes last leaue thy idle thought going law sit downe rather losse liue peace better good counsell liue 〈◊〉 quiet world say thee thou art patient wise man reuengefull foole haue either done said vnto thee thou keepst coyle man euer wrongd thou art true haue spoken thee thou hast giuen cause doe lye lye lye lye let goe like lyar therefore thee much wrong himselfe hast thou reason reuenged another indangering thy selfe neglect let goe knaue thou canst take fuller reuenge punish let passe idle foole follow thine owne businesse haue spoken enough thinke vpon may make much thy good thou wilt well weigh haue said vnto thee must returne againe old way entring chap iv guzman de alfarache freed prison fall gaming get money whereupon resolues himselfe goe millayne came prison got lodging generall •… one men knowne vnto hauing euer seene life first flight made comming abroad since time imprisonment hauing neuer conuersed heretofore alike stranger vnto yet thought much ioyed glad heart winne affection inclining haue fortune show selfe fauourable vnto rest contrary sorry saw lost see kinde sinne mee vnprofitable selfe foolish purpose desire two might lose hee might rise winner goe away money selfe beene interessed therein got bound let haue indiscretion ignorance lay men burthen owne shoulder neither moment themselues benefit vnto v one stand peeping window another needlesse curiositie head halfe doore watching see went neighbour house day came midnight brought carryed led thereunto idle needlesse curiositie reason whereof runne thousand suspitions thousand iealousies thing neuer could much lesse gathered way world imagined brother sister ere thou get thee gone leaue thy prying others action god helpe v thou doest know whether one men ought prie men action sinneth sinneth whether doth thing doth may doth sinne sure thou doest sinne thou doest tell doth death life going comming concerne thee good doest thou get reward doe giue thee thy night watching ill bestowed thy selfe others honour shalt thou reape dishonour contentment canst thou take therein say diligence thine thou maist haply haue occasion doe friendly office bestead time need may contrary thing men base condition assure selfe nay dare seale oath thou wouldst doe thy neighbour fearing thieues would come night rob speake vnto thee take paine sit vp watch house earnestly entreat thee tell lye wouldst thou say vnto answere wouldst thou make certainly thou wouldst tell thou hast enough doe looke vnto thine owne euery man bound respect himselfe first thou wilt stand freezing cold indanger thine owne health benefit another come passe doe thy neighbour good turne exercise thy charity towards thou wilt watch quarter houre yet thou maist bring fault light lay open profitable counsell curious obseruers men fault spot •… nne thou wilt thus play foole sit vp whole night see thou canst light vpon oblique action thou maist lay dish hereafter doest thou perceiue time ill doth become thee seest thou say truth thou canst thou wilt examine thy selfe know better thee would stand great deale thine owne health get thee bed betimes looke thing goe home thine owne house let thy neighbour alone wilt thou doe despight charge thine owne soule sinnes thy neighbour free whence come saued thine damned one play winne increase stocke grieues forsooth one win one lose iust go otherwise thou take pleasure looking game •… n looke vpon gamesters must 〈◊〉 fr •… passion looke thou canst without passion thou canst doe thou art thou wilt doe doe two hold lesser euill thou shouldst play thy selfe looke vpon anothers game like passion play well enough knowne desire winne battaile fought betweene two wit foure thou confident thy good fortune doest aduenture thy money least thou desirest may carry away thee thou seekst defend thy selfe well thou canst thou settest thy selfe downe play credence beleefe thou maist well lose win well get get thine thou seemst haue reason deseruest excused onely looking man reason vnderstanding businesse nothing concernes bee blinded passion affected disaffected violent fashion tell mee doe amisse styling man depriued true iudgement whether may lawfully condemne returne purpose continuing play within little sea began swell effect game gamesters waues grew high money began swimme one side boord blood waxed hot choller began kindle close fight watching aduantage boord sinck grapled hard side card likewise plaid part laid life bestirring themselues lustily gaue one blow head club hee strucken ouer boord money suncke hauing lost fight aboue hundred crownes man great blow giuen whose hand lookt whose losse sensible case beene mine owne thinking myselfe brought ill luck instrument bad fortune grieue much vnderstood worth world much lost gaming ought vsed two manner end either meere gaine gaming vsed two cause entertaine time gaine say nothing vnto saue bend themselues way like vnto pyrats put themselues forth sea purchase prize capiat qui capere potest catch catch let euery one arme ship well haue eie bullet flie eares warlike weapon vse kinde fight goe scouring sea whole yeare hope meet one lucky day play intertainment bee onely card themselues doe marke point vnto v shall picke learning shall consider king courtcards called spaine rey cauallo sota first king v second signifies knight one queene third soldier knaue queenes knanes pictured painted forth vnto v vppermost lowest ace shall finde portraiture shape former giuing v thereby vnderstand none play thereat king queenes knanes assure whole packe cardes meete merchant tradesman lawyer diuines befitting profession ace speake much vnto v knaue rather sota souldier downe ace least last card thou shalt see nothing else spot admonishing v thereby except aforesaid ass shall offer play card another asse adoptiue sonne losing perhaps none owne wherewith pay least could hardly spare straine string hard quite debarre men noble entertainment call gamester play recreation twice halfe dozen halfe score time yeare cannot hurt much especially doe play greedy desire gaine onely sport pastime howbeit hold thing impossible man set himselfe play without 〈◊〉 gamesters desire win desire winne though pinne play wife sonne although man doe stake money cannot said play couetousnesse coyne yet opinion man vnderstanding iudgement lie stake man meane spirited guzman mean venture ad money play make himselfe either man mouse get trouble get hospitall seeing small store money remaining vnto much sustaine v long time let v sup well goe bed iarre water alls one good day morrow hold much longer wee cannot thinkst thou tell thy opinion whether shall play foole wise man intend shall bee well done supper company shall meet againe together wanting third maintaine combat come forth challenger list aduenturing runne lance amongst rest putting selfe vpon fortune either lose winne honor day hazarding crownes haue sayavedra made answer vnto haue euer ready hand blemish people began perceiue straight way flockt blushing see garment cut short waste discouering part shame bid v hide went flinching away got home bylanes place least frequented would fadge v would cunningly steale silke cloath gold hanging neuer stood vpon termes courtesie dainty rest greater value greater gaine lower part hanging would snip peece two according occasion time would giue v leaue endeuouring euer cut best choisest place turning hand made thereof either woman body men montera cap made stuffe little brim weare ease within doores •… clownes haue cloath monteras purse pinpillowes sleeues little child thousand like fidling thing still ordering husbanding would lose least thread alwayes contriue manner might make best vse whereunto would put little little came approaching neerer neerer vnto citie drawne thither vpon fame report new uiceroy already come thither would shortly solemne feast running buls bayting beares like pastime besides great fayres market sticke need come hundred mile may present expence vpon way alwayes little still made prouision went along got one place spent another taking vp hen capon village chicken douehouse pigeon pig gammon bacon thing tame would come hand neuer escapt hand furnishing selues necessarie implement might serue conueniencie iourney dyet lodging man desire haue good lodging inne must haue care come sunne set short time spend vntill towards night houre come wherein vsually retire selues runne ouer open place countrey found breach wall house would prie could proule thence seeke make entry might doe conueniency lesser hazard person would begin beg almes saying poore student driuen great necessity could want meanes returne handsomely owne countrey much demand end giue v thing thereby seeke occasion steale something hauing eye still towards henroost casting selues might dispeople house pullen besides innes farmer backside carried alwaies good anglerod strong hooke line baited crust bread sixe graines wheate catch therewith whatsoeuer came way seldome put rod pluckt fish long mine arme fell vnfortunately v could get booty prouerbe se caya lacasa house fallen dawne victualls found yet come worst prouerbe could come wee sure meet good fat calfe man need eate world could afford better veale soone came naples first comming draue dayes good trade made quicke returnes great deale profit purse thing succeed well v tooke great paine reapt great gaines put selfe apparell presence might promise reputation honest man man might well cozned carde outside meane mine faire colour entrance wee made like juego de can̄as glittering gold kind brauerie lacke patience receiued end foile might haue continued good fashion worke enough doe saue skinne pluckt ouer eares keepe bone broken mine owne fault egges proud addle well hatcht might haue beene may thanke body selfe god thanked worse mee might haue receiud much harme thereby therewith comfort selfe one camerades countrey seruant regent •… collaterall councell whose father also serud heretofore de •… ous make himselfe knowne vnto whereupon hee went kisse hand owne returne empty glad see offered doe kindnesse lay power courtier vvords sprinckled woman since heard world went set throat whose shrill sound ascend high heauen leauing little girle shee looke vnto rest linnen shee began runne seeing selfe strait dissembled matter well could without either turning face towards mending pace walked soberly demurely along shee nothing doe letting went along ware fall ground going still without perturbation countenance inlarging step thinking selfe wicked woman recouered lost would therewith haue contended rested quiet shee leaue shee cryde shee made noyse sent forth loud clamour whole field ring peale shrill clapper made farre towne solitarie place free company outcryes shee made heard many insomuch great store sort people came running especially boyes little child besides great number dog barking bawling beene mad comming thicke bee midst marketplace came sayavedra handsome young youth honestly clad well behaud garbe fashion fine spaniard backe towards could discerne vnderstand went little side alone themselues entertained talke good put great muse thinking selfe might cause two treat together secresie hauing imagine selfe euer seene one another notwithstanding might breake discourse end might see whither tended stood still moue place wherein hauing still eye lest get sight obseruing proceeding chance go towards lodging might taking start euer anon mine eye vpon yet kept still end likewise might shift foot slip consider selfe call vnto mee aske talked sayavedra might take occasion make excuse list himselfe might make answer reason calling away finished discourse yet entertained talke purpose whereupon better satisfaction thought best course continue little longer leaue large field wherein expatiate mind earnest businesse elsewhere might presse gone almost dinnertime young youth tooke leaue went businesse likewise willing doe like wonderfull iealous strong suspition plotted together put tricke vpon sayavedra saying word feare thereby increased began doubt drift might watching lesse care cat would watch mouse suspition shrewd worme lie still gnawing heart nature suspition iealousie held vice setles selfe vpon vicious man accordingly nature condition men haue reason lesse suspitious fearing euery man farre forth fashion carriage may occasion feare much desire haue thing make v rush violently break bar difficulty whatsoeuer although would faine haue held peace striue could keepe tongue mine yet could hold longer though life layen vpon must need aske young man might subiect long discourse yet beare present making word thereof till dined taking time calling sayavedra vnto said thus vnto young man morning think haue much mistaken seene heretofore rome name mendoça sir said sayavedra name aguilera hath name aguilera famous theefe nought eagle flie thing nothing come amisse still ready vpon occasion good fellow fine companion likewise brother companie one none outstrip hath trick hundred resort lecture reader beside put together aguilera hath tickling tallons seazes sure owne go sheere away ti neuer heard hath quicke apprehension nimble wit strong braine sound iudgement excellent penman accomptant either keeping merchant booke summing vp recknings whatsoeuer know fellow haue knowne one another many yeeres haue trauayled together endured many particular trouble peril hath beene put vpon one may turne exceeding either great good hurt v goe sea either happy voyage miserable shipwracke goe sea must resolue beforehand encounter danger especially betweene death life springing planke slipping cord gaue account came citie purpose seeke well could meanes whereby liue would ingulphe himselfe first sounded water might within two dayes arriuall taken vp vagabond masterlessehound good hap lighted vpon entertaynment might quit cost without suspition placed himselfe merchant citie receiued seruice goodnesse hand hath serud yeere somewhat faithfully truly looking might play iade giue sound kicke heeles get safe away mule vse doe come seuen yeere old kicke haue kept farther told lay head together draw one two good fellowes companie ioyne together knead cake make v swinging pastie might feed fill free selues poore miserable kinde life wherein liue loath hearken thereunto royal amongst rest began louder euer cryde vnto thou vile naughty man thou false crafty merchant thou common coozener thou enemy god thou hast neither truth conscience thee thy honest dealing thy faire proceeding thy good vsage haue doe thee maruell thou bee rich thou take course others thou hast done mee thou hadst monies apparant world didst thou dare first crosse blot written seeking thereby defeate due afterwards impudently affirme giuen thee nothing thou didst know whence whither would much know either name canst thou alleage thy selfe hast thou false money coyne lye stampe see thou art ouertaken thy mischiefe blinded thine owne wickednesse thou hadst wit god iust punishment vpon thee either take away memorandum hide money see diuine maiestie hath beene pleased make good innocencie protect simplicitie downeright plainnesse wherewith committed money thy custodie presuming haue againe whensoeuer calld verily beleeue aduise trust thee money another sharker thy selfe one office without licence paying much rent whereof greatest part come regidor rest remaines renter end also may liue haue wherewithall discharge rent doest thou speake freely thou knowest concerning men may dare man presume speake oppose himselfe though neuer little offer question either life action make hold peace pestilence neuer suffer liue quiet force owne ease flie country men great place power presently fall feeling finde buscan la paja 〈◊〉 el oydo straw thine eare seeke hole thy coat prouerbe picke one quarrell thee either right wrong ouerthrow thee vtterly vndoe thee like vnto cuppingglasses fasten sit close hard thy skin neuer leaue drawing sucking till haue haled thee would haue taking till full hold could also tell thee man dare say blacke eye goe haue punisht whosoeuer offer fare vsually doth pipkins set full water ouer fire sooner begin boyle water runneth ouer put fire occasion thereof vnderstand yes marry doe may passe ouer thing better reason good angel guard free blowes would otherwise fall vpon rid trouble could tell thee likewise somewhat thou hast left men hanged haue cause heard see could say themselues euen men would plead stiffely heretofore fauour feare haue well content eat meat quiet hold tongue could tell thee besides would vnmaske men fare daintily men cost haue either nothing dogcheape making poore pay must pay fare worst time make full point leaue agentes consentientes instrument copartner themselues conclusion thou art worse thou doe much hurt thou doest damnifie one house alone whole country good counsell dost thou giue mee let mee wish thee friend make vse thy selfe thinkst thou perhaps saue thine owne finger burning take sacar la brasas con la mano del gato cat foote therewith rake prouerbe coales ouen thou knowest true hast thing else say speake selfe haue told thee know would willingly deale mee thou say est deale others haue minde come vnder lash suffice thee contrary decorum fitting greatnesse place quality haue inlarged selfe speaking already may well become mee willing oblige selfe anew sift liues diue doings good bee gotten thing runne along straine italy god bee thanked going spaine robbery vsed spaniard man knowledge esteeme know man otherwise make censure according prouerbe cloathes thou wert cicero himselfe shouldst goe ill clad thou shouldst longer cicero least scuruy cicero world would scorne count mad man wisedome learning world hauing much wealth much land another man may like dog goe shake eares without door like money currant pass thing wheresoeuer hee come neither offer thee chaire sit downe giue thee vpper hand shal see thee vvithout feather though thou bee rich apparelled vertue knowledge dayes little reckoning made thou bee gloriously set richly suted though thou neuer base groome euery man eye vpon thee euery man hat ready honour thee bee thou base vile dunghill yet bee couered ouer greene grasse many set themselues downe vpon recreate refresh themselues catulus catulus saying nonius minde hee saw nonius riding triumphant chariot stickt say deale dung doth cart carry giuing v thereby vnderstand dignity doe grace vicious catuls though bee many nonii nay wert thou good alchimie shall bee adored thee glorious gaudy glittering men doe iudge eye eare see heare outside looked inside looked rich rayment sound louder good report man considers thy knowledge thy wealth talke much thy vertue thy purse thy purse thou hast thou spendest well appointed well apparelled g owne fowre inch thicke folkes spanish word enxundia adeps porcinus interior pinguedo porci inueterata city knew make returne part whither euer haue like opportunity see againe inne lay best towne commonly called lhosteria di santa marta whither part nobleman gentleman vsually resort wee remained making merry spending money without selues spanish phrase 〈◊〉 sin besar tocar en cosa •… prouecho good point profit yet goe keeping thus ground wee came gaine ground clocke doth alwayes strike stay till houre come little little time creepes limited thereunto strike playd much money guest house company sake passe away time thing else vsing helpe mine owne fortune skill gaming sayavedra hand businesse vse set plough worke saue deepe fat ground hope plentifull haruest kept holidayes attendance great feast full boord poore pittance worth sitting downe well content hee spare labor losings getting could much best course thought proceed plainly sincerely yet common course amongst gamesters plaid small game went along leaden foot marking obseruing card fortune fauour crossecarding could light lucky encounter would giue little losse wind blew faire found good fortune comming towards neuer left following good lucke till swept vnto money boord fell hauing one day wonne matter hundred crown somewhat captaines hap command gally sit perceiud likt well manner play glad got money reading lookes great store crownes purse rather extreame want necessity gaue sixe doblones two coniuncture considering pouerty seemed vnto sixe thousand time one single royall man hundred nay thousand perhaps another time doe much good made thankfull acknowledgement fauour done beene much matter greater moment fell happily hauing afterwards vnderstood himselfe disease sicke griefe lay instant mine owne remedy likewise represented vnto quickly found make needle must knit net word effected desired spends nothing buyes hath need distributed likewise crownes amongst rest stander make better deuoted affectioned towards mee might leaue euery man well pleasd contented insomuch affable franke bountifull carriage grew credit good opinion amongst wonne heart got good w •… loue men old saying hee sowes quien bien siemora bien coge well prouerbe reapes well assure many conuersed would haue hazarded liues need beene wherewith found selfe iocond body lightsome heart comforted blood cleare spirit quickned cheekes fresh red rose mine eye sparkle lookt merrily laught ioy captaine called fauelo proper name giuen certaine mistresse hee sometimes serued willing still retaine remembrance beauty owne misfortune whole story whereof hee large related vnto dearly loued much made indearing sweetnesse disposition gentle behauiour gracefulnesse person commendable quality poysoned vaine false appearance drowned end desperate torment iealousie beastly thought still waiting vpon time forward would neuer suffer alone part continually embrace friendship greatest loue could whereupon intreated would pleased make vse person might way seruiceable vnto guest take fare though knew bid losse daily deepe furrowes better taking root new friendship acquaintance mine gone true course vertue might haue found hauen wherein haue harbourd selfe made nothing fraud deceit yet would alwayes laying thereby might bind surer vnto carryed selfe fairly cunningly many conuersed withall like hawkes made stoope lure within dayes name credit good amongst could battle largely vpon might haue receiued courtsie city beene willing make vse thereof whereupon partly partly ancient desire know something concerning selfe lest knowing might make take thought sicken dye griefe considering selfe good state handsome young fellow well clad good part good purse man whatsoeuer could hold disparagement vnto acknowledge mee kinsman sway guzman begin thinke vpon reuenge meant take kinsman earnest desire fully ashamed owne rich man kinsman though hee vicious ill giuen flye vertuous man haue winde finde stinkes pouerty need indeare poynt vnto common thing rich like vnto fire albeit belong different place rich compared fire onely prouided one particular roome yet notwithstanding many come neere vnto warme themselues though take much coale prouerbe thence ma fuego ma calor fire heate many shall see warming themselues fire rich man hall shall aske make whats businesse answer great businesse doe perhaps giue thing ala doest thou get curring fauour soothing vp crowching creeping vnto assisting day night base seruile office misspending time thou mightst better bestow gaining thy meate elsewhere true sir benefit selfe little yet choose come warme selfe sen̄or n house others doe others tell pray angry plainly tell fooles returne againe way many kindred came vnto mee euery one desiring make himselfe better knowne vnto offering seruice complementall manner befitting fashion one amongst rest onely sprinkled ouer little courtholywater good nothing sleightly couerd ouer ash false forgiuenesse shall offer blow occasion bellowes though neuer little soone discouers selfe coales kindle flame likewise liue without must recouer selfe hand mine mine owne proper industry kinsman haue sought repayre either willing hazard themselues fortune father absence buryed much word spoken thereof whereby remembrance wrong might haue beene reuiued holding lesser inconuenience two let sleepe thus quietly awaking giue occasion people publish shame favelo hearkned attentiuely euery word said would haue remitted businesse vnto end hee might make himselfe party reuenge became true friend doubting giue good satisfaction therein performe well selfe could wish albeit earnest vsing many violent intreaties might take burthen wholly vpon yet notwithstanding could bring giue way vnto telling neither iust fitting iniurie mine reuenge anothers onely end come natiue countrey spaine resolution neuer returne thither againe till selfe giuen enemie payment coyne know wherefore receiud adding withall doe great deale wrong thinke wanted either strength courage put selfe vpon businesse considering neerely concernes toucheth soule quicke hee heard say seeing thus peremptorily bent grew quiet would presse point farther though made reply thereunto yet told haue thing worth doe thing whole estate life honour may import seruice lay downe foot wholly disposed feare worst man knowes may happen case make surer worke souldiers shall assist least giue v leaue stand gaze see world go command v fa •… forth please shall wanting vttermost power afford best ayde giue content promise vpon mine honest word therefore put account set foot within galley italy would neuer faine shall able fetch thence would rather runne danger selfe though neuer great suffer least noble captaine said beleeue rest confident professe true heart vnto doth sincerely suggest thinke needeth much water driue mill first enemie rest secure suspect reuenge shall take secondly selfe sayavedra shall able well enough goe pretend accomplished desire businesse may carryed friend would right themselues vpon haply chance pursue make great content tooke knew haue mee along whereupon made good prouision diuers delicacy entertaine withall beene admirall galley calld seruant vnto told past betwixt captaine favelo prouerbe time •… remangar los braços hasta los codos man set •… himselfe roundly peece businesse tucke vp sleeues elbowes much knead great deale dowe mould make tart therefore must roundly set selues worke scarce ended discourse ready ioy leape skin gogg content tindar taken fire deere rouzd set hot following game holding backe presently sit councell concerning manner reuenge hauing well aduised selfe said thus vnto best profitablest least dangerous selues consist matter money desire said sayavedra chase better fifteene looke well play besides wound giuen v bodie quickly cured light vpon purse long healing paine v great dayes life goe said may fall handsomly worke first guzman go lot laid c •… ning kinsman thing done buy foure trunkes two thou shalt put part galley favelo shall appoint two thou shalt fill stone letting man know thou shalt cunningly vnespyde secretly conuay lodging put chamber stone shalt thou wrap vp close old rag wheresoeuer whithersoeuer shall carried tumbled fro may rattle make noyse charging haue great care leaue one empty place trash cramme close life also see heauier discretion shall thinke fitting making weigh six arroba peece come hundred halfe good weight also acquainted euery particular thing doe leauing well informed instruction giuen wheeles thus set going got beltrans house good old man vnckle conuersation began fall talke fearefull goe abroad anights regard trunkes lodging two especially worth looking full plate iewels good value good store crownes say truth litle wealth owne fault cozen said vnto harme come vnto blame bodie selfe house might well pleasd accept haue excused lodging feare albeit best towne yet haue inne though shall trauaile world ouer shall finde goodnesse honestie keepe thing safetie cozen young man know world doe old lad haue traueller must doe come inne great deale experience thing therefore let aduise neuer trust trunkes sure strong locke iourneying vpon way carry along pocket portmanteau good padlocke fasten staple chamber doore lodge either hoste wife child seruants haue two three keyes chamber shall sooner turne backe twinckling eye shall lose left within hardly recouer againe therefore sure make sure shall call mine hoste question seeke recouer owne law answer sure great deale cost trouble alleage themselues either carryed away selfe brought thing thither least knew thing came consigned vnto committed charge thine prouerbe meanes make owne inne en la posada •… ay cosa posada bring nothing sooner lost vnlesse looke narrowly vnto young gallant though please iouiall disposition loue good companie take house freely yet could wish fetch away trunkes thence bring hither leaue plate siluer shall serue necessarie vse eseritorio shall kept safe shall need afraid thereof long remaines house thankt much trunk beene worth million thinke conceiue much little lesse well regard seene vessel siluer likewise chaine gold thing brought thither also seemd desirous haue secured place safetie talke fell discourse touching mariage telling mariage fit yeeres wife longer staid without purpose settle selfe estate lose much time elder mariages leauing man child fatherlesse become poore miserable orphanes therefore •… minded churchman admit selfe one religious order better marry hand well respect mine owne comfort husbanding estate seruants th •… ugh neuer faithfull doe part want conduitpipes conuey away thy wealth scattering abro •… •… ike water vpon woman gaming feast •… ng •… xcesse apparell diuers thing seeing themselues 〈◊〉 put shift maintaine idle expences rob th •… ir master haue afterwards flie country laid manifold inconueniences single life n •… ke come vpon making large relation vnto good part gentlewoman wisht vnto vnderstood kinswoman motherside nobly richly descended defect supplied beauty haue likewise hothere afterwards came discouer mysterie young daughter shee mischance begotten young citizen genoa promised mariage afterwards cozen ng poore wen •… h married another told besides shee mother wealthy woman one would great stay helpe vnto especially gouernment house bringing vp child god blesse withall finde lesse louing vnto shee mine owne naturall mother set good face matter seemed like wondrous well hee said vnto mee telling whatsoeuer came could good counsell guide action without farther consultation selfe conueniencie •… ffer selfe might lose certaine benefice wa •… bestowed vpon making sure must necessarily resigne cozengermane mine motherssisterssonne liues sevill threw baite vnto nibble vpon wherewith entertaind time hee seeming well contented faire answer whilest earnestly talking businesse come sayavedra vnto rounding eare made show deliuerd long message seeing time speaking aloud said vnto answer make answering key replyde answer would haue make sir done marry beshrew finger said well saying doest thou know rome sevill doest thou see rash inconsiderate thou hast beene promising cannot performe goe carry great chaine giue tell haue doe doe excuse vnto signifie withall haue straind selfe farre abilitie reach say well sir replyde sayavedra god name shall able lugg along side huge chaine weighs seuen hundred crownes good gold thinke need hyre porter helpe presently made answer word doe bid get goldsmith shop take chaine along make choyce iewell shall thinke fit serue turne leaue chaine pawne shall worth haue pay interest lone take better course pawne fall short make crownes vnto shalt thou disingage thy selfe folly whereinto thou hast runne know remedie vnckle listned said pawnes said giue made answer sir hath foolish seruants must whether incurre many inconueniences falling still hundred thousand errours many mischiefes sleepebreaking care gentlewoman castile treating mariage gentleman owne country well knowne vnto especiall acquaintance owe beholdingnesse haue requested would furnish apparell iewels wedding neere hand cannot giue satisfaction would see sir tree trust vnto shift driuen cumply griefe blockhead man wit excuse knew hardly could doe kindnesse halfe iealous owne kinde heart inuited thereunto without making mee priuie vnto hath promised best furtherance cannot sinke head woman iudgement selfe request courtesie owne act make good without sirrah said man seeing cannot otherwise goe wait vpon doe shee shall direct old man seeing much moued seemed much offended man indiscretion said vnto cozen let trouble thing worth speaking therefore let disquiet come place cannot want friend small matter know well sir said noble kinsman doe friendly office lie power long haue cannot lacke amongst kindred know married furnish thing shee requireth solemnity dare intreat matter troublesome cannot choose vnto yet side earnestly requested supply gentlewoman occasion demanding courtesie kind commanding obligeth gentleman make best shift trie friend rather faile need yet know well enough iewels euery met withall publike assembly sole •… ne act shew face without blushing cozen said enough breake sleepe take farther care part kinsman trie amongst v doe doubt wee shall fit reasonable conuenient manner shall serue turne salue credit nay cozen haue sit little helpe trunkes may send hither please kist hand double kindnesse returning one condigne thankes either wit could inuent word expresse acknowledging great extraordinary fauour herein doe taking leaue soone euer came home lodging tooke order trunkes hauing three keyes peece well surely lockt strongly plated yron hand carried thither without adoe vnkle saw sayavadra enter house porter heeles heauy laden scarce able creepe along hauing well considered strength lock barres distrust mine hoast together weight heaft certainly assure himselfe •… full treasure whereupon asked sayavedra within trunkes th •… weighed heauy whereunto answered sir though master hath many thing great value yet worth rest parcell stone hath gathered together part italy choisest could light vpon wheresoeuer hee came whither carry know old man arched vp eiebrows wiped eye wondring see great store wealth putting owne hand safe custody vnder keeping say prouerbe 〈◊〉 de siete slaues 〈◊〉 à muy buen cobro seuen keyes trunkes remained sayavedra returned deuices wee might fetch another kinsman mine young rich great credit amongst resoluing goe home house pitch another net end whilst others complaine harme done stand laugh whilst others wept applaud •… l dinner told tooke ill seemed ashamed withall accusing strangenesse would dainty make scruple comming vp vnto soone came within house told doe nicenesse loath disquiet vnderstood taking rest like complement past time questioning health discoursing thing whilst dressing fitting cloathes citie last hee brought downe closet pretty little countinghouse hee beneath stayres sitting downe short pausing hee demanded wind blowne thither early sir said none saue onely may giue good morrow day end may thriue better night hath beene friend businesse sir come vnto intreat haue seruant house honest discreete fellow would pleased call hither sooner said hee presently ring bell sound whereof sooner heard two three came hastily running hauing beckned one amongst rest come vnto said vnto seruant steffanello shall doe whatsoeuer shall pleased command quoth shall intreat hand take paine goe along seruant sayavedra goldsmith take aloy weight value chaine haue sayavedra thereupon presently deliuered little boxe wherein caused made pure gold taking snewd vnto kinsman much pleased sight thereof neuer weary locking vpon handsome one beautifull massie extraordinary curious workmanship insomuch seemed vnto neuer seene like dainty delicate fine linkes smoothly polished without stone inammelling taken fill viewing returnd backe againe seruant two went together dispatch businesse whilst meane continued talking sometimes one thing sometimes another better passe time little came backe againe bringing little scrole paper goldsmith hand wherein set downe chaine gold finenesse two twenty carat according weight worth sixe hundred three fifty spanish crownes somewhat called sayavedra willed giue mee deliuered mee counterfaite one first opening boxe wherein lay taking forth fell afresh looking vpon putting anon boxe still kept open said vnto sir farther intreat hand followeth night since haue beene bitten play gentleman citie themselues worse haue gotten matter fiue thousand royal haue challenged play greater game willing follow good fortune last make triall good lucke may may venture little get much kind gaming doth wholly manner consist handsome carriage businesse gamesters may well lose winne would find selfe limited stinted play chance lose runne money able come againe vpon fresh supply recouer lost lucke serue get vpon albeit thanke god lacke money hauing home vnkles house fiue thousand crownes yet may meddle soone certaine letter shall come hither hand daily expect sevill cannot houre prolong either payment mine owne departure rome setling good benefice either vpon selfe cozengermane mine shall stand best vnkles liking submitting selfe direction may dispose discretion shall thinke fit neither iust conuenient breake offer touch summe lest might want occasion vse may much rather forbeare doe need make vse iewels plate like dead commodity lie good nothing lay pawne dead lift yet vnlesse vrgent occasion extreame want force thereunto loath part much lesse put away losse many often doe haue chaine haue seene viewd know worth shall desire secresie would willingly incurre censure vnthrift men talke forced giue account trifling toyes would pleased furnish sixe hundred crownes vpon chaine paying interest short tearme shall vse assuring selfe whether winne lose shall fayle paid due time wherein chance faile may pay selfe chaine end shall leaue howsoeuer world goe may gainer though loser likewise told vpon like occasion pawned certaine piece new plate richly gilt vsd ill manner returned vnto mee fit serued honest man boord forced sell hauing one penny allowed fashion therefore auoiding another losse intreated doe fauour chaine might remaine still owne hand without posted ouer one another hee made show hee take halfe well hand small courtesie offer pawne clapping downe couer boxe shut sodainly consignd ouer vnto forcing hand vowing protesting would meanes receiue kindnesse refused accept chaine besides vse weare oft massie heauy mee doe courtesie keepe long sure would safe well vsed adding withall mortall many thing might occurre vnto stranger fit conuenient hee therein satisfie desire vpon word earnest instance made accepted perceiued galley much wagg hearing beating oares least noyse world beene greatest solitude minde man could imagine fully awakened going put cloathes captaine come cabbin tell doubled cape noli farre faire winde fine weather heart could wish still continue thus fauourable vnto v much contrary full teeth v shall heare hereafter fortune alwayes prosperous moone hath crescent waynings much pleasing smile much sowre frownes shee change copie countenance onely desire whilest wee guzmans conceit kinsman genoa making voyage know mine hoste thought hee saw returned first night lodging second rest could heare newes thinking selfe lamentation would make many cold shaking fit ague would haue want warme blanket many couerlets would cast vpon yet giue none hospitall diligent search would make seuerall coniectures become disputing themselues whether bodie murtherd make themselues master wealth whether beene wounded quarrell imagined selfe conceiued right gone along galley cleane hope humane remedie began thinke selfe shrewdly flea would trouble many faire night begin consider haste made vnrip trunkes might saue themselues harmelesse euery one first alledging antelation time prioritie pitched selfe round v cloud aegyptian cloud blacke darke hell hauing lost comfort light lost likewise hope safetie especially saw storme whit allayd rather increased vpon v wherefore better auoyding many danger whereinto reason tempest like runne gaue present order hang lanterne might better see sea began swell lifted one waues high heauen aga ne abasing pride tumbled downe low opened bosome sea wide might see sand lay bottome faine appoint another assist helme expert pilot indeed knew guide rudder haire mastersmate caused tyde fast chayre post neere vnto poope resolued either dye place without remouing thence keepe galley aliue set safetie whilest skilfull mariner labouring put deliberation execution often demanded great danger much often willing heare see blindsighted wee would rather giue credit proceeded mouth saw owne eye represented nothing death vnto v lying tongue seemed afford v like comfort doth physitian sorrowfull afflicted father question touching health life sonne whether likely dye disease whether dead already tell god thanked mending hand like manner mastersmate making answer vnto v cheere v vp put v heart would bawle aloud vnto v que todo eranada tush nothing therefore good comfort heart indeed telling v told v truth nothing came winde torne sayles fitter one whole peece rent rag grew higher higher still forced clap treo kinde round sayle make vse remedie repayre losse yet might desist vse meanes could thought might make best good making vertue necessitie made good shift could clapping couple oares place guiding therewith galley besides danger great deale toyle labour shall able expresse halfe nay least part vnto eye saw eares heard doe know tongue speake say light tongue yet sure shall hardly meet men beleeue many vowes make many inuocations saint euery one calling greatest famousest owne countrey various deuotions generall recourse prayer childish foolish heare word come mother ò sweet mother many abuse many absurdity committed amongst confessing themselues one another could ghostly father power absolue others loud voyce made confession sinnes vnto god wherein offended thought god deafe thicke hearing would stretch throat high heauen perswading themselues perhaps force breath send soules packing instant vp vnto heauen desperate wofull manner poore weatherbeaten galley endure misery together till next day following brightnesse sunne clearing skie began recouer breath ioy sorrow turned mirth cheering hartning vp one another certainly cannot denyed danger attend vpon death alwayes feared still neerest vnto v wee thinke may well scape much feare storme sensibly apprehend danger thereof stood feare contrary winde new rigging vp galley carryed backe againe genoa sea shame wrought vpon made say selfe saw wind blew sea raged rest fare worse sake ionas tempest raisd might raise vp repentance sayavedra became seasicke fell shrewd burning feuer sayavedra fall sicke feuer run mad shortly grew besides himselfe would haue grieud man heart moued much compassion see thing foolery vttered sometimes storme greatest danger others confessing sinnes would cry loud voyce guzman de alfaraches ghost ghost go thus wandring vp downe world whereat made often laugh feare though haue vented thing vnhappily saw mad regarded said yet would leaue talking flash would fall ripping vp life bolte fit formerly recounted vnto concerning course taken composing thousand extrauagancies chance heard man talke promising performe pilgrimage monserrate thither would leade telling station wedding beene dresse like french cooke thousand seuerall wayes laughed though much pittied mee see state wherein tooke pleasure spake thing himselfe beene true guzman indeed briefe shrewdly beaten growne extreame weary late storme night following went good houre take rest see could recouer old debt former lost sleepe v weary drowsie galley batterd torne poope sayavedra rising vp franticke fit lept open place rudder split v sea could neuer sayavedra drownes himselfe set eye though mariner kept watch soone heard flownce fall presently cryde hombre la mar bodie fallen water whereupon began presently coniecture must need vpon inquiry finding wanting sought recouer would poore sayavedra buried sea much lamenting misfortune seeking could comfort made show beene exceeding sorry god knowes true next day got vp betimes morning wholly spent receiuing condolings made vnto done dolefull fashion beene brother kinsman neerest dearest friend world bewayling great losse sustained threw himselfe sea carryed away trunkes likewise god blesse mischance said selfe misfortune doubt shall easily ouerpasse knew comfort ente taine withall diuert griefe verily beleeue wonderfull sorry put seeming heauinesse sought bring feigned last called one beene condemned galley studious great louer curiosity come bring certaine booke along written owne hand captaine taking turning ouer leafes carelesse kinde fashion lighted chance vpon notable storie hapned sevill returning backe booke owner willd reade vnto thereupon required attention granted vnto began reade followeth recommending first vnto well strangenesse truth sevill famousest citie spaine metropolis true strange storie merchant sevill andaluzia merchant stranger well borne rich honest whose name miçer iacobo two son one daughter noble gentlewoman citie carefully trayned vp vertue good manner kinde learning appertayning liberall art shee bred vp needle wherein curious workmanship shee excell gentlewoman part meere bungler vnto reason shee exquisite singular ein childhood shee beene bred vp monasterie nunnes reason mother dyde childbed shee borne regard good fortune mutable vncertaine merchant men carry wealth men purse commit estate disposition winde weather halfe foot difference betwixt making marring inriching vndoing fell two sonnes returning home indie bringing along good store gold siluer come within sight barre san lucar thinking selues safe beene say within doores th •… owne house arises huge storme sodaine sea inraged boysterous blustrings windes begin swell lo •… ke big vpon billowes insomuch poore vnfortunate ship set vpon two fierce cruell enemy miserably tossed fro violently carryed course last vnable longer resist rage terrible tempest shee desperately ranne selfe vpon rocke terriblenesse blow open wombe cleaue cleane midst split rib thousand peeces men good cast away vtterly lost neuer either seene heard heauy newes great losse whose nimblenesse lye onely wing came flying father care deepe melancholy sodainely seazed vitall part griefe thereof within dayes also dyed daughter remained couent hauing lost wealth father mother brother remaining thus abandoned left shift selfe wonderfully sensible wofull estate might likewise haue much troubled man whatsoeuer though neuer wise saw short time might manner runne reckoning one day shee lost many reall comfort hope remedie allay misery shee much desired become nunne shee wept bitterly tooke pittifully would haue grieued man heart see sorrowfull lamentation shee made ceased designes began sorrowes ceased plenty began want ceased regalo word large extent signifies thing may giue woman content meat drinke cloathes sport whatsoeuer else may delight regalos began trouble went daily increasing vpon shee knew world doe able maintaine herselfe nunnerie albeit nunnes wisht exceeding well bare great loue affection noblenesse condition qualitie affabilitie ciuilitie goodnesse nature sweetnesse behauiour commendable part condoling much present necessitie pouertie desirous shee continue still amongst yet could possibly bring passe will subordinate superiour prelate owne choice neither could effect desired shee continue longer amongst shortly notified vnto either leaue house minde stay forthwith assigne dowry shee able want meanes cumply second condition shee forct entertaine former poore distressed maid cunning needle curious hand kinde workes white blacke silke gold ordering colour giue true life perfection whatsoeuer shee tooke hand fame thereof spred ouer citie summe must adde vertues soule beauty face height excellencie part bodie answerable minde seene would verily haue thought nay almost sworne two cunning exquisite artizans emulation one spent spirit imployde vtmost skill framing singular creature shee perfect peece beauty goodnesse shee might draw beholder eye obiects though vnworthy looking attract selfe yet put together word doe exceed excesse nothing compared retirednesse life mortification flesh fast prayer penance shee vnwitting shee thrust wide world shee nunnerie shelter lay open venue fortune shee better stand vpon guard fearing world murmuring occasion might bring scandall vpon reputation one wonderfull tender iealous honour shee got lodging shee companie diuers vertuous religious young maydens without suspition least shadow ill intention hauing helpe meanes liue saue sweat browes labour finger end shee liud frugally keeping herselfe within bound giuing good example vertue young damosel time archbishop citie great desire haue curiosity made certaine wrought chalicecloathes spanish word corporales though signifie thing belong body yet strictly taken linnen cloathes laid vpon altar whereupon mass place bodie sauiour iesus christ vnder formes bread wine represent vnto v sindone fine linnen sheet wherein wrapt sacred bodie blessed sauiour •… sepulchre vide stephanum durandum de ritibus ecclesiae lib 1 c 22 neat towel handsome napkin dainty handkerchers like wrap hoste bordered historicall worke best fit vse whereunto •… hey serued haue done neere life art could attaine vnto much inquirie made none found could doe thing halfe well dorotea gentlewoman called vpon good report heard sought recommended worke vnto care promising shee well paid paine shee considered herselfe curious peece worke shee must make choyce best purest brightest finest gold threed shee could get money whatsoeuer cost know best bestow know best buy shee herselfe taking neighbour friend along went seeke ware amongst goldbeater shop sevill make sell kinde commodity hap come young man shop handsome fellow well behaud newly set vp himselfe get better custome stroue haue shop well furnisht indeed better choyce rest neighbour traded kinde youg man shee willing buy gold shee occasion vse worke well shee found fit turne likewise excuse herselfe labour going oft doores shee much money would haue done deed hauing store little giuen begin worke withall shee told master shop shee would bestow little money shee would come againe worke went money came young occupyer beheld beauty composed countenance young mayden well obserued manner speech honest cariage modest behauiour fell good liking farre loue least could haue found heart haue giuen gold shee occasion vse great matter instant deliuered vp soule vnto perceiuing shee forbore buy much otherwise shee would willingly haue done shee wanted money embracing occasion hand much gaine farther custome expresse affection bare vnto draw good opinion suffering part vpon termes said vnto mistresse gold good looke turne picke choose like carry away much haue vse please pay well spare rest shall pay little little shall receiue hand set worke young man seemed kinde courteous ware could finde fault good themselues could wish desire dorotea made present payment much shee hauing made choyce much gold shee thought good needfull shee carried away leauing name street whither either come send remayning behinde done presently went way poore young man louestrucken departure pittifully wounded amorous arrow farre himselfe rest tossed fro various thought hauing braines beaten many troublesome vnquiet imagination loue almost burst heart neither eat drinke thing else might seeme beare name life altogether soule occupied contemplation rare incomparable beauty mirrour vertue troublesome life bad death knowing world doe last away prison know freed woman sent thither ouer night answer made shee beat foot ground stampt despight anger verily perswade himselfe well wit vnlesse beene dreame day past till next came accustomed houre come thither assistente himselfe person attended two tenientes sate seat iustice willd claudio called forth woman imprisoned brought according owne confession also keeper approud themselues man knew sabina slaue finding nothing said set libertie yet freed claudio paid soundly came home found greatest part house good burnt together sister one honest one accompanied dorotea house found dead bed despensero besides three seruants affront honour generally published throughout whole citie afflict minde manner oppresse heart strong apprehension thereof hee fell grieuously sicke desiring health hee might take worldly comfort onely hee might liue doe penance heynous sinne hee committed corrupting good creature hee recouered sicknesse without making one acquainted therewith hee retyred himselfe top mountaine desert place holy course life hee ended dayes betaking himselfe religious order saint francis dorotea remayned husband peace loue teniente like filthy fellow without doblones ought gaue without reuenge ought hee could take bonifacio honest man vntoucht honour sabina knew affront done dyed within dayes iust god workes well doth know punish wrong offered innocent storie entertainment passe away time brought faire winde spaine little longed hauing lost anchor ordnance oares helme carryed away sailes rent tackling torne hauing nothing left sea swallowed vp onely left aliue ought iustly haue perished disimbarke barcelona telling friend captaine favelo made vow storme would stay three night part spaine till come sevill visit image lady del valle offered vp deuotions made certaine promise consecrate thing vnto happy escape tempest grieud soule lose companie could doe otherwise feared lest genoa would come pursuit skiffe like vessell bought three beast carry selfe trunkes entertained seruant giuing goe iourney man knowing contrary tooke leaue euer end second booke second part guzman de alfarache rogve second part life guzman de alfarache third booke wherein relateth rest lewd roguish life time returned spaine till condemned galley must leaue chapter guzman de alfarache hauing taken leaue captaine favelo telling goe sevill make saragoca peru statute gotam college otherwise called hospitall fooles man particular end knowne himselfe hath minde grace lye men use grace lye bring forth witness credit falshoods seekes fountaine lake stone mettall tree hearbe wherewith proues vntruthes presently alledgeth authoritie hath said nothing stand reason made good haue insight naturall philosophie manner quoteth thousand witness man tell lye layes burthen men shoulder runne contrary course selfe lying shall tell lye affirme seemes ought taken apollonius tianeus take vpon himselfe sayes hath seene stone called pantaura queene stone 〈◊◊◊〉 〈◊〉 •… ne pant •… beare abort stone may well great •… e reason compare riche •… see vertue thing shall finde ri •… e rich drawes vnto selfe preserueth possessor thereof manner poyson doth bringeth mighty thing passe fierce cruell beast ouercomes tread downe stand way command make euery thing stoope power •… ubjcteth earth therein rich fiercest beast 〈◊〉 •… fish though neuer great resist rich least fish hide highest mountaines haue foundation maketh dry hidden sand sea doth couer bottomlesse abysse altitude hath abased difficulty hath ouercome impossibility hath facilitated danger hath shee wanted safetie aduersitie hath shee found friend thing hath shee desired shee hath obtayned law hath shee made hath beene obeyed venomous poyson onely like basiliske beheld v killeth body bare desire onely coueted destroyeth soules damning euer bottomlesse pit hell yet shee herselfe treacle harme receiue counterpo •… use 〈◊〉 venome wherewith shee infecteth soules conscience possesseth rich antidote pretious marry mayde might happely make loue vnto drudge kitchen scoured pot pannes may euer spake well intertained mee time quite forgot selfe space two houres interchanged talke long seeming vnto one short minute loe offend thine eares whilst thus pratling come deuillish curre one belzebubs whelpes seeme flew eagerly forth one neighbour house thereabouts fell barking balling loud possible v heare vnderstand one another window high woman spake low pretty fresh wind abroad dog lay spend mouth fast willing remedy fault groaped foot stone might throw finding cast downe mine eye ground might perceiue neere vnto wall little copped blacke thing tooke bee stone presently catcht vp hand stone nothing hard guzman besmeard quickly found besmeared finger sought hastily shake giuing flirt hand sold greyhound chap ii guzman de alfarache go sarago •… come madrid turnes merchant married breakes credit turnes bankrupt treat woman subtill trickes inconuenience counterwritings remedy soone came home got well seigning would refresh selfe would haue seruant acquainted disgracefull accident wil •… draw vp two bucket water hee done one washt hand mouth hauing almost rubbed skinne either yet rest
