compounded withall money much lesse inioyne mariage vnlesse formerly giuen word faithfull promise witness case fittest meanes personall punishment either lesse according qualitie delict cause might handled king atturney general might hope pardon left boysterous offendors assuring selfe meanes men would haue feare woman shame would often doe commit like sinnes treachery refuge taken hauing hope remedie helpe left vnto would leaue lewd course life hastie vndoe themselues others wench goe good shee vrge perhaps shee haue wherewithall liue shee picke liuing disgracefull dangerous deceit thousand farre honest wayes woman liue pitie think come pleads thus lack poore woman woman weake creature weake simple suffer themselues ouercome much facilitie aptnesse beleefe men much falshood promise therefore ought much fauoured pityed v facile nature men false promise haue wrought much •… e confesse plea true either taught knew hand themselues facilitie fault ought easily wonne would learne better keepe cabinet close depart pretious iewell vpon good tearmes foolish confidence hath vndone many woman like vndoe vnlesse looke little better themselues destroying confidence like vnto faith without good workes hath sent thousand packing hell let woman therefore shee wise depend vpon men promise neuer faire promise passion performe delayes seldome neuer satisfie expectation woman therefore say shall trust man faith promise shall vpon false assurance surrender vp copiehold hand let blame bodie herselfe shee afterwards cozened deluded another kinde iniustice world somewhat neere nature would require reformation shall haue seene oftentimes haue two fellowseruants lodge together one house agreed vpon businesse willing enioy shee like silkeworme continues three silkewormes make three sleepe awaking first feed falling againe sleepe till begin worke ball neuer leauing till shut vp themselues ball consume thems •… lues vngorging sli •… nesse whereof forme ball covatr pag 327 sleep till last master come vnawares vpon take manner thereupon layes hold vnfortunate seruant neither tasted creame cheese milke sowre whey cast dog swine put prison keep poore soule long till last growing desperate driuen marry increase miserie condemne pecuniarie punishment whole linage sold shirt able pay see himselfe thus vndone first forced marry whether hee haue little hath taken violently torne throat go one way shee another runnes country turnes rogue shee stayes home turnes whore pray see proper mariage wise worthy sentence great good come prouision made reforming abuse doubt would doe much good proue profitable commonwealth paid punishment sinne wherein offended price meat whereof tasted prouided house put guz •… prouides house 〈◊〉 thing order withdrew selfe thither much afraid giue v due acknowledgement sinnes verily perswade selfe time finished life soule assuredly gone downe hell beene condemned fry eternall fire vsurers wicked generation viper haue neyther conscience themselues acquainted action euen thought secret heart giue leaue giue gentle nip make see owne perdition put great confusion shall know world •… themselues know ye also know shall speake truth must plainly tell rich cause digression greedy de •… rich ill gotten misery liues soule one certainly bad case hence commeth passe couetous men much deuoted vnto rich incurre infinite trouble peril hazard therefore free himselfe danger better secure himselfe crate thebane famous philosopher vndaunted crate throwes good sea courage bound vp one pack fardell together gold precious iewels great fury threw sea saying get gone ô ye rich bottome sea lest drench deepe rather drowne drowne great philosopher leaue herein methought ill much better done distributed good amongst poore gaue v therby vnderstand great trouble gold bringeth seemed farre lesser inconuenience remaine poore liue many griefes affliction rich occasion possesse thing enter consideration minde rich enter fearfull prison within see men imprisoned laden iron bound chaines fetterd manacled girt necke collar iron wherewith brought iudge many affliction torment miserable wretched men thus incarcerated compassed strong wals hard chain much oppr •… ssed much heauier shackle ioue rich bound abound compasiion misery thus fast bound painfully laden bolt manacle collar chaines iron fee •… hand neck whole body throughout much pitie taken rich see much richer hee wealth hee hath good thing heart desireth yet account rich wealthy man rather wretched vnfortunate besides prison wherein liues miserable findes himselfe attended guarded barbarous cruell keeper loue rich happen thou fall time hand getting clutch may keepe thee safe haue thee thou maist escape haue three foure strong doores shut vpon thee many great chaines make sure besides lock keyes know many double ward bit picklockes world euer haue beene shall shall able open doores set thee free thence yet wretched creature blinded pleasure take imprisonment neuer thinke vpon seeke get content continue dayes life bona •… enture saith hath set affection gold hardly withdraw loue king dauid saith soule cleaueth vnto dust belly trayleth ground fastned glued earth vnfolding thereby affection haue earthly thing seldome neuer rich possessed without man setling affection vpon easie thing haue wedged thing world much much strongly heart man knit vnto glosse saith difficultie wee despise lothnesse leaue safest surest way neyther loue keepe therefore kingly prophet said rich increase set thy heart vpon true hurtfull soule dangerous body therefore sauiour christ much pitying lamenting possessing heartily loue said woe vnto rich yee haue already receiued comfort iames likewise great deale griefe sorrow doth bewaile lament kind men saying goe yee rich men weep howle misery shall come vpon rich corrupted garment moatheaten gold siluer cankred rust shall witnesse shall eate flesh fire haue heaped treasure together last dayes behold hyre labourer haue reaped downe field kept backe fraud cryeth cryes haue reaped entred eares lord sabaoth yee haue liued pleasure earth beene wanton yee haue nourished hart day slaughter yee haue condemned killed iust doth resist bemourne therefore misery wherein rich shall end anguish vexation spirit comfort shall forsake shall sleepe sleepe awake finde hand empty dauid saith rich men turne fooles much wealth become ambitious vaine giue themselues ouer thousand vice suffer thousand sharpe iourneyes many troublesome toylings get rich haue got haue daily fit feare trembling lest may chance lose imagination losse causeth extreame sorrow braines still working vnderstanding neuer taketh rest sauiour said man treasure also heart wretched man thou dost thing world bad thee loue money seeke make themselues rich fall thousand temptation many snare deuill hath laid intrap root euill couetousnesse causeth v commit sacrilege theft murder rapine author symony causer v •… ring contract vngodly gaine thousand deceit fraud breaking deed word periuries peruerting iustice vnquenchable fire desire rich insatiable lust much insatiable tell euer yet see rich man satisfied heare say enough hee hath got desired whorings publike view balance wherein thou didst put honor thine owne ere long shall weighed best take heed speake lest may chance haue head broken labour feared husband past shame towards god man shall thinke reclaime shee foolery know take shall neuer able doe liue therefore let alone also marry see wealth beginnes waste seuenth know themselues yet pretend onely cause marry young loth haue honour lyable lauish tongue euill disposed people also lest person might run hazard rape like violence well two euils least god hath part mariages may better said deuils contract thing reputed eyther good ill according end whereunto directed knowne action determined defined leade thereunto bearing loue alwayes end selfe thing conduce guide v vnto mariage loued loue beare vnto mariage onely vse meanes accomplishing desire kinde woman doe walke directly right way goe somewhat serue owne turnes running byway owne ruine therefore hold good mariage indeed hath end saue serue god holy honourable estate god doth permit confesse mariages must tell withall deuill hath share least good holy calling thou makest hellish mariage instituted quietnesse comfort thou loust thou neyther hast art willing haue thou dost rather intangle thy foot thou maist sooner trip fall ground let virgin widow make butt shoot lawlesse liberty freeing herselfe father gardians subiection let led along vaine loue let cast away filthinesse followes sensuall appetite doe doe let assure themselues goe ill one husband shall proue good kinde vnto themselues thinke wish shall make slaues •… yed vnto shall vp like hawkes shall lead euill life shall waste away wealth yet leaue great charge child vpon purse shall still empty trouble shall come vpon husband shall gamester whoremaster shall thus abused shall haply dye vnder hand ariseth euill end proposed themselues eyther seeking aduance themselues beyond qualitie flaunt beyond meanes forementioned reason sole cause ruine idoll baal adored put trust god thought could succour free defend case time haue true need indeed helpe shall find ought feared able send downe fire consume enemy comfort hath giue thou adorest idol thou shalt deliuered none day trouble euen water themselues trench like vnto elia though filled afresh barrell barrell yet shall moysture licked vp fire know yee mariages god ordaineth enter onely shew selues obedient haue consulted misery may befall life man matter fire shall come downe heauen say loue god charitie shall consume dry vp many water tribulation quicke fire make speedy riddance trouble presenting sacrifice diuine maiestie onely assist v grace world crowne v glory world come let serue end sermon let v returne againe mariage pleasd god would neuer beene serud six yeares mariagegalley short time would beene lesse wherein wee wanted money maintaine v scantling clothofgold kirtle richly bordred imbroydered sold turnd gold least thread though bigger spider escapt meltingpot yet past reasonable handsome kirtle still world went v old end spent gone could inch saw water come vp aboue chinne could long hold must needes sinke would meanes consent sell thing eyther mine owne credit furnish shop would reach farre one farthingworth radish found selfe strait aduising fatherinlaw willing take somewhat rigerous course god send v good night thereupon began set loud throat like pig offered sticke matter beene moment indeed insomuch neighbour came running helpe many house could hold saw truth businesse god would haue thing nothing perceiued reason doe rested quiet went wayes yet shee leaue lamentation might well haue serud turne hundred holyweekes inforced might fall foule let alone leaue self might bound hearing answer word deed tooke cloake threw shoulder got mee adoores leauing alone giuing thereby free liberty say doe would till grow weary could madded rest saw mee set light said seemed make little reckning may truly confesse vnto time liued cannot accuse selfe euer taxe least iniury done vsd kindnesse husband could vse wife god shall bestow wealth vpon v pleaseth take away alters case man cannot doe withall lye hand neyther power goe increasing rich neyther stop course man tyde ebbing hee cannot termed vnthrift bad husband vseth best endeuors others doe get wherewithall liue good honest fashion prouide well hee wife child family bad husband spends meanes vpon woman throwes away play wanted yet whereof sucke hungry sauour porrige shooinghorne •… w 〈◊〉 hardnesse four bread wee also certaine wilde oliues allowed v 〈◊〉 •… ate many feare setting teeth edge •… r wine like gaue sauiour vpon crosse compound stuffe tasted worse sowre beere shall tell care tutor wife notifie vnto v fasting dayes euery weeke end might looke collation call breakefast surety shee might erre shee would vsually say two one shall tell commutation supper dinner put together would make vp reasonable nunchions giue v weighed iust euen would weigh saffron allotting euery one foure ounce pennyweight ouer casuist thus size v know necessitie much would iust serue turne regard long study short dinner none best reason finde fault seeing vsd alike entred like fellowlabourers one selfesame vineyard euery man must haue one allowance one hauing another food gaue v well fitted proportioned sustenance limited scanted little ill drest schooleboyes poorer sort schollers could haue dyet worse fashion haue plentifully furnisht meat stinting mindes belly wise man showing himselfe therein wise doth abhorre full dish feed sparingly may sooner better retyre himselfe study hogg horse fatnesse well become commendable men leane slender grosse men commonly grossewitted besides haue filthy wallowing gate vnfit fight either themselues friend kinde vnweldie lumpe vnprofitable masse flesh bone able vse manly exercise whereas see quite otherwise leane laden fat willing graunt end might denie manifest truth wit little meat naught quickly shortens life man may liue thriue study lost labour drudge booke falcon pray euer brought field flie first fed shee came greyhound dogge euer put course hunt put victual belly must kept reasonably high come hungerstarud field neither one maintayne flight course must kept good state must student meane thing meane best grant meatmoderators gutmathematicians fit feed fulnesse cram belly full hold yeeld againe side fast till grow feeble therewith leggs able great beard good wife pen̄aranda sit conuerse boyes yet comfort vnto mee likewise boorders amongst v bigge lubber almost selfe say truth wee lesser frye mixed one amongst another like pea beanes else shee could cleanely lay hand commodity kept apart themselues growne pretty quantitie •… ee would sell vnto v payd already faigning haue bought well knew shee stolne shee wash linnen shee would making thy meale one poore morsell make hold longer turne doores take another shall finde come must forced serue selfe shee gone tell come vnto manner man ill life shee led cause shee quit herselfe seruice word hee serued must winke fault must make replyes besides must let doe lift let haue owne yet scarce content remember marryed receiued maidseruant house shee beastly filthy slut idle drone altogether vnfit seruice turnd away shee beene three dayes tooke another seemed good health shee came vnto falling sicke old disease shee onely continued mee two dayes went backe againe hospitall whence shee came presently third neat seruant great theefe willing roste conie shee cut peeces stues brought onely table head leggs wing disposing rest shee thought good roguery shee stayd mee onely day next morning put away neighbour saw three seruants six dayes euery one went away mumbling mattens murmuring mee bad report went mee laid hundred fault charge discredit sernice shamefull vile manner twenty dayes faine take dyet common victualing •… ose woman would drawne house reason euill speech giuen mee till time friend mine brought mee one worse rest shee would loue euery body denie none would aske question stallion came amisse shee wheele easily turned euery hand would presently haue put away durst feare ill spoken neighbour tell truth cause held lesser inconuenience two leaue house hyre another street farther keeping till mee would dismisse home shee would abroad abroad shee would home •… ee haue nothing doe shee call flaxe giue shee say miserable great husband neither notice eyther dastardlinesse feare cannot say whether carelesly setpurpose shee tript chapin saue falling presently opened armes louingly receiued raising vp cheeke hapned beene done chance leane thence put little mettall added farther boldnesse word faigning staid behind able goe faster went discoursing together loues speake onely mine owne shee laught sayd making selfe merry therewith better shee would haue seeme intertaine passe away time mother crafty slye subtill thing sought sonnesinlaw daughter desirous husband mislike man gaue line enough till led along nose within owne doores thus randome losing himselfe good opinion world rector notice hereof taking compassion mee sought apply remedy cure disease therein rather hurt good seeing selfe hardly set vpon side much oppressed mine owne proper passion hauing power resistance burst forth open rebellion following vnruly appetite bone reason like many prop haue serud strengthen weaker vnderstanding broken strangely split shut vp loues strongest prison let haue iust cause yeeld selfe captiue vnto let croft thwarted designes thing conspiring together hinder execution desire let sit downe giue counsaile man would hearken vnto knew better meanes good left thought would best remedy mother offered house shee woman good credit kind trading good quicke returnes gained wherewithall maintaine backe belly made exceeding much shee ready vpon occasion serue could imagine kindnesse willing doe kept neat sweet handsome made reckning respect lord master thought world would still haue lasted sought auoid venome euill tongue vaine raised already beene true perhaps might haue miscarried pardon gentleman married man said ill accompt haue giuen many yeares study much good learning vpon point taking order attaine degree schooles might least haue beene able haue read another day lecture open schooles publike professor doctor chayre might haue beene easie haue done considering good conceit come height labour painestaking haue receiued reward take mine ease toyle stone rolled downe forced like sisiphus beginne world anew fall afresh worke doe thou therefore consider often thought vpon often doth god put spoake wheele doth crosse designes making proue vaine fruitlesse altar made ready wood laid vpon vpon isaac sword drawne arme lifted vp high letting fall strike stroke euen till hindred execution good doe thee haue already told course tooke childhood came end carrying basket manly year make mansion inne common victuallinghouse god grant trouble may haue end foot may fixed chap v guzman de alfarache leaues study go liue madrid hee carry wife whence banished hauing •… apt bachelor diuinity degree master prophane loue bee supposed become licentiat hauing already farre proceeded therein may good licence true professor thereof permitted speake much know concerning good experience haue thereof dare boldly boast selfe one best proficients euer bred vp schoole loue goe define many hauing said much repeat lesson hath already beene said ouer thousand time loue totum toto contrary effect say thereof lesse shall vnderstood yet wee shoote one arrow amongst rest haue endeuoured hit marke piercing making way eye heart poysoned shaft deliuered hand archer neuer stayes till come center guest great deale earnestnesse selues inuite receiued house easily put childe longs euery thing see euermore erres giue wing show lightnesse apprehending beloued v bringeth v vnfortunate end onely go blindly worke speed best lightly wooes likely winnes wench though bee effect loue yet bring passe ere euer execute shall want patience hope feare hazarding person wit word modesty demand iudgement making choyce bridle restraine inconsiderate action consideration free v danger fell loue first sight taken looke dart flew forth eye comming thicke force vpon mee presently yeelded thereupon became captiue transcursion time needfull case would necessarily inferre affirmation hold bee error euer since fall first parent leauen whole lumpe masse mankind made sowre corrupted hereditary vice frame humane horologe broaken put order one whole wheele left answer one another spring remaining whereby giue motion vtterly spoiled rent torne piece wholly frame order beene cleane contrary thing differing first setled estate wherein god created alteration truer course arising man disorderly disobedience hence grew blindnesse vnderstanding forgetfulnesse memory defect disorder appetite deprauednesse action deceit sens weaknesse strength paine torment greatest delight pleasure cruell squadron sore fierce enemy soone god hath infused soules body incompassing v euery side violently set vpon v hotly assaile v sweet enticement sin faire promise false apparances foule filthy pleasure ouerthrow goodnesse v taint corrupt soules put quite good course created may said soule composed two contrary part one rationall diuine naturall corruption forasmuch flesh side whereto incline weake fraile full imperfection sinne hauing wholly infected cleane throughout hence come passe imperfection disorder naturall vnto v great extreame man cannot account conquest fortior est qui se qua •… qui fortissima vincit 〈◊〉 greater subduing passion great courage whosoeuer resist bring vnder regard mortall warre infernall enmity still betweene reason appetite appetite perswadeth v vnto agreeable nature doth best like please v thing quality take pleasure treat haue desire obtaine whereas contrary reason like vnto schoolemaster may better correct v go alwayes rod reprehension hand condemning ill wee commit wee like little child play tr •… ant flye schoole feare correction wee doe amisse runne amouching eyther aunt house grandfather wee made much suffered play wanton thus often alwayes reason remaineth ought reason many time made subiect sensuall appetite vassallage slauery appetite hath gotten great power dominion ouer v filthy loue vehement violent powerfull proper solely wholly sutable disposition glued wedged nature breathe liue proper vnto v must necessitie follow hardest passion represse terriblest enemy wee haue deale withall strength greatest force come vpon v assault v subdues v albeit true reason holding shee doth ancient place preheminence wont sometimes hinder great wisedome valour sodaine working looke although haue power potent cause assist may easily trice rob v wee aware putting man instant besides himselfe yet already hath beene said much appetite sure markemen free lordlike neuer yet taught obey acknowledge superiour easie thing hauing loue side worke whatsoeuer effect forme manner shall seeme best stand owne liking likewise thing doth naturally appeterc bonum desire good euery action wee vndergoe regard good represents selfe vnto v happinesse wee finde wee euermore desire obtaine ioyne vnto v side say side nay wee would possible earnest desire conuert incorporate owne substance hence conclusion may gathered man men may sodainly fall loue fall loue force necessitie distance time interpose selfe discourse ensue thereupon election deliberation matter vpon first veiw onely sole single primary sight may ioyntly concurre correspondencie consonancie spaine commonly vse call vna confrontacion de sangre confronting conformitie blood wherin starres particular influence wont worke doe often moue v thereunto beames doe dart themselues eye heart take infection finde especially encounter withall like vnto owne returning presently backe againe selfesame place whence sent forth draw heart doe portrait ingraue therein fayre obiect saw desired seemeth appetite noble pledge well worthy buying rate price whatsoeuer esteeming thing infinite value presently enters treaty may come inioy freely offring good greatest treasure rich hee hath liberty heart made prisoner lord himselfe admitted bosome instant bonum thing bee come beloued entertained v likewise considered man doth forthwith apply vnderstanding esteeme summum bonum chiefest happinesse desiring haue conuerted himselfe himselfe conuerted much desireth whence commeth passe selfesame effect may wrought length time getting ground vpon v continuation consideration conuersation also may occasioned instant contentment pleasure wee take good wee imagination figure fashion selues caused v regard wee know speake truer kinde language hinder course thereof make resistance also respect corruption nature debilitie reason captiuitie liberty weaknesse force dazled blinded light wee want wing flye like men hoodwinkt runne headlong owne ruine seeming decent fitting v yeeld selues presently thereunto thing naturall vnto v proper vnto man light sunne cold snow heat fire heauy thing descend ayrie ascend without giuing way vnderstanding power freewill inioying priuiledges might exercise office subiection remaines free stead making resistance wee furnish enemie weapon selues iust doth succeed reason understanding regard whereas first age whilest wee stood state innocency reason vnderstanding absolute lord like king thing vnder subiection conserue keepe peace fayre goodly fabricke man first sinne remained slaues made obedient forced become minister executioner cruell tyranny passion affection hauing got vpperhand wee furthered led along blinde depraued vnderstanding hungring thirsting owne lustfull appetite wee doe inconsiderately debase manly brest bowing ground lappe water may please palate lustfull pleasure wee flye like hooded falcon one towring vppermost region ayre another taking thickest wood ignorant future danger fearing assured mischiefe must light vpon v doe stand vpon distance time set neyther doe preuise prouide afterclaps would loue suffer doe impatient littlegreatgod delayes like effect worke vpon turnd marryed man second time well happily mine owne liking content verily perswade selfe que nunca por mi se començara el toçino del paray •… neuer haue prouerbe fallen great happinesse still haue continued happiest man world consider selfe enter imagination holy ordinance ordayned god paradise solely wholly haue sought seruice glory god augmentation church continuation mine owne specie kinde lawfull meanes succession least thought meerly intend mine owne pleasure delight beauty duty minded much lesse giue place understanding hee might aduise mee hee knew best mee indeed willing hearken good counsaile shut mine eye thing haue done good put reason away mee ill intreated truth shee told mee marrying fayre woman many care must necessarily offer themselues vnto mee feare shee become common conclusion ill aduised pursued please mine owne humour illdesiredgood blinded naturall gift bewitched grace beauty thing proper spouse without artifice dawbing hee erres thinkes thing seeme well artificiall composition borrowed beauty returne home againe supper ready prouided would goe sleepe alone themselues till houre come wiues come bed sometimes falling would stay away till broadday occasion goe forth visit neighbour word good men wiues liue cunning fashion without suffering themselues vnderstood either word deed knew well play part doe kinde kinde husband well respected wiues honoured many visites another gate fashion walke without disguise nay wiues would earnest haue abroad calling carrying along feast bankets whereunto inuited eating together one boord sleeping together one bed knew one gallant loud maintaynd hee sodainly clap within stabd twice bodie god would haue dye wound goe bodegon dinner wine tauerne market basket honourable noble disposition well agree leaue house free cōmers going themselues thousand yeares could doe handsomely wife best leasure neither selfe body else home stranger openhanded liberall hee forced carry selfe fairely towards hee well able goe thicke thinne held round pace hee beganne great hope would quickly bring v mire wee happely arriue intended iourney fell wife showing good looke two alone hee highly esteeme euery slight fauour afforded would requite kindness waight gold entred great league friendship inuited house taken leaue hee would send home many good dish meat serued well furnish owne table taking secret order seruants carried thither bring backe againe leaue though siluer offended somewhat trouble mee doe openly man blockish doth perceiue thing done à humo de pajas mooneshine prouerbe water man good lookes braue thing rich gallant shall intertaine wife great present whatsoeuer else may giue content may know end well enough contented therewithall witals doe like sayes true sayes grieues grieue would neuer giue way vnto glad thereof gaue consent wife kindly intertaine suffered goe abroad well pleased returnd see come home laden iewels new gowne delicate sweetmeat brought banquet made shame little could fall heartily eate part could dissemble much likewise doe like neither clap horne head thinke goe without themselues must assure vnderstand vnderstand mischiefe saw walke street well clad iewell hat hatband sutable vnto hidden shee would carry selfe soberly decently keeping alwayes settled composed countenance carefull life layne vpon might perceiue thing come either lookes gesture might giue least cause interpret fell talking one thing occasion offered thou seest happinesse fairenesse weather freshnesse winde thou seest fauourable fortune vnto mee smild laught vpon franke liberall towards succeeded end lesse vnhappily mee thing else vnderwent euill meanes doe thinke man escape flawes whosoeuer hee shall shall sayle ocean vpon fame rare piece beauty large licence courtier court guzmans wise giuen prince gentleman belonging court assumed liberty themselues smelt hungry sauoury sent rasher coales walke station house message sent fro howbeit verily perswaded neuer friendship strooken iust cause giuen whereat yong master might deseruedly take offence yet notwithstanding seeing himselfe thus persecuted outbraud others mightier powerfull himselfe wealth linage gallantry grew exceeding iealous therevpon ready runne wit almost vtterly lost iudgement went first straine himselfe stand competition exercising end extraordinarie liberalitie towards v presenting v gift great price amounting thousand ducat hee saw hee could contest bee able resist great force power vnconstrained without cause iust exception world saue onely owne iealousie suggest weake consideration little little fell began retire himselfe frighted thus v onely vaine shadow sometimes went considering selfe strange kinde foole heatfull humour set fire filthy lust hee eagerly follow chase hunt violence dishonesty great cost vexation minde laught also poorenesse wit iudgement one malds house come vnto crauing something good worth hee would willingly freely bestow vpon chance poore man come vnto begge halfe royall god sake would sticke deny v receiued reward wee deserued paid owne coyne master wee serued inrich v made himselfe poore ill gouernment could continue rich like ruinous building fell altogether ground first man left field fled gallant come amaine greater person priuy greatnesse truely vnderstand owne strength worth much free pretend thinke men must giue way could haue told demanded sir seruice doe condition great men owe haue throwne vpon mee whereby binde vnto good euer doe mee expect wait vpon workes word thought worst besides bad paymaster vse v harshly beare themselues proudly debt execution enter force vpon house wife lawlesse liberty vnciuill proceeding within dayes fell hand iustice graue minister state came know past amongst v fable lyon may haply haue heard lyon vpon time hauing admitted beast company hauing generall hunting killd hart came distribution sharing absolute authoritie princely prerogatiue adiudgd wholly himselfe iust minister deale mee hee might haue somewhat iudge fals loue guzmans wife better colour doe began lyonlike little roaring hee meant quarrell v knew course wherevnto hee tended presently recourse vnto complaining wrong offered vnto boasting selfe bee gentleman one anciently descended gothes hee cunning desired nothing thus come vnto gaue kinde entertainment causing sit downe side side began aske countryman told seuill said hee seuill best countrey world began treat citie indearing much vnto mee commendation haue receiued great deale honour profit thereby hee demanded mee parent called named vnto told mee beene good friend acquaintance making long discourse vnto iudge sentenced certaine sute fauour farther told mee assure himselfe mother still liuing hee well knowne yonger dayes word hee proceeded farre like kinde complement nothing wanting make full complete acknowledging himselfe neere kinsman still looke especially saw come particular hee could tell token made say selfe omnia possunt potentes cannot great men doe falne vpon theame cannot call minde certaine iudge hauing faithfully vsd iudicature exercised office great iudge giuen wanto •… nesse deale integritie time residencie expired render account custome gouernment could charge anything saue wenching little much subiect humane frailtie sharpely reprehended made answer recommended office giuen charge hee deale vprightly truly administer iustice faithfully performed man could taxe contrary would yee therefore pleased peruse letter looke vpon content commission amongst instruction shall finde vertue inioyned chastitie shall willingly submit selfe censure indure punishment yee shall pleased inflict vpon clause expresly specified commission particular mention made thereof seemeth vnto kinde men doe faile dutie doe thing contrary office though sweepe say whole street doe otherwise vndoe countrie certaine iudge hauing destowred iudge •… owrer virgias thirtie maiden amongst daughter poore woman saw wrong done shee went vnto besought since done vndone daughter hee would pleased returne home vnto end dishonour might diuulged whereupon taking royall piece foure shilling eight purse said vnto good woman know nothing concerning daughter lo eight royal take get mass said antonio padua may doe fauour recouer lost maidenhead good amends doe know may seeme bee well done doe thou tell thou canst almost wit end thinke small punishment inflicted vpon great fault commanded get home house proffering loue vnto doe many fauours hee count himselfe happy time lie power doe mee courtesie sufficient motiue vnto binde vnto seuill sonne parent well occasion hee would assist mee could afford mee best fauour faire answer got home within dayes iudge authority wife alone thought selues secure thinking thing world much lesse dreaming comming thither behold one night walked round came doore commanding one people knocke thereat vpon answer giuen askt intreating iarre water worship well knew thirst lay whereupon earnestly besought would doe honour come might sit take drinke like beggers take without doores desired nothing lookt come hee sate conserues brought sweeten mouth hauing tasted tooke iarre dranke began enter discourse telling v walked himselfe weary seene night many faire woman none came neere wife said farther heard exceedingly commended good voyce willd take violl seeing worship pleased giue hearing shee sing one song thought fit shee without coynesse straining courtesie seeming vnto v would much aduantage v get great person friend might ready stead v vpon occasion man astonished well seeing hearing take leaue willed come see make selfe stranger went way wife began talke well thing past farre forth fauour might meanes make v hereafter respected feared visit sometimes one day among rest carelesse thing might befall said vnto happens guzman whilest yet liuing men mortall may die shall bee able doe thee good done sooner thou doest make vse fauour sue vnto commission may honourable profitable vnto thee told held selfe much bound vnto euer rest thankfull expression loue fauour towards loath troublesome vnto also yet serued thing whereby deserue least kindenesse forborne moue become hostesse could liue recknings good account indure much subiection tyed short prouision first began shew dislike imperious yet base dealing also many time purpose refused see hiding selfe way vsing helpe great friend still made excuse disposed come thought haue made selfe market proued otherwise new master mine perceiued euill correspondence held thinking himselfe presence would quickly remedie bring bowle old bias presently gaue order prorogation granted vnto commanded giue account done put willingly resigning vp office tooke vpon found state therby much impawned house much waited consumed thought presence haue beene remedie giue content might better inioy thing owne liking fell farre otherwise presence expence increased wee better meanes make rise hee much troubled herewith knew world mend himselfe conceiuing himselfe nothing would worke v better rigour put v shift might come cap hand crouching vnto armes acrosse teares eye come cry mercy intreat fauour treated colleague leauing alone himselfe exceeding poore wherevpon fals old trade theeuing escape great danger oft thinke therevpon seemeth still vnto yet scarce free perill often call life remembrance neuer amendment particularly late lewd course bad estate wherein found selfe little honour mine owne credit small respect bare towards god feete walked euill step beganne wonder selfe vvas guzman discourseth wittol dissemble either much loue much griefe may proclaime himselfe cuckold world much wonder may onely vice vertue goodnesse case hee consent therevnto affoord fauour entrance doe onely take pleasure strong sure inough whereinto might safely retire selfe telling besides poore cause feare losse life rather burthen otherwise thing could best spare wherevpon willingly gaue leaue doe presently without manner yet stormes arriued last safe hauen money could negociate list selfe euery place talke man may make shift liue get wherewithall maintaine port practice long world world iudges haue hand take malefactor money giue euery man know would faine liue place trumpes would doe good renounced long agoe flush money would seeke furnish selfe afresh spent preuentionssake would make new prouision long parcell likewise set downe writing vnto end might learne without booke misse one letter lesson taught good memorie businesse import v hauing well instructed doe shee guzman craftily coozens preacher get good almes come afterwards repetition got cell certaine famous preacher good man holy reputed reuerenced men beene saint said vnto reuerend father poore stranger place come hither citie present great want necessitie desire accommodate selfe could light vpon honest house might liue peaceably quietly soules health thing desire world set wage shall stand much vpon may haue honest cloathes backe care meane whole set common though neuer poore passe ouer miserable life well content selfe therewithall without either hope desire farther profit albeit wretched estate see nothing rag much lacke decent seemely cloathes ill clad shall happely light vpon take seruice albeit could present able helpe selfe supply necessitie occasion offred vnto relieue want yet hold better suffer penurie relie vpon hopefull expectation god helping hand one time pittie distressed state poore offending diuine maiestie vsurping vpon good neighbour god forbid men purse free mee corporall labour leauing selfe guiltie condemning conscience got morning lodging seeke worke whereby might gaine bread put mouth good hap finde purse midst street tooke vp went looke perceiud money presently shut purse fearing left mine owne weaknesse might draw doe vnlawfull act shall intreat fatherhood take hand next sunday preach wil publish people may owner thereof may present others report chance heare peraduenture may haue much need haue much good may doe inioy good saue diuine maiestie may best serued honest frier heard saw heroicall disposition tooke rather saint man much honour reuerence wanting kissing garment heauenly kinde language thus spake vnto deare brother giue hearty thankes almighty god hee hath conferrd vpon cleere vnderstanding knowledge little esteeme make good world assure selfe hath communicated vnto holy spirit hath promised holy word prouide minister thing vnto diuine wisdome shall thinke fit needfull poore least little wormes small fleshlesse bloudlesse vermine ant flyes caterpillers like hurtfull creeping thing crawle vpon earth wanting careth shall much mindefull supply thing shall see stand need freeing present misery farther increasing ioyes blessing vpon action supernaturall diuine worke strike admiration men stirres vp angelicall spirit heauen sing forth thousand hymnes praise thankesgiuing noble creature borne glory god good world gift none acknowledge magnifie praise speaking good holy name perseuering vertue shall doe would haue see returne againe vnto mee day next weeke hope god shall bee able doe much good procure fauour shewne vnto good man made end holy word heart therewith thought quite pierced thorow began bleed within considering greatnesse sanctitie sinceritie contrary roguerie villanie vile wicked meanes goe make instrument theft colour businesse let fall feigned teares holy frier thought shed god sake therevpon began likewise himselfe grow somewhat tender matter rested thus till next sunday following saint day came preach spent greatest part sermon businesse mine indearing act much proceeded subiect much necessited exaggerate heighth moued compassion made willinger doe good repaired vnto almes powred forth plentifull manner munday morning mother came portaria religious house gate porter lodge belonging couent couarruuias portaria askt holy father saying speake earnest piece businesse porter perceiued desirous shee come speech went call presently brought vnto sooner saw taking hold hand habit kneeling downe offring kisse foot told purse desiring god sake might haue againe acquainted outward markes also particular remarkeable piece one well studied case wherevpon frier without adoe deliuer vnto knowing token true mother purse owne hand shee opened taking one three doblones gaue holy father bestow vpon finding also foure royal two mass bee said soules purgatorie purpose shee recommended vnto thus shee recouer purse brought presently home vnto wanting much pinshead likewise purpose wrapt piece little parcel paper might sooner seeme woman purse vse kinde fiddling fooling vvith money businesse thus ouerpast two dayes vpon wednesday towards euening went visit frier comming thither prouided mee coffer full cloathes might well outweare ten yeeres spending money besides dayes gaue mee cheerefull countenance willed mee returne againe vnto next day hee something else say vnto mee hee doubt bee much good repairing vnto time appointed aske mee whether could write informd sufficiencie kinde wherevpon told certaine gentlewoman whose husband indie much desire haue one follow businesse haue care husband estate citie country bee true faithfull thing commit charge therefore deale plainely truely tell whether could like course according answere seeke seeke settle mee hee saw stood affected giuen thankes said vnto good father appertaines personall paine sollicitude diligence fidelitie wherewith ought serue able tender vnto must tell withall countrey haue knowne acquaintance part therefore gentlewoman shall put good hand must haue disposing expect body shall bee bound truth able giue securitie likely onely rub know leaue therefore fatherly consideration done case crauing aduice therein told mee would bee surety stood vpon stoppe damme vp way wishing forgoe fayre offer accepted willingly saw meanes businesse good forwardnesse would finde legges goe well thing doth sooner deceiue iust honestminded man simulated sanctitie wicked counterfet rogue chapter vii guzman de alfarache preferrd gentlewoman seruice robs vpon theft hee apprehended condemned gallies life great force custome well roughnesse custome force thereof trouble affliction smooth water happinesse prosperitie ease miserable doth lighten loade doth sort helpe make seeme facill sufferance greater burthen light vpon haue liud well happily griefe comfort hardly take hold fortune cannot doe man harme hath inuested habit happinesse disrobe thereof disgracefully vnexpected priuation make insupportable custome vncontrouled lord prescribes proscribes lawes pleasure infirming confirming others ratifying disannulling like powerfull prince prohibits heere establisheth consequently side wherevnto leanes carry well pursuit vice practice vertue apply himselfe goodnesse easily runneth danger losing adhering euill hardly afterwards rooted force subdue hath power command ouer humane action haue called custome second nature experience teacheth v power greater nature custome ouerthrow nature little finger body hand affect sowre bitter thing artifice doth shee conserue sweeten bitter make become sweet pleasant clap close truth linke selfe league mightiest monarch fort inexpugnable make poore shepheard liue alone himselfe solitarie field depth low vallies top high mountaines amidst bush thornes wood rock opposing himselfe vnmercifulnesse cruelty sharp rigorous winter suffering terrible stormes continuall raines bitter windes piercing ayres summer parching scorching sunne doth rost sindge tree burne stone melt metal force great tameth fiercest wildest beast venemous bridling fury allaying poison time last ouercommeth custome none work vpon onely subiect comparing custome time long strong heeles another shadow followes body growing greater greater contest superioritie fire wageth warre ayre earth water element goe together eares perpetuall enmitie one another sunne generates gold giues essence life like manner time pursues prosecutes fortifies custome make marres working wisely silence according selfesame order wont continued drop hollow hardest stone custome others time owne hee discouereth thread manifesting secret fire occasion maketh essay tryall art experience hee teacheth v quilates aloy gold sheweth v end wherevnto pretension tend declard himselfe last bee one neuer tooke pitie short space made publike laboured diligence keepe hid secret hath said verified truely selfe proper termes case often treating business trading ware putting money vse framing net catch fooles raising price selling commodity farre dearer went vpon trust paid ready money carrying alway bead hand countenance composd still truely verily mouth whence neuer truth yet came openly according old custome coozen steale many doe withall time discouer roguery often many haue beene heard say promise common course tradesman sir stood cannot affoord price vow protest vnto get royall whole parcell ware haue bought may goe shut vp shop make many market haue let haue better cheape could affoord make payment money haue rate course tooke thousand thing like nature hauing vse money hand mine gaine hundred hundred often likewise prosperitie good guzman deliuers thing worthy consideration auoyded v fortune studying dayly grow greater greater onely might get selfe good opinion world meerely vaineglory loue god much dreame vpon thinke vpon thing else saue onely well thought haue people eye vpon taking charitable minded man giuer almes would gather therevpon man good conscience care soules health therefore might better trust cause great number poore morning morning come doore keeping two three houres might good notice taken seene ouer ouer past along house afterwards send away god hee knowes poore slender almes whilest nada thing nothing receiued gaine selfe good reputation like stalking horse made vse better get men good hand often haue diuided loafe bread twaine whit hungry full belly could hold remained thing lost cast away dogges part thousand piece bestow afterwards poore giue vnto knew need whose mouthes knew would spoken divulged world often hauing bloudy heart damnable intention naturally cowardly timorous feeble pardon put vp iniuries putting publike god account mine owne thought secretly condemning secret dissemble sticking say publike god thanked truly inwardly offended thing world hinder reuenge fearefull found selfe vnable put execution coales thereof aliue burne within soule whose flame much adoe suppresse often time shew selfe abstinent orderly faster thing world seeme bee one might spend lesse spare eate another man cost spend vpon another man purse swallow downe victual like cormorant wolfe belly still afraid neuer haue enough continually visit church would often goe send prison get selfe credit amongst officer minister belonged vnto doe good office prisoner gratefull worke vnto god rather end ill hap one time come thither formerly knowne might vse kindely beare better respect repaired hospital went vpon pilgrimage frequent place deuotion kissing nay gnawing altar hungry zeale would lose sermon iubilee publike deuotion step trod paine meanes got selfe great deale reputation especially amongst woman thing gypsy runne swift winde facill beleeuing nimble publishing whose mouthes praise commendation went spreading selfe abroad many time oft poore body willing vse helpe making especiall choyse one well esteemed reputed men would stand open street dish hand publikely begging almes acquainted withall hauing got pretty round summe money gaue least part kept rest selfe lickt vp creame left whey minded doe notable villanie first thing went better effecting businesse get faire goodly large iesuiticall cloake wherewith couer better dissembling would put gesture outward sanctity submission mortification good example hauing true turning vp white mine eye sober looke graue vtterance seldome spetting speake purpose broadwaking hat little band lesse paire breech kinde habit posture bore ball tript vp heeles stood way nothing else yet plainly seene therewith easily deceiued holy man good honest frier wisht well nay already done well doe harme alone greater mischiefe followed vpon necke meanes lost good opinion world say hee lost admit hee kept whole sound yet villanous instrument iust cause giuen preiudicing meane measure credit reputation honest innocent creature well placed gentlewoman verily perswaded would doe true faithfull seruice might well presume particular action made shew vnto rare singular shall say knauerie perfection well ere sure tooke mee honest man gaue word trusted much owne could lacke thing lay power pleasure good opinion conceiued willingly vpon recommendation receiud guzman entertained seruice gentlewoman seruice shee trusted wealth familie shee ordained good lodging prouided delicate soft bed necessary fitting mee shee vsed mee thing else seruant kinsman one whose sake verily beleeue god would throw many fauours vpon sometimes would intreat say auemary health good successe husband made answer demand beene oracle deale mortification made many time shead teares meanes came coozen rob worst iniure wronging house shall vnderstand gentlewoman certaine faire white slaue none wisse blacke moore handsome wellfauoured wench maidseruant long time tooke bee freeborne likewise seemed good holy creature truth one might well shake hand v neuer barrell better herring well better worse selfe let suffice tumbled together guzman lie mistress maid vpon one bed know smell one another short time growne well acquainted within dayes beene house ho could keepe chamber would neuer faine would come whether would rest seruants seemed saint looked though butter would haue melted mouth shewd selfe loose dissolute beene bred vp brothell house trained geare publike stewes yet stil carryed selfe wisdome discretion none house except selfe mistresse could come know least way suspect secret businesse betweene v besides cherish make much chest neuer without good store collation sweetmeates chamber like comfitmakers shop furnished great deale fine linnen white curd neatly folded vp neat sweet mistresse glad see tooke v saint shee likewise gaue money spend knowing whence came whose hand receiued glimpse thing would fall good tearmes wherein stood would curious search well might lose company continued also might thereby oblige vnto went intertaining faire word good hope telling time serue would seeke redeeme captiuitie afterwards make wife seasoned pot made rowze vp spirit like spaniell wait diligently vpon mee serue mee thing thought would please considering loue feigned vnto though crafty subtill wench euermore make sure account freeman shee slaue yet free thinke neither hauing wife ought knew contrary still aliue mistris knew nothing concerning owne estate wealth finger money gaue thing citie went hand likewise command stocke abroad country take gather fruit profit thereof designe make reasonable good round booty get mee gone seeke new world great minde goe indie watch opportunitie imbarke selfe howsoeuer afterwards fall mee could handsomely put blow home mistris foreseeing certaine ruine farmer tenant told paid rent shepheards sold flockes baylife vineyard conuaid wine vault sellars wont kept one pennyworth thereof come purse resolued selfe communicate matter priuate onely one gentleman neere kinsman acquainted passed ill account made intreating apply conuenient remedy hee without speaking much word thereof vnto mee going one euening cast vp reckning deuise selfe might make cleane worke mistris thinking god wot thing deuoyd care free least suspition matter weather hot selfe drowzie fell fast asleepe whilest thus taking rest thinking body harme guzman arrested carried prison alguazil come suddenly vpon mee take hold mee without telling wherefore said know hereafter better leisure hee carried mee away prison businesse thus carried neither house street bee hurry tumult stirre coyle make come know whose order apprehended committed went along sad heauy knew world thinke one deuising selfe whether commitment vertue requisitoria commission come italy whether suite creditor castile new theft lately committed citie perhaps want good carriage come light albeit euery one weight inough presse downe heart make sinke vnder many heauy burthen yet grieue rest lye racke manger wont doe together good name likewise lose credit estimation men would trust done heretofore remedie patience seeing better god bee thanked worse misfortune befell mee iust time crowne shauen thing worth speaking found either home lodging regard mother single woman liud alone selfe little little carried scrapt together kept mee afterwards broke open chest found nothing bull last yeere old ragges wherevpon came prison take account mee giuing bad one might well bee presumed one would alwayes receiue neuer pay giue beadroll doe pray vpon bead laid great sum charge could meet nothing blankes made strict inquisition finde looked heere looked could light vpon thing much one farthing custodie saw got frier gaue large account case stood like wise man neither condemne absolue till heare could say selfe hee might better iudge thereof hee heard party hee came prison visit mee talking businesse denyde stood stiffely affirming subornd false witness innocent child new borne man knew lesse thereof therefore hope god hee would helpe mee freed ioseph susanna would defend iustnesse cause would suffer vprightnesse dealing perish acknowledging withall much chastisement sinnes deserued many former offence committed diuine maiestie good religious man knew doe v hee giue credit hee much perplexed within himselfe stood doubtfull side hee leane present hee inclined part falling seeking support weakest gaue comfortable word promising best care paine defence recommending business vnto god would saw fit free mee trouble afford helping hand hee tooke leaue thence went escriuanos office abonar make good cause desiring charitiessake hee would haue especiall care looke well telling verily perswaded religious honest man one gaue mee much trust credit thinking good man thereby doe mee harme onely tell might bee better perswaded himselfe reason speake doe lawfull fauour could escriuano heard tale hee grew hartangry soule vexed villany see grace make graue person stale roguery put grosse iest vpon good man herewith incensed choller rise aboundance hee law owne hand presently beene hangd way without adoe left office charged time knew v vnderstood one another well inough camerades hayle fellow well met one another gaue content stayd amongst talking passing away time euermore eye see could safely get doore stood still watching opportunitie might conueniently doe giue slip vpon first apprehending soone come within sight fashion attourneys sollicitours like officer court iustice prison also committed presently flockt mee twenty seuerall proctor attourneys sollicitours liud sinnes people pen paper neuer went without tooke name cause imprisonment making matter nothing easie suite goe one would tell iudge good friend fauour cause brought another hee great interest publike notary third within two houres would get bailed fourth businesse toy meere trifle thing consideration world sixe royal hee would instantly vndertake free mee euery one would make himselfe master cause saying properly belong vnto accompanied come along time arrest man intertained plea preuention vnwilling crosse prouerbe first come first serud wherevpon intreated hee would call escriuano friend mine vnto another first put pen paper drawne petition mee teniente selfe laught knew well inough manner proceeding onely liue get wring man beforehand afterwards shall draw along two yoke ox hang arse one hauing power warrant free thiefe ashamed aske money make interrogatory condemned gallies thus striuing imployd businesse come mee rushing violently thorow midst bold confident fellow thought rule rost carry away one beene proctor heretofore criminall cause said vnto mee sir heere told yes question might haue saud saw sure inough askt cause imprisonment told hee replyde tush laugh merry sir take care toy trifle warrant sir wee take order therefore let neuer trouble haue money sir may carry escriuano poast presently petition teniente may put surety answere matter meane time haue libertie follow businesse shall refuse grant prouision case haue writ remoue bring matter open hall assist counsell shall presently giue order release shall speake one singular good lord dare pawne word shall tarry heere aboue halfe day others heard said ha whats winde doore heere pretty kinde forme framing petition withall heart course meane take wee haue beene twenty v vpward two long houres better taking paine businesse take hand shall hindermost dogge beare away hare must follow suite proctor therevpon made answere master beene writing labouring businesse two moneths yet withstanding vpon comming vnto man must goe thorow gentleman good friend dispatch business therefore god name ye may gone let clyent alone heard say replyde vnto sweet seemely manner negociating faire flourish hee make washt hand hee shaue v fashion carry away cause cleanely may gone sir please gentleman knowes reason intertaine cause hath minde therefore need many word conclusion one said said end differrd long grew last hot angry one another began rip vp others fault tell without body help spot practice lay open view staine life discouer person well prisoner others heat ouerpast quiet came old proctor intreating doe fitting would see well contented paine gaue foure royal begin withall fingred could see friend fifteene dayes knew well enough meant doe errand vnto lick something though neuer little better secure seething pot next day following haue wherewithall goe marketplace driuen perforce make choyce stood feare wel acquainted old cause haue refused shewd least vnkindenes haue taken stitch therevpon mee hee would haue discouered pot rose throwne open cloake couered knaueries would two houres haue heapt vpon hundred seuerall
